1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
"May, Dawn! When did you get here?"

Haxorus looked up and saw Ash running up to welcome his former traveling companions. The two girls looked about Ash's age, and had clothes that were fashionable, yet suited for travel. May also took the time to greet Pikachu and Misty while Dawn immediately went over to hug Delia.

"You still haven't evolved your Misty?" May asked.

"I don't want to evolve!" Misty said. "Everyone always says Linneas are more suited to traveling, especially on land, but I prefer staying in this form! I even had Ash promise to never teach me Teatime so I can avoid evolving."

"Besides, Misty's been a good friend for all this time," Ash said, drawing Misty in a hug. "I couldn't bear to evolve her now."

"Okay, okay! I was just curious," May said, trying to calm Misty down. "No need to get testy."

"You still look as beautiful as ever, Delia!" Dawn said.

"Thank you, Dawn. How is your dream coming along?"

"Great! I learned a great deal about being a Pokémon Stylist," Dawn said, catching Haxorus' ear. Dawn then pulled out a sketchbook and showed off her designs. "See? I used all the times Ash and I have been together as inspiration for the new costumes I plan on making. I'm even hoping to catch a Valerie to help me make these clothes!"

"These look impressive," Delia said.

"Oh, hey, you need to meet my new friends, Iris, Georgia and Cilan," Ash said as he proceeded to lead May and Dawn over to where Haxorus and Iris were sitting. Noticing she still had time to use the remote discretely, Haxorus decided to...

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content: Haxorus felt a little guilty about making the only family Ash had a Pokémon, so she decided to give him a new family, with May and Dawn as his sisters. She didn't have time to consider their own family relationships, so after she pressed the button to make Ash, May and Dawn a family, she learned of everyone's new relationships.
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: Haxorus puts Ash, Dawn, and May in the same fam...

choices: Use the remote to make them best friends.
Use the remote so Ash, Dawn, and May only have one mother.
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Haxorus watched Ash and his friends and thought, I mean, it's not that bad that I turned Ash's mother into a Pokemon if he still thinks of her as a mom, but I should at least give him a human family as a kind of thanks. Now, I don't want to be in their family. I DON'T want to be in their family. Haxorus aimed the remote at the group and pressed the family button.

Haxorus put the remote away before Ash could turn around. She concentrated, but didn't remember any of the three Trainers as part of her family. Haxorus breathed a sigh of relief. It's good to know the remote can do that. Huh. Haxorus noticed that May and Dawn seemed a little tense next to each other. That's strange. Is this a human thing I don't know about?

Ash led his friends to the table, "Everyone, this is Georgia. Georgia, these are my half-sisters, May and Dawn."

"It's good to meet you," Haxorus replied. She extended her hand to shake.

May shook Haxorus's hand, "It's nice to meet you too."

Dawn tapped her chin, "You know, you seem familiar..."

Haxorus quickly said, "Shh! Don't tell anyone please!"

Dawn smiled and replied, "No need to worry. Your secret's safe with me."

"Secret?" Wondered May.

"I'll tell you later," Ash replied.

"Um, did you say half-sisters, Ash?" Haxorus asked.

Ash nodded and explained, "Let's see... Norman is our dad. He was with my mom first, but it didn't work out, so I went with him when he met Dawn's mom. They were married for a little bit, but that didn't work, so Dawn stayed with her mom and I went with Norman when he met May's mom, and they've been together ever since."

Haxorus saw May and Dawn staring daggers at each other. Ohh....

"It's fine. Things happen. As long as he and Caroline are happy," Dawn said, gritting her teeth.

"Like Dawn says, things happen. Norman's been a great dad," May replied, a little annoyingly.

"Yeah, which is why he can't even remember Ash's mom..." Dawn sniped.

Ash sweated nervously, trying to escape the situation, "Uh! Hey! Georgia, where's Iris?"

"Hmm? Ohh!" Haxorus gave them directions to the room Iris was in, then said, "You can go now if you want. I-uh, I just need to do something here."

May and Dawn looked confused, but Ash just said, "Uh, okay. Let's go." He led May and Dawn towards the room Iris was in.

Haxorus frowned and thought to herself, This isn't good. I think I made May and Dawn not like each other. How can I fix this?
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: May's father, Norman, married both Caroline...

choices: Ash, May, or Dawn describe more of their lives with Caroline, Delia, and Johanna
Check in with Lillie or Gladeon, who have their own Domestic Pokemon.
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
As Haxorus considered the question, she noticed Dawn's sketchbook. Huh. Did she leave this because she was arguing with May? She skimmed through it, then found something - a photo taped to one of the first pages of the sketchbook. It was of Dawn and Johanna, Dawn's mother. Haxorus read a note, presumably written by Johanna. To my budding Pokemon Coordinator and Stylist, I hope this sketchbook can store all your inspirations. Love, your mother.

Haxorus thought, If I make her a Human Pokemon, then there's just going to be one mom. Will that make things simpler? Okay, let's make her a mom Pokemon, like Delia. She aimed the remote at the picture and pushed the button. The picture changed to one of Norman and Dawn. Hmm... Caroline's not in this picture... Does that mean she's still not Dawn's mom? I'll probably need to fix it with them. I should go now. Haxorus took the sketchbook with her and went back into the room Iris was in. Seeing the backs of Ash, Dawn, and May, and hearing May squee, Haxorus pointed her remote at them, thinking, I want Ash, Dawn, and May to have the same mom and dad. before she pushed the button.

Haxorus got a sense of what May was squeeing about, and slammed the door behind her on instinct.

The door slam got everyone's attention. Thankfully, Haxorus was now the one with her back to the group so they couldn't see the remote.

"Gee Georgia, where have you been?" Asked Iris.

"Oh, you know, hiding magazines. And Dawn left her sketchbook at the table. Dawn, is it okay if I leave it next to our bags?"

"Huh? Sure, I guess," Answered Dawn.

"I still can't believe you know the daughters of Diantha and Lusamine, Ash!" Said May with excitement. "Why didn't you tell us sooner?!"

Haxorus used May's declaration and question as a distraction, heading towards the bags. She found two very fancy bags hadn't been there before, and "remembered" which one was her bag. She smiled as she slipped the remote into what was now her bag. Having a Mom and Mama like them is great, Haxorus thought to herself.

Ash explained, "Ah, well, they wanted to keep it a secret, so I did. Sorry about that."

Dawn shook her head, "No need to worry." We get some of that in Petalburg City, so we understand."

"Ah yeah, I remember Ash telling me about his father being the Petalburg City Gym Leader. That's really cool," Said Iris.

"Thanks!" Said May. "I mean, Dad's not a Champion, and Mom's not a super-successful businesswoman, but they really love us and we really love them."

Dawn agreed, saying, "Yeah, we wouldn't have anyone else for family."

Ash smiled, adding in, "Yeah, they're a great Mom and Dad. Hey, that reminds me. How's your Johanna, sis?"

"She's doing great!" Dawn pulled out a Poke Ball and opened it. A bluenette Human Pokemon came out, wearing a beautiful light-green dress with a large yellow-green bow, along with gloves, choker, heart hairclip, and crown ( https://archives.bulbagarden.net/media/u... ).

Ash's Delia moved forward to embrace her fellow Human Pokemon, "Johanna! How have you been?"

Dawn's Johanna embraced Ash's Delia and answered, "I've been great. How have you been with Ash?"

Ash answered, "She's been a great Pokemon, and she's taken great care of me. How has your Johanna been?"

Dawn beamed as she replied, "She's been great, and she's taken really good care of me and May. Right now I'm trying to train her for Pokemon Contests."

"Oh, I know you'll do a great job," Said Ash's Delia.

Haxorus pulled out her Pokedex. Johanna, the Domestic Pokemon. Normal-type. Kind, and loving, Johanna is easily trained to cook, clean, and care for others, especially children. Many Trainers catch Johanna to take care of themselves or their family. Although very similar in temperament and capabilities to Delia, the two have been found to be separate species of Pokemon. She nodded and thought to herself, Good job, remote. "Wow, so you had a Delia and a Johanna growing up?" Haxorus asked.

May nodded and said, "Yeah. Mom is mom, but with Delia and Johanna it's almost like we had three moms. Before we were born Mom learned that she was going to have triplets, so Dad caught a Delia in Pallet Town and a Johanna in Twinleaf Town to help raise us."

Haxorus blinked. "Triplets?"

Dawn nodded and explained, "Me, Ash, and May are fraternal triplets.That means we were all born at the same time, but we're not identical."

Haxorus nodded, "That makes sense."
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: Use the remote so Ash, Dawn, and May only have ...

choices: Wicke arrives to talk about traveling arrangements with the kids
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Lillie sat in her room as she looked at all the clothes in her closet. "I can't decide what to pack!" She then turned and asked, "What do you think, Johanna?"

A Johanna, dressed in a white dress that went to her ankles, merely smiled as she said, "I think you'd look beautiful no matter what you wore, Mistress."

"Johanna, I told you not to call me that!" Lillie said, slightly frustrated. "I know Mama caught you to look after us while she was busy, but Iris, Georgia and I all agree that calling us anything but our names doesn't sound right."

"I'm sorry, Lillie; old habits die hard," the Johanna explained as she approached the worrying girl and wrapped her in a hug. "I hope I didn't upset you over that."

"No, it's fine."

"You know, I'm surprised you tolerate us so much," Lusamine's Melony said as she began hauling the packed bags out of the room. "Is it just because we look human that you can stand being around us and not other Pokémon?"

Lillie blushed as she said, "Ye...yeah, I guess. But I'm hoping to change that!" She then pointed over to her nightstand, showing off the egg sitting there. "I was entrusted with a Pokémon's egg a while back by Professor Kukui, so I'm hoping that by caring for it from its birth, I can get used to being around Pokémon that don't look as human as you two."

"Well, you can start by looking after the Pokémon in the sanctuary if you're that determined," Gladion said as he walked in from the hallway, a Delia in a similar dress to Johanna following behind him.

"Baby steps!" Lillie hastily said. "I'm not ready for that!!"

"Whatever," Gladion sighed. "You packed yet?"

"I'm still deciding what clothes to take. I don't want Iris, Georgia and Mom to think I've been slacking in the fashion department. You should do the same."

"Why should I? I'm comfortable like this."

"Lillie does have a point, Gladion," the Delia told the boy. "This is the first time you've seen your sisters and other mother in over a year, correct? You may as well be at least presentable."

Gladion scoffed, but said, "I'll think about it, but I'm really interested in knowing what traveling through Unova's done for their battling skills."

"Always on about battling," Lillie said, a little saddened by the statement. "I don't think I could ever put any Pokémon in danger like that."
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: Check in with Lillie or Gladeon, who have their...

choices: Gladion and Lillie tell their Human Pokemon what to wear.
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Gladion, Lillie, are you there?

Gladion and Lillie both looked at each other, then sighed. Aether Foundation's Head Researcher Wicke had an Aurea for each of Lusamine's children, and had trained each of them to be able to transmit a telepathic conversation between Lusamine, Diantha, or Wicke and that child, even over long distances. The telepathic message they had each received had thus come from a different Aurea, allowing for a three-party telepathic conversation.

Yes, we're here, Gladion and Lillie both thought in reply.

With that response, Wicke continued her telepathic conversation, thinking, Good. Your mother Lusamine has acquired plane tickets for Pallet Town. There are enough tickets to seat your mother Lusamine, yourselves, and the Human Pokemon coming with the three of you. Your mother Lusamine suggested making sure your Human Pokemon are all clothed so that there is no confusion that they are to be passengers on the plane. Please let me know if there are any questions.

Thanks for letting us know, Thought Lillie. I don't have any questions.

Yeah, alright. I'm good too. Thought Gladio.

That's good to hear. I'll check in in a little bit to see how you're doing. Thought Wicke in response.

Gladion and Lillie sighed as they felt the twinge of the holographic conversation being ended. "Well, you heard Wicke. We need to make sure we and our Human Pokemon are well-dressed for this trip."

Gladion corrected her, replying, "She only mentioned our Human Pokemon. I think I'll just take these clothes. Anything fancy would just get dirty in battle."

Lillie sighed as she said, "Very well. But we warned you."

Gladion just shrugged.
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: Wicke arrives to talk about traveling arrangeme...

choices: Meanwhile, Haxorus goes to make more Human Pokémon
Meanwhile, Diantha gets a call from Lusamine about the Pallet Town visit
Meanwhile, Dawn and May reveal they each have a Valerie
Meanwhile, Team Rocket attacks Haxorus and her group
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
"It'll be so fun to catch up with Iris and Georgia," Lusamine's Olivia commented. She then rubbed her bracelets and said, "How strong of trainers do you think they've become?"

'I wouldn't know," Lusamine said with a smile. "They've been surprisingly secretive. All the same, I hope they like the gifts I caught for them."

"You went out of your way to capture a wild Valerie for Georgia and a wild Elesa for Iris, Why wouldn't they love them?" Melony asked.

Noticing a slight pause before Melony said Iris' name, Olivia asked, "Still finding it hard to support her dream?"

"Of becoming a type specialist? No, I'll support that 100%. I just don't like how she'll reject any Ice or Fairy-type Pokémon."

"Speaking of, Melony, I'm sorry, but you'll have to wear clothes for the plane ride," Lusamine said.

With a defeated sigh, Melony said, "I'd rather be in my Poké Ball for this, but if I have to be seated, at least let me wear something I'll feel comfortable in."

"Don't worry, I've got the perfect outfit for you," Lusamine responded as she handed Melony a set of clothes. Reluctantly, Melony grabbed the clothes and started dressing. She now stood before her trainer wearing a tank top that left her midriff exposed, a pair of sweatpants, sneakers and wristbands. "What do you think?" Lusamine asked.

With a smile, Melony said, "I'll admit, it feels more comfortable than that dress you had me wear that one time. Thanks, Lusamine."

"Anything for my Pokémon, just like I'll do anything for my precious children," Lusamine said as she stared at a photo of her, her lovely wife Diantha, and their children Iris, Georgia, Lillie and Gladion. "I can't wait for the six of us to be reunited again."

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Ash's Delia asked her trainer, "Ash, have you decided on a snack yet?"

Ash replied, "Oh wow. I forgot all about it."

"You forgot?" His two sisters asked in surprise.

Ash nodded and said, "Well, I was just really happy to see you, but now I hope Cilan gets here soon."

"I still have these berries I collected," Iris said. "We could have some while we wait."

"Oh yeah! That's a great idea!" Said Ash. He turned to his sisters, "Hey, May, Dawn, want to try the berries Iris found?"

"Sure," Said May. "I'd love a little snack."

"Little snack?" Teased Dawn. "Well, me and my Pokemon could use a little snack ourselves. Will there be enough for everyone?"

Iris nodded, "Yeah, I got a lot of berries. There should be enough for everyone."

"Do you need them prepared in any way?" Ash's Delia asked.

"Thanks, but these berries are fresh. We just need to wash our hands and we'll be fine," Iris answered. She turned to her sister, "Georgia, would you and your Pokemon like some berries?"

Haxorus shook her head and replied, "No thank you. I'm not hungry, and I want my first meal with my new Human Pokemon to be nice and big. Just save some for us and I'll let you know when Cilan is here."

Iris nodded, "No problem."

Haxorus smiled, "Thanks, sis." She went back to her new bag to get her remote and Pokedex, then got another flash of memory. Digging a little deeper, she pulled out another device before returning to the lobby of the Pokemon Center.

In the lobby, Haxorus looked at the three devices she had with her. One was the remote. The second was her Pokedex. The third was an expensive internet-compatible smartphone. With this I can look up all sorts of people online, Haxorus realized. Thanks Mom and Mama. Okay. Now what kind of Human Pokemon I want to make?

Let's see... Mom and Mama are probably going to get here by plane, so let me look up Flying-Type Trainers... of course! Her! So... like a pilot... but maybe a one of those... the ones with the cart?... too? That should work. With the picture on screen ( https://cdn.bulbagarden.net/upload/8/80/... ), Haxorus pointed her remote at the picture, then pressed the button. Successful, she switched to her Pokedex. Skyla, the Sky Companion Pokemon. Flying-type. Skyla flies using the propeller on her head. Known for their graceful mid-air movements, Skylas can be trained to pilot any aircraft and act as an airplane stewardess. Once native to Unova, Skylas have traveled the skies and now can be found worldwide.

Okay. Next... a ninja! Ninjas are cool! With a little searching, Haxorus quickly found a Ninja Gym Leader. ( https://cdn.bulbagarden.net/upload/3/31/... ) One remote use later, Haxorus was checking her Pokedex. Janine. The Ninja Pokemon. Dark and Poison-types. Janine is known for her agility and her natural aptitude in the Ninja arts. Janines are known to attack from unexpected angles, using the poison they can secrete to weaken their opponents. Janines are most commonly spotted in the Kanto region, but may be hiding in other areas.

Haxorus smiled at her creativity. Alright. Now one more. Hmm... Haxorus imagined her mothers arriving, no doubt bringing a lot of luggage with them. If only there was someone who could help them... Maybe someone who is strong enough and could carry their luggage? Them? Carry them and their luggage? Without getting hurt, of course. Haxorus took some time, scanning the internet for Pokemon that were ridden and the people who rode them. She decided on a famous Rhyhorn rider. ( https://cdn.bulbagarden.net/upload/2/28/... ) At this point, the remote and the Pokedex cane quickly. Grace. The Riding Pokemon. Ground-type. Grace is light enough to ride other Pokemon, but strong enough to carry many times her weight on her back without hurting herself. Grace is easily trained to race while riding Pokemon, or to run on all fours herself on any type of terrain at a high rate of speed without dropping her cargo or passengers. Graces are mostly found in the Kalos region.

Alright. That's three new Human Pokemon and four types taken care of, Haxorus thought to herself with pride.

Even if they are, they look really nice. I bet she has more neat clothes. Most noticeable was the fact that she was riding a naked Grace that had reins around her face and a bit between her teeth. The Grace let go of the bit.

"Good girl!" Said the Pokemon Trainer as she returned her Grace to her Pokeball and walked up towards the counter.

Haxorus could only watch and think, That girl looks really nice, especially with that neat outfit and all that hair. She took a head to the short head of hair that Georgia had, and looked down at Georgia's clothes which looked less interesting in comparison.

Haxorus gave the matter some consideration. Well, the easy way to be a better Georgia is to be a better someone else, right? I just need to switch lives with someone awesome. But if I do that, whoever I switch with will be in my new family. I don't want that. She sighed heavily as she pointed the remote at her family's picture. I'm sorry, everyone. I promise to be back really soon, but I need to leave the family for a little bit. Haxorus pushed the relationship button, and saw that she was no longer in the family photo.

Haxorus quietly walked back to the lobby. Her memories of her new family were gone, although she still remembered being Iris's best friend. I need to switch lives quickly before Iris and the others finish eating their berries. Fortunately, having gone through the magazines, she knew who to go to and quickly found two good choices.

The first was Princess Allie ( https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/... ). Princess Allie was the Princess of Parfum Palace. Haxorus didn't know how she was a princess, but the article made it clear that she was incredibly rich.

The second was Princess Sara ( https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/... ). Princess Sara was the Princess of the Mirage Kingdom in Hoenn.

Hmm. Should I switch with one of these two, or someone else? Haxorus thought to herself.

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Haxorus pushed the button, and immediately the magazine disappeared from her hands. Huh? What- Haxorus looked around, realizing that she was looking up at the top of a fancy bed, a bed bigger and softer than anything she had ever known, and yet not as surprising a softness as it should have been.

Haxorus concentrated, and a name entered her mind. Princess Allie. That's my new name. Awesome! She looked towards the window. Wow. Here it's so early the sun isn't even out. Haxorus squeed to herself, as she sat up. She could still feel her soft honey-blond hair, and she wore pajamas probably like one Serena would have worn. Alright. I kept this beautiful body. Now to get back to my family. She looked around and found two Poke Balls next to a nightstand. Haxorus crawled over to it, putting the remote in the nightstand before she opened one of the Poke Balls.

A Delia dressed as a maid popped out. She yawned, then bowed and asked, “Good morning, Princess Allie, what is your wish at such an early hour?"

Haxorus answered, "I want a picture of Diantha, Lusamine, Iris, Lillie, or Gladion."

Haxorus's Delia blinked and replied, "Very well, I shall retrieve the portrait from the gallery immediately."

"Thank you," Said Haxorus.

It was only a few minutes before Haxorus's Delia came in, carrying a framed postcard depicting Diantha, Lusamine, and their children at a beach in Kalos. "Is this what you wanted, Princess Allie?"

Haxorus nodded and said, "Thank you. Please put it on the nightstand. You may return to your Poke Ball."

Haxorus's Delia bowed and said, "As you wish," before doing as her Princess commanded.

As soon as her Delia was back in the Poke Ball, Haxorus got out the remote and aimed it at the postcard. Time to be the daughter of Diantha and Lusamine, and sister to Iris, Lillie, and Gladion again. With one press of a button, Haxorus was back in the family. The new Princess of Parfum Palace whooped, "I did it! It all worked out-"

Haxorus froze as she realized, I need to get to Pallet Town as soon as possible so I can be with my family. But as Princess Allie my servants- She paused, realizing that all her servants were Human Pokemon of one species or another. -are sure to help get me there!

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Iris looked away and twiddled her fingers nervously, "As long as you keep your snobbiness to a minimum, I guess I won't mind."

Haxorus blinked and thought to herself, Snobby? As if I shouldn't be so proud to be so rich and so beautiful with my grand pink dress and lovely hair- Haxorus frowned and slapped her cheeks No! Just because Princess Allie was snobby doesn't mean I have to be!

"Uh... are you okay?" Asked May.

"Yeah, yeah. I'm fine. T-Thanks for asking, pe-pleasantly. Thanks for asking so pleasantly," Haxorus replied. She bowed. "I'm Princess Allie."

May and Dawn blinked. "Princess? They asked together"

Haxorus nodded, "Yeah."

Ash turned to Iris, "Wait, so are you a princess too? You never told me that..."

"It's complicated," Iris said. "I'm not really into all that princess stuff..."

"Hey, where's Cilan?" Haxorus asked. "I mean, you told me about him," She quickly said.

Iris blinked and replied, "Wow. You actually listened when I mentioned him?"

"Of course I listened," Haxorus answered, briefly "remembering" Princess Allie being bored to tears when Iris was calling her about the friends she had made.

"He's ordering breakfast for us while we wait for your parents." May squeed, "I can't wait to meet them!"

"I can't wait for them to meet you too," Haxorus replied for a smile, but her smile faded when she saw Iris's confused face.

"Um. We should go back to the airport to wait for them," Dawn offered.

"Yeah, sure," Haxorus replied.

~~

While the others were seated and waiting near the arrival gates, Haxorus and Iris were off to the side, with Haxorus's Delia next to them.

Haxorus said, "Um... Sis, I know I've been snobby in the past..." Haxorus paused as she flashed back to several memories of Princess Allie being snobby and stuck up, flaunting the family wealth from Perfum Palace. She shuddered before she continued, "But I'm a different person now, I promise. I want to be with the family more, and I want to travel the world with you, Iris."

"Really?" Iris asked.

"Really," Haxorus promised. She extended her arms and asked, "Hug?"

Iris looked like she was going to tear up as she bounded into her sister's arms. As the two embraced, Iris said softly, "I've never been happier to be your sister. Even when you were stuck up, I always wanted deep down for us to be more than sisters, I wanted us to be... to be..."

"Best friends?" Haxorus asked.

"Yeah." Iris separated from her sister and wiped her nose. "Sorry, I've gotten your dress wet."

"Don't worry about it," Haxorus replied. "Now let's go back with the others and wait for the rest of the family, okay?"

Iris nodded happily, "Okay."

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Haxorus and Iris began walking to the others. Cilan met them a bag in hand, and said "Iris, I have your- oh! Is this the Princess Allie you've mentioned?" He bowed and said, "A pleasure to meet you, Princess Allie. I am Cilan, Striaton Gym Leader. I'm sorry, but if I had known you'd be arriving I'd have gotten you a meal as well."

Like you know what I'd want to- Haxorus took a deep breath, then replied, "Do not worry, Cilan. I'll... wait for the rest of the family to get here. I'm not hungry right now."

Cilan nodded and said, "As you wish."

"Mom! Dad!"

Haxorus, Iris, and Cilan turned towards the voice, which was Ash Ketchum's. The three of them finished walking towards the others, finding Ash, Dawn, and May next to a man, a woman, and a small boy respectively.

"This is your family, right Ash?" Iris asked.

Ash nodded, "This is our father. Norman, the Gym Leader of Petalburg City."

"And this is our mom," Said Dawn

The woman smiled and said, "My name is Caroline. It's nice to meet you all."

May tousled the little boy's hair and said, "And this is our little brother Max. You still helping out at the Gym, Max?"

Max beamed and said, "Yeah! But I still can't wait until I'm a Pokemon Trainer."

"Nice to meet you, I'm Iris."

"Pokemon Connoisseur Cilan. It's a pleasure to meet you."

"Princess Allie of Parfume Palace," Said Haxorus. "I'm also happy to meet you."

Max blinked. "Wait a minute," He said. He took a big breath and continued, "I've read about you two! Your parents-"

"Shh!" Said Iris. She blushed and explained, "Not here please! You'll attract a crowd. If you're quiet, I'm sure they'd be happy to meet you."

"Really?! Thank you!" Max responded.

Haxorus was smiling on the outside, but frowning on the inside as she thought, Why are we hiding from our adoring public? Our family is famous and wealthy, and our mothers successful and renowned. We should be proud to- Wait, is this that snobbiness Iris was talking about? Wow. I didn't think like this when I was Georgia. This girl must have had a really snobby life. But I know about it, so I can be okay and not upset Iris. Even if it is true, I don't have to be snobby about it, right?
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: Haxorus sees Norman, Caroline and Max arrive to...

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
"You've changed quite a bit, Allie."

Turning around, Haxorus stood face to face with Diantha, the woman she had made her and Iris' first mother. She wore a trench coat and wide-brimmed hat that obscured most of her features to most people.

"Mom? When did you get here?" Haxorus asked, making sure to keep her voice down.

"Just a few minutes ago. I just happened to see you talking with Norman and his family. Are you making friends?"

"I'm trying..." Haxorus said, bottling up the urge to bring out her new snobby persona.

"Well, that's all that matters. Anyway, your Mama said she'll be her with Lillie and Gladion in about an hour. Why don't we catch up with Iris and the rest while we wait?"

"Of course, Mom," Haxorus said as she followed Diantha back to the group.
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: Diantha arrives first.

choices: Wanting to help Lillie, Haxorus makes more Human Pokemon.
Bitter, Lillie uses her remote on Gladion.
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
With her Human Pokemon behind her, all wearing the common clothes she had mentioned earlier, Diantha approached Norman and his family, "A pleasure to meet you," She said, moving her glasses slightly to reveal her eyes.

Norman smiled and shook her hand, "An honor to meet you as well."

Diantha nodded, noticing the young boy among the family trying desperately to contain his excitement, with her sisters and brother next to him. "Ah." She quietly pulled out four photos and asked, "Who should I make these out to?"

"Max, please," Max replied, voice squeaking.

"May."

"Dawn."

"Ash."

"Are you preparing to become a Pokemon Trainer, Max?" Diantha asked.

Max nodded with excitement.

"Of course." Diantha signed the photo, To my fan, Max. Best of luck on your journey as a Pokemon Trainer. She then passed it to Max.

Max took the photo and quietly said, "Thank you." He stood there quietly, staring at the autograph.

After signing three more photos and giving them to Max's siblings, Diantha turned to Iris, "Iris dearest, would you like some hot chocolate?"

Iris nodded and replied, "That would be nice, mom."

Haxorus frowned. Why didn't she ask- oh. In her bags were expensive hot chocolate mix made with powdered chocolate, freshly imported Moomoo Milk, pure spring water, and really fancy marshmallows. There was even a portable stove in her belongings. I see. Princess Allie usually just has her Human Pokemon make hot chocolate for her. Still, if mother doesn't ask, she's free to purchase her own- Haxorus closed her eyes and puckered her eyes.

"Is something wrong, Allie?" Diantha asked with concern.

Haxorus took a deep breath and answered, "No. I'm fine. If I can find a place to purchase a gas canister, I would be glad to share-" Haxorus paused, as if the word was unfamiliar to her, "-what I have so everyone can have hot chocolate."

"Really? You'd share?" Asked Iris.

"Y-yes. Of course," Replied Haxorus.

Diantha smiled with pride, "You truly have matured, and your offer means the world to me, daughter. Unfortunately I don't think they'd allow us to bring drinks from outside, but I'd be honored if you'd share with us later."

Haxorus fought off the instinct to demand to speak to someone to have an exception made. Instead, she smiled back and promised, "Sure!"

Diantha passed her Human Pokemon Delia and Joy some money and gave the three of them their orders, saying, "Jenny, please stay with us and watch our bags, Delia, Joy, please get us some hot chocolate."

"Right away, Trainer!" Said all three in unison, before Delia and Joy walked away to get the hot chocolate.

~~

Haxorus waited, listening to the others talk as she nursed her hot chocolate. Mine is better, but... it's just nice sharing this with the family, She decided. She didn't have much to say about her own life as Princess Allie, as all she had to share were her days in Parfum Palace, days of indolence that all seemed to blend into each other. Still, Haxorus couldn't help but smile as her sister Iris spoke with pride about her journey as a Pokemon Trainer and how well her Pokemon were doing. Haxorus remembered that life she had left not so long ago, and silently promised to herself that she would use that to keep her grounded.

"Hi everyone!"

The group looked towards the sound of the voice. It was Lusamine, her children, and their Human Pokemon.

Iris and Haxorus walked fast to meet them, everyone else just behind them. Iris embraced her mother, "Mama, I've missed you."

Haxorus bowed politely, "It's good to see you again, mama."

Lusamine smiled and said, "It's a pleasure to see both of you again."

Lillie said, "Wow little sister, you really got up on the right side of the bed today. You're acting as big as you look."

Little? How old is Allie supposed to be? Haxorus wondered for a moment before remembering and realizing that even though she had that blonde girl's body, Princess Allie was a few years younger than her siblings. Oh.

Gladion sniffed at them, "Will wonders never cease. It's nice to see the both of you too," He said with the tone of someone whose mind was on something else.

Hazorus tried not to frown, but deep down she got flashes of memory of Princess Allie not getting on well with Gladion as of late, as her soft-glove lifestyle began to clash with his broody travelling. It seemed to be connected with a fear that Lillie had gained of Pokemon that weren't Human Pokemon, a fear that made Haxorus sympathize with her sister. "Thank you," She replied.

Diantha approached her wife Lusamine. Haxorus saw them laugh as they embraced and kissed, but she was too lost in thought to properly hear what they were saying.

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
"Why don't we find call some cabs to Professor Oak's Laboratory before we're spotted?" Diantha suggested to Lusamine.

Lusamine giggled and said, "My Dearest Diantha, It's already been handled. I called ahead for the largest van that I could find to take us so we could have more room. I wasn't expecting to need that room, but it should be enough for all of us."

Diantha smiled and said, "Ah, the same foresight that has elevated Aether Foundation to the heights of success." She kissed her. "Every day I'm reminded of why I married you."

A man approached the group, and Lusamine asked him, "Are you our driver, Johnathan?"

The man nodded and replied, "I am."

"We're your group," Said Lusamine. "Shall we go to Professor Oak's Laboratory?"

"Whenever you're ready," The man replied.

~~

Both families took their seats in the van. Haxorus took deep breaths as took a seat in her gown. She knew how, but... Having to travel in this crowded peasant carriage is... fine. Just fine.

"So where is your assistant, Kathi Lee?" Lusamine asked.

Diantha smiled and answered, "I decided to have her charter a personal flight straight to Professor Oak's Laboratory. She's arranging everything for our arrival as we speak."

Lusamine beamed with pride and said, "And there's the brilliant improvisation that made you the most brilliant star in Kalos and the best wife a woman could have."

Norman and Caroline laughed. "You two are so sweet together," Caroline remarked.

"Well, we don't have a lot of time to spend together like this, so we make the best of it we can," Lusamine explained.

I wonder if the remote also had something to do with it, Thought Haxorus.

"May, Dawn, how have you been doing on your Pokemon Contests?" Ash Asked.

"Oh, I got runner-up in the Johto Grand Festival" May answered.

"I got runner-up in the Hoenn Grand Festival," Said Dawn. "How have you done, Ash?"

"I got Top 8 in the Vertress Conference," Ash admitted. He shrugged and said, "It happens. I hope I can do better next time."

"I'm sure you can!" Said May.

Dawn added, "No need to worry, Ash! As long as you're doing you're best we're all proud of you."

Gladion scoffed, "Right."

"What's that mean?" Ash asked.

"We'll see how good you are at Professor Oak's Laboratory," Gladion replied.

Ash smiled fiercely, "Yeah! Just you wait!"

"Pika!" Said Pikachu.

Diantha and Lusamine laughed at the two competitive Pokemon Trainers.

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
May turned to Haxorus and asked, "So Princess Allie, I have to ask. What's it really like to live in a palace?"

Haxorus blinked, and replied with confusion, "I... kind of said everything in the airport while waiting for my mother and sisters."

May replied, "What? No way! You told us about how the Delias and the Johannas took care of you and how everything was really nice, but you didn't really say what you did."

Haxorus explained, "But that really is it. Sometimes I walked my Furfrou, sometimes I was out in the gardens, or at the fountain, but I'm the princess of Parfum Palace. And of course there's buying new dresses and having fun with my hair. I don't really have to do anything."

"Really?" May asked. "You don't go on exciting adventures or anything?"

"Well, from now on I'm going to be having adventures with my best friend sis, Iris!" Exclaimed Haxorus.

"Really? That'd be great!" Said Iris. "I can't wait to show you how to be a Pokemon Trainer!"

"But, don't you have important responsibilities to tend to?" Asked Dawn. "I knew a princess. Her name was Princess Salvia, and she worked very hard, meeting a lot of rulers and attending important parties to foster goodwill."

"That... sounds like a lot of work," Replied Haxorus. "I never had to do that."

Diantha admitted, "The 'Princess of Parfum Palace' is a ceremonial term these days, a holdover from when the Palace housed an important branch of the royal family. It's where I grew up in my first few years of life."

"But mother, you've become Kalos Champion since then," Said Gladion. He turned to his sister Haxorus and snarked, "You think you can do that well, little sister?"

Haxorus fumed, "Well, maybe I could if I wanted to."

Lusamine frowned, "Gladion, don't be rude to your little sister."

Gladion frowned back and replied, "She's gotten spoiled growing up there."

Haxorus frowned. Now that I think about it, I do remember spending most of my time at Parfum Palace growing up. When I was in Georgia's life, I was traveling too. But- but there's nothing wrong with it! Parfum Palace is my home! He shouldn't be so rude!

Diantha answered, "Gladion, she's no different than you or your sister Lillie. The two of you spend much of your time at Aether Foundation, after all."

"I've been Pokemon Training, and Lillie is at the Pokemon School," Said Gladion.

"Well, I did tell her to go..." Noted Lusamine.

"It was my idea mom!" Protested Lillie.

Diantha took a deep breath and said, "Everyone, please. This is time for us to spend together as a family. Let's all come together, and maybe we can all decide how to do that from here. There's no better time for us to figure things out than now when we're all here. And maybe we'll feel better after we've eaten properly."

The other members of the family sat there, a little unhappy but saying nothing. The other passengers sat there awkwardly.

Diantha smiled as she said, "As a matter of fact, I did! And I'm sure Mama has some for Allie and Iris, as well."

"You know me so well, dearest!" Lusamine said with a blush. "However, my gifts are better left for when we're not in a bus."

"Mine will probably have to wait for a more spacious venue as well, my love" Diantha said with a nervous chuckle.

"Oh, you," Lusamine playfully teased as the two women giggled.

"A gift? How futile! I could get anything I wanted with the snap of my...no! No! This is a gift from Mama; I must graciously accept it!" Haxorus thought as she tried to gather her thoughts. She then looked over to Iris and said, "By the way, Sister, you're looking beautiful in that dress."

Iris blushed as she pulled at her dress (formerly Caitlin's) and said, "It's not really my style, though. I only put this on because where I'm traveling next, there won't be as many forested or out-of-the-way areas for me to explore, not like Unova was."

"It must be nice, being able to venture out without the fear of...well, you know..." Lillie said as she hung her head.

"Hey, don't be like that, Lillie," Iris said as she placed a hand on Lillie's. "I'm sure you just need a little time around a...a baby Pokémon. Then, as you raise it, it'll be easier to be around other Pokémon."

"I'm trying. I recently got an egg from Professor Kukui," Lillie said, showing off the egg to her sisters. "Once it hatches, I'm hoping I can bond with it and help erase my fears."

"That is a great first step!" Haxorus said with a flourish as she opened her fan. "Then I'm sure you'll have no trouble playing with all the Pokémon I have in Parfum Palace...as well as anyplace else you might encounter them."

Lillie smiled and said, "Thanks, you two. And Allie, it's nice to see you're trying to be less snobby."

"I'm proud of you as well, Allie," Lusamine said. "I was a little skeptical at first when Diantha told me she wanted you to live in Parfum Palace, but it seems your time away from the rest of the family has taught you some humility."

Diantha nodded as she said, "Absence does make the heart grow fonder, as they say."

The vehicle Diantha and Lusamine had rented came to a stop. The driver announced, "We're all here, everyone. Thanks for riding."

"Our pleasure. Thank you for the smooth ride," Said Lusamine, leaving the driver a decent tip.

"Thank you, ma'am! I hope you and your family have a pleasant day!" Said the driver before driving off.

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: The bus arrives at Ash and Delia's old house

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
"Seriously? Why'd we stop here?" Gladion asked, clearly annoyed at the location. Unlike him, though, Haxorus was intrigued.

Before her was a modestly-sized store that advertised clothing and supplies for use exclusively for Human Pokémon. The sign above the door had the smiling faces of a Delia, Elesa and Melony, which Haxorus took as a sign that the store had something for every kind of Pokémon. A poster on the front door even displayed the fact that the owner of the store had clothes made on-site by a team of Valeries.

"This was the closest place the bus' route could go on the way to Professor Oak's laboratory," Diantha explained. "Even with my connections, I can only get us so far."

"Do you think I could go in?" Lillie asked. "I've never actually set foot in one of these stores before."

"And I think I might need some new costumes for my Pokémon," Dawn said, with an enthusiastic nod from May.

"You don't have to be against this place, you know," Iris scolded her new brother. "Stop acting like a kid for once."

Haxorus quietly snickered at Iris' use of "kid" to describe Gladion as he said, "Well, there's not much in there for anyone other than coordinators."

"Speak for yourself," Ash said as he looked at the store. "Delia couldn't make the delicious meals she makes without the fresh ingredients found here, mostly grown by Amalas. Plus, there are some neat training tools that I take full advantage of. If you'd like, I can guide you around the place."

"Well, looks like we have a dilemma," Norman said as he and Caroline joined the group. "What do you think, Lusamine? Is there time to take a quick look around?"

"We're still a couple of hours out from when we need to be at Professor Oak's lab, so I wouldn't mind, but I'm sure it'd be a bit of a shock for dear Allie in particular, since like Lillie, I'm not sure she's set foot in one."

"So what if I haven't?" Haxorus defensively said, fanning herself in frustration. "I haven't needed to go to one of these shops because all my Human Pokémon's clothes were given to me!" Realizing her tone of voice, Haxorus then calmed herself enough to say, "Still, if I'm going to be traveling with Iris on her next journey, I should get to know what this store is like."

"Looks like it's settled," Diantha said as she walked in front of the group. "The lab is about a half-hour walk from here, so we'll have an hour and a half to look around. Let's go in, everyone!"

Haxorus excitedly walked into the store with her and Ash's families and was blown away by what she saw.
1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.title: A large specialty store, selling clothing and o...

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Even though the store was modestly sized, it was one of the largest Haxorus had ever seen. The map just past the entrance showed that the store was more of a mall and had a layout very much like a Pokeball, with a middle corridor going through it and stores on both sides forming two parts of a separated ring. There was one large clothing store and several other stores that all seemed to be themed around one or more Pokemon.

Lusamine announced to her children, "Okay everyone. Remember. An hour and a half."

"Yeah, alright, I'm going outside, maybe see if I can find a place to train my Pokemon," Said Gladion.

Diantha frowned, "Gladion, please. We've all just come together. You should stay with us."

"I'll keep him company," Haxorus offered, a little mischievously.

"If that's what you want," Haxorus' mother Diantha replied. "Gladion, be nice to your little sister."

Little sister? Wondered Haxorus before realizing that she was living Allie's life, and Allie was the youngest of this family by a few years, even though the girl's body was probably their age,

"Yeah, alright. Come on," Gladion offered his hand for Haxorus to hold.

Haxorus held Gladion's hand, and he led her out of the mall.

Lusamine shook her head and sighed, saying, "I don't know what gets into him sometimes."

Diantha replied, "He's probably just in a rebellious phase. I'm sure he'll grow out of it, dear,"

Their two remaining daughters looked towards Gladion and Haxorus. I hope so, They both thought.

~~

As Gladion led Haxorus out of the mall, Haxorus fumed. What's his problem? Well, whatever it is, I know how to fix it. While Gladion was looking ahead, Haxorus pulled out her remote and aimed it at Gladion. She pushed a button and the remote...

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
Haxorus pushed a button, and suddenly Gladion was several inches smaller, now tugging on Haxorus' hand instead of just gently leading it. Haxorus, on the other hand, was unchanged. I see, Haxorus realized. I'm as old as Gladion was, and he's as old as Allie was. But my body was already supposed to be this old, so only he changed. Haxorus memorized what button she had just pressed, then looked at her now younger brother as a few more years of a pampered life took settled into her memories. Serves him right.

Once they were completely outside of the store, Gladion let go, whipping around and asking Haxorus, "Ugh! Why are you still here, Allie?!"

"Hmph! What is your problem?" Haxorus asked right back. "You should be with us."

"You're the problem!" Gladion shot back. "Big sis Lillie is terrified of regular Pokemon and everyone's too busy to care! Both Mamas work, Iris is traveling, and you're stuck-up in that stuck-up Parfum Palace! I can't wait until I'm a Pokemon Trainer. If no one else wants to make Lillie better, I will!"

Haxorus frowned, "Have you talked to anyone about this?"

"Why bother?" Gladion asked."I'm just a kid, no one will listen to me except to say 'Don't worry about it. She just needs some time.' Give me a break."

Haxorus stood there, her concern for Lillie conflicting with her offense that this little kid would say those things to her. Don't be a snob, don't be a snob. But if he doesn't want to be with us...

The phone rang, and an old voice Haxorus faintly recognized spoke out, "Master Gladion, how may-"

Make Gladion the butler's son, Thought Haxorus, pushing the button to forge a relationship.

And just like that, Gladion was gone, back at Aether Foundation with the butler Hobbes who was now his father.

And Haxorus was alone outside the store. Haxorus let out a deep breath. It had to be done. He was so insufferable. He'll be happier this way, She thought to herself. And now I can focus on my wonderful mothers and sisters.

1151222111211121222223312211111512331121.content:
"I wonder what kind of Pokémon they became," Haxorus wondered as she looked up the new Human Pokémon in her PokéDex.

"Olivia, the Guardian Pokémon. Rock-type. Olivia are more capable of communicating with Pokémon of different species than others, particularly aggressive Pokémon, though they are mostly known for caring for smaller, defenseless Pokémon. They are known for crafting intricately-made trinkets out of rocks to symbolize their connection to others, but are known to be clumsy while walking in unfamiliar terrain. They are mainly found in the Alola region."

"Melony, the Stern Coach Pokémon. Ice-type. A Melony’s body can withstand the harshest winter weather, making it a valuable Pokémon for hikers and villagers high in the mountains when foraging for food or seeking shelter. Other Pokémon seek out Melonys to test their skill, which Melonys will help refine if they manage to defeat them. Melonys with this kind of relationship with other Pokémon treat them like their children and can be very doting and protective. They are mainly found in the Galar region."

"Misty, the Mermaid Pokémon. Water-type. Mistys live in any kind of water and are known for their aggressive outbursts when disturbed. They are most friendly to children and baby Pokémon who come close, and will sing and play with them to make them happy. Despite usually accepting any Pokémon or humans near their territories, they have an unusual hatred for Bug-type Pokémon. They are mainly found in the Kanto region, but can be found all over the world."

"Elesa, the Model Pokémon. Electric-type. Elesa usually have a playful attitude and strike poses to get any Pokémon or human to cheer for them. While in Altering Forme, they use the cords attached to their ears to absorb electricity from any surface touched, even static electricity. While in Direct Forme, they continually discharge electricity from the antennae on their ears until they are drained of energy. They are mainly found in the Unova region."

"So Elesa has two forms?" Haxorus thought as she looked at the two Elesas in the magazine. Apparently, the yellow-haired Elesa was the Altering Forme, with long black cables over the headphones covering her ears now part of her body. Meanwhile the black-haired Elesa was the Direct Forme, with horns on her headphones now serving as part of her body.

Before Haxorus could ponder any more about this new reality...

1151222111211121222223312311.content:
Haxorus blinked. The motorcycle Officer Jenny had been riding was now gone, as if it had never existed. Officer Jenny was now standing near the group, and she was now completely naked.

“Hey, I think that’s a wild Jenny!” said Ash.

“That means we can catch it!” said Iris.

A member of the group quickly pulled out an empty Pokéball and threw it at the wild Jenny. The Pokéball hit the wild Jenny and opened, emitting a red beam of light that pulled her into the Pokéball. The Pokéball fell to the ground, where it rocked back and forth once… twice… three times… then dinged, signalling that the wild Jenny had been successfully caught.

Who caught the wild Jenny?
