11512221112111212222233123111.content:
Haxorus walked up to the Pokéball and picked it up, then raised it above his head triumphantly.

“Yes! I caught a Jenny!” he said.

“Alright! Great job, Georgia!” said Iris.

“Aw, thanks,” said Haxorus, blushing.

I can’t believe I caught a Pokémon on my first try! he thought. That was so fun. No wonder there are so many Pokemon Trainers out there.

Haxorus held the Pokéball out, and sent his new Jenny back out.

“Jenny?” Jenny asked, looking at Haxorus.

“Hi, Jenny,” Haxorus said. “I’m Georgia, a Pokémon Trainer. Do you want to come with me on my journey?”

“Jen, Jenny!” said Jenny, with a big smile on her face as she nodded enthusiastically.

“Alright!” said Haxorus. “Welcome to the team.”

“Ny!” said Jenny.

Haxorus reached into one of his pockets, and pulled out his Pokédex. He opened the Pokédex and scanned Jenny, updating his Pokédex.

“Jenny, the Justice Pokemon,” said Haxorus’ Pokédex. “Due to their innate sense of justice and morality, they despise criminals. As a result, they are often used by police forces around the world. Jennies are also very protective of their family and friends, and will fight rampaging Pokemon to protect them. Jenny is a Fighting-type Pokemon, native to the Kanto region. However, unique forms of Jenny have been found that are native to the Unova, Kalos and Alola regions.”

“Wow,” said Ash. “Jennies are so cool!”

I can’t believe it, thought Haxorus. The remote turned her into a type of Pokémon! That’s so cool!
11512221112111212222233123111.title: Haxorus.

115122211121112122222331231111.content:
Haxorus followed behind Ash, Iris and Cilan on their way to the Pokémon Center in town, but most of his attention was focused on Jenny. Mere minutes ago, she was a police officer, but now she had become a Pokémon, stripped of all human identity, and she didn't seem to care in the slightest. She simply walked alongside Haxorus, happily humming to herself despite having no clothes on. Haxorus also managed to spot a couple more Jennys out in the wild, and they seemed to get along well with the other Pokémon in the area.

Eventually, the group arrived at the Pokémon Center and Haxorus saw Nurse Joy standing behind the counter with Chansey, an ever-present smile on her face. "Good afternoon; how may I help you?"

"We just want a quick heal-up of our Pokémon, please," Ash said, setting his PokéBalls on a tray, which Pikachu also hopped on. Cilan and Iris started to do the same as Haxorus told Jenny, "You're just gonna get a quick check-up, okay? I'll see you soon."

"Jen, Jenny!"Jenny happily exclaimed as Haxorus put her back in the PokéBall and set her, Beartic, Bisharp and Vanilluxe on their own tray.

As Joy tended to the Pokémon, Ash said, "I'm going to call Mom and let her know we're just a day away from home."

"I believe I'll go shopping; I'm not sure I packed enough food to keep us fed for the rest of the trip," Cilan said as he took his leave.

"I think I'll look for some berries to give my Pokémon. What're you going to do, Georgia?" Iris asked.

"I'll stay here for a while. I've got some thinking to do."

"Okay; see you later, then!" Iris said as she walked out the door.

Haxorus now sat in the waiting room of the Pokémon Center staring at the remote in his hands. "This thing is so powerful. It made me evolve into a Haxorus, made me switch lives with Georgia without her realizing anything was wrong, made Georgia and I switch bodies, and even made Officer Jenny her own species of Pokémon! I wonder what else it can do."

Seeing all the posters, magazines and people around the waiting room, Haxorus decided to use the remote several times. When it was all over, Haxorus observed the results, trying to contain his excitement.
115122211121112122222331231111.title: The group continues to the Pokémon Centre

choices: Haxorus and her Jenny claim victory.
Beck and his Jenny win the battle.
The battle is interrupted by Team Rocket!
115122211121112122222331231112.content:
“Hey, you guys!” a voice called out, and Haxorus turned to see a young boy wearing a yellow shirt and matching blue shorts, shoes and cap, walking up towards them and waving to get their attention.

“Which one of you just caught that wild Jenny?” the boy asked.

“Um, I did,” said Haxorus, holding up a hand.

“Great!” said the boy, taking out a Pokéball. “I just caught a Jenny of my own, and I want to put her to the test. I challenge your Jenny to a battle against mine!”

“Okay, you’re on!” said Haxorus. “You ready, Jenny?”

“Jen!” said Jenny, nodding.

“Yes!” said the boy, throwing his Pokéball into the air. “Jenny, I choose you!”

The boy’s Pokéball opened, sending out a burst of white light that formed into a Jenny.

“Jenny!” said the boy’s Jenny, looking at Haxorus and his Jenny.

“Ny!” said Haxorus’ Jenny, stepping in front of Haxorus and getting ready to battle.

“Hey!” said Haxorus. “I forgot to ask what your name was.”

“Oh! Sorry,” said the boy. “I was so excited, I forgot to introduce myself. My name’s Beck. What’s your name?”

“I’m Georgia,” said Haxorus. “Nice to meet you.”

“Yeah!” said Beck.

“This will be a one on one battle,” said Cilan, taking up a position between the two Jennies to act as a referee. “Are both trainers and their Pokémon ready?”

“Yeah!” said Haxorus.

“You bet!” said Beck.

“Jen, Jenny!” said the two Jennies.

“Very well,” said Cilan, raising a hand. “Battle begin!”

Who wins the Pokémon battle?
115122211121112122222331231112.title: A trainer appears to challenge Haxorus' Jenny!

choices: The group makes it to the Pokémon Centre.
1151222111211121222223312311121.content:
“Okay, Jenny, use Low Kick!” said Beck.

“Jenny!” said his Jenny. His Jenny ducked down, and kicked with her right foot, aiming for Haxorus’ Jenny’s legs. The blow connected with her shin, and Haxorus’ Jenny staggered back a few steps, but didn’t fall over.

Oh no! thought Haxorus. I don’t know what moves Jenny can use!

“Uh, Jenny, you use Low Kick too!”

“Jen!” said Haxorus’ Jenny. She lashed out with her right foot as well, kicking at the legs of Beck’s Jenny.

“Ny!” Haxorus’ Jenny yelled as she swung her foot, and swept the legs out from under Beck’s Jenny, causing her to fall over.

“Great job, Jenny!” said Haxorus. “Now attack again!”

“Jenny!” said Haxorus’ Jenny. Her hand started to glow white, and she brought her hand down on Beck’s Jenny in an open-handed Karate Chop.

“Ah! Jenny, look out!” said Beck.

“Ny!” said Beck’s Jenny as she rolled to the side, causing Haxorus’ Jenny to hit the ground instead. Beck’s Jenny jumped up to her feet, and faced Haxorus’ Jenny.

“Use Leer!” Beck ordered.

“Jen!” said Beck’s Jenny, and her eyes began to glow red as she glared angrily at Haxorus’ Jenny. A red outline briefly appeared around Haxorus’ Jenny, and she shuddered fearfully.

“Don’t let her get you down, Jenny!” said Haxorus. “Stop her from doing that!”

“Jen,” said Haxorus’ Jenny, nodding. Her own eyes began to glow blue, and Beck’s Jenny glowed blue as well, causing her red eyes to disappear instantly.

“Huh?” said Beck. “Jenny, use Leer again!”

“Jenny!” said Beck’s Jenny, and she glared at Haxorus’ Jenny. However, her eyes did not start glowing red.

“Yeah! You used Disable!” said Haxorus. “Good work, Jenny!”

“Jenny!” said Haxorus’ Jenny, smiling.

“Now, finish this with Karate Chop!”

“Jenny!” said Haxorus’ Jenny, as her hand started glowing white.

“Jenny, use Karate Chop too!”

“Jen!” said Beck’s Jenny. Her hand also started to glow white, and the two Jennies charged at each other, striking their opponents with the side of their open hands. Their momentum carried them past each other, and the two Jennies stood still, waiting for the other to move. Haxorus’ Jenny winced, and staggered a step forward. Beck’s Jenny smiled, but her happy look soon disappeared as she started swaying dizzily, then fell over face first into the dirt.

“Beck’s Jenny is unable to battle!” said Cilan, raising his hand. “Georgia’s Haxorus wins!”

“Woohoo!” said Haxorus, jumping up and down excitedly. “Yeah, great job, Jenny!”

“Jen, Jenny!” said Jenny happily, flashing her trainer a V sign.

“Aw, man,” said Beck. “Jenny, return.”

Beck held out a Pokéball, and a red beam of light shot out and pulled his Jenny back into her Pokéball.

“You did great, Jenny,” Beck said to the Pokéball. “Get some rest.”

Beck put his Pokéball back into his pocket, then walked up to Haxorus and her Georgia.

“Hey, thanks for the battle,” said Beck, holding out his hand.

“Yeah, you too,” said Haxorus, taking Beck’s hand and shaking it. “Are you and your Jenny gonna be okay?”

“Yeah, I’ll be fine,” said Beck. “I’ve still got my Squirtle, Pidgey and Rattata ready to go. Congrats on the win.”

“Thanks,” said Haxorus, blushing. “You take care, okay?”

“Right back at ya!” said Beck, smiling. “See you around!”

Beck turned, and continued on his way to Viridian City.

“How are you feeling, Jenny?” Haxorus asked, turning to his Pokémon.

“Jenny,” Jenny said, giving a thumbs up. However, Haxorus could see some bruises on her legs and shoulder, and she was swaying slightly.

“Come on,” said Ash. “We should get to the Pokémon Centre.”

“Right,” said Haxorus. “I’m going to put you back in your Pokéball, now, okay?”

“Jenny,” she said, nodding.

Haxorus took out a Pokéball and returned Jenny, then followed Ash, Iris and Cilan towards the Pokémon Centre.
1151222111211121222223312311121.title: Haxorus and her Jenny claim victory.

11512221112111212222233123111212.content:
Ash, Iris, Cilan and Haxorus spent the next half an hour walking along the dirt road towards the Pokémon Centre. As they walked, Haxorus couldn’t help but marvel at the powers of the remote he had, which was now sitting in his pocket.

It had been only yesterday that he’d been an Axew, but the remote had caused him to evolve all the way into Haxorus. Not only that, but he’d then swapped lives and bodies with Iris’ rival Georgia, and nobody, not even Georgia herself, was aware of the changes. Haxorus looked over at Iris, and saw Georgia happily walking along, as if she had always been Haxorus. Not only that, but the remote had made Iris and Haxorus best friends, getting rid of the rivalry that had existed between Iris and Georgia before Haxorus took her life and body.

And just a few moments ago, Haxorus had used the remote to turn a human into a species of Pokémon. Earlier that day, the Officer Jenny from Viridian City had been a police officer, but now her life had been changed completely, stripped of everything that had once made her human, and she was now caught in a Pokéball, sitting in Haxorus’ pocket. Not only that, but it seemed that every Officer Jenny in the world had become a Pokémon as well, and other trainers had caught Jennies and used them in battle, as Haxorus had seen in his battle with Beck. In fact, there seemed to be more Jennies than before, as Haxorus had seen a few wild more Jennies, mingling with the other wild Pokémon in the area.

Haxorus felt a slight twinge of guilt. Was it really okay for him to use the remote to change things so drastically? He’d basically stolen Georgia’s body and life, and completely rewritten Officer Jenny’s entire existence, without a care for how they might feel about all this. Maybe he should try and return things back to the way they used to be...
11512221112111212222233123111212.title: Something happens along the way...

choices: Haxorus tries to find a Reset button.
Haxorus tries manually undoing the changes.
Actually, Haxorus decides not to try and fix things...
Someone sees Haxorus take out the remote...
115122211121112122222331231112121.content:
Haxorus sighed softly as his guilt started becoming stronger. This wasn’t right. It was one thing to make himself evolve from Axew to Haxorus, or to make Iris and Georgia best friends. It was another thing entirely to steal someone’s body and life, or to strip someone of their identity and humanity... which was exactly what he’d done. Georgia had no idea that she used to be a human, and neither did Officer Jenny. In fact, every single member of Officer Jenny’s family had been transformed into a new species of Pokémon. Thousands of people had everything that made them who they were stripped away, replaced with an entirely new identity that wasn’t theirs.

That kind of power... it was too much. Haxorus was worried that he might get too carried away, and become corrupted by the ability to essentially change reality whenever he felt like it. With his mind set, Haxorus reached into his pocket for the remote. He had to find a way to undo at least some of these changes. Maybe there was a button that could undo the latest change, or possibly even reset everything back to the way it was before Haxorus had found the remote. If he couldn’t do that, then maybe he could manually undo the changes he’d made...
115122211121112122222331231112121.title: Try to reverse the changes.

choices: Use the remote on Nurse Joy.
Use the remote on someone else.
115122211121112122222331231112122.content:
Haxorus shook his head. As far as anyone else was concerned, it was completely normal for Officer Jenny to be a Pokémon species, rather than a human family, and Georgia seemed to be quite happy, blissfully unaware she was living Haxorus’ life in his old body. Haxorus’ feelings of guilt quickly faded, and a few minutes later, Ash, Iris, Cilan and Haxorus arrived at the Pokémon Centre.

The four of them walked through the doors, and saw Nurse Joy standing behind the counter. Like Officer Jenny, the Nurse Joy of the Kanto region looked completely different from the Nurse Joys Haxorus was used to seeing in Unova, and she had a Chansey by her side, rather than an Audino.

“Hello, and welcome to the Pokémon Centre,” said Nurse Joy, smiling at them. “How can I help you today?”

“We just want to get our Pokémon patched up,” said Ash.

“Of course,” said Nurse Joy, placing four trays, each with six slots, on the counter. Ash began putting his Pokéballs on the tray, and Pikachu jumped off his shoulder and onto the tray. Iris and Cilan took out their Pokéballs and filled their trays, and Haxorus did the same, placing the Pokéballs containing Beartic, Bisharp, Vanilluxe and Jenny on his tray.

“I’ll take your Pokemon now,” said Nurse Joy. “They should be fully healed in a few minutes.”

“Thanks, Nurse Joy,” said Ash.

As Nurse Joy took their Pokemon to be healed, Ash turned to the others.

“I’m going to call Mom and let her know I’ll be home tomorrow,” said Ash.

“In that case, I’ll go shopping,” said Cilan. “I want to make sure we’ve got enough food to last us for the rest of our journey.”

“I think I’ll go look for some wild Berries, then,” said Iris. “You can use those to make food for our Pokémon.”

“Thank you, Iris,” said Cilan. “What about you, Georgia?”

“I think I’ll wait here for our Pokémon,” said Georgia.

“Alright, then,” said Iris, as she walked towards the door. “I’ll see you guys in a few minutes.”

Ash nodded, and walked over to the video phones, while Cilan walked the other way. Haxorus headed towards the waiting area and took a seat. As he sat down, he looked at his reflection in the polished surface of the counter, and saw a human girl with rose hair and blue eyes looking back. Even though he’d gotten used to moving around and using a human body, he still wasn’t used to seeing Georgia’s face instead of his own.

A few minutes later, Nurse Joy arrived, carrying the trays of Pokéballs she had been given.

“You and your friends’ Pokémon have been restored to full health,” said Nurse Joy as she placed the trays on the table Haxorus was sitting at.

“Thanks,” Haxorus said.

Nurse Joy curtsied. “My pleasure. We hope to see you again soon.”

As Nurse Joy began to walk away, Haxorus’ hand strayed towards his pocket, where the remote was. Maybe he could use the remote on Nurse Joy, or on one of the other trainers in the Pokémon Centre...
115122211121112122222331231112122.title: Leave things as they are.

choices: Nurse Joy is now a species of Pokémon.
Nurse Joy was fused with her Chansey.
Something else happened to Nurse Joy...
1151222111211121222223312311121221.content: While her back was turned, Haxorus pulled out the remote and pointed it at Nurse Joy. He pressed a button, waiting to see what the remote did.
1151222111211121222223312311121221.title: Use the remote on Nurse Joy.

choices: Cilan and Iris arrive with lunch.
Haxorus gets the urge to use the remote again.
11512221112111212222233123111212211.content:
Haxorus smiled as he lowered the remote. Nurse Joy was now naked, and her hair was now hanging loose behind her back. There was a new person standing at the counter, a man with black hair who was wearing a surgical uniform, including a surgical mask with a coloured cross on it. If Haxorus had to guess, this man had taken Nurse Joy’s place, now that she was a Pokémon species.

“Good work, Joy,” said the doctor. “You had those Pokémon healed up in record time.”

“Joy!” said Joy proudly as she took her place behind the counter, standing to the doctor’s left while Nurse Joy’s Chansey, which was presumably now the doctor’s Chansey, stood on the doctor’s right.

Haxorus took out his Pokédex, and quickly scanned the new Pokémon he had created.

“Joy, the Healing Pokémon,” said his Pokédex. “Due to their kind and friendly nature, as well as their dislike for seeing Pokémon in distress, Joys are often used in Pokémon Centres around the world. Their kind nature also leads them to adopting young Pokémon that have been orphaned in the wild, raising them as if they were the Joy’s own children. Joy is a Fairy-type Pokémon, native to the Kanto region. However, unique forms of Joy have been found that are native to the Unova, Kalos and Alola regions.”

Haxorus smiled, and put his Pokédex away as Ash walked up to the table.

“Pika Pi!” said Pikachu as he leapt off the table onto Ash’s shoulder.

“Hey, buddy,” said Ash. “It’s not like I was gone that long.”

“So, how’d it go?” Haxorus asked.

“She said she’d be happy to meet some of my friends,” said Ash. “She’ll be home all day tomorrow, so as soon as we get to Pallet Town, we can head straight home.”

“Pika, Pikachu!” said Pikachu excitedly.

“That’s great,” said Haxorus. “So, where are Iris and Cilan?”

“Cilan’s making lunch in the kitchen, and Iris just walked over there with an armful of Berries,” said Ash. “I don’t think he’s gonna need any more help.”

“Right,” said Haxorus.
11512221112111212222233123111212211.title: Nurse Joy is now a species of Pokémon.

choices: The group finishes lunch and continues to Pallet Town.
115122211121112122222331231112122111.content:
Haxorus briefly felt the urge to use the remote again, but decided against it. He figured it might be better to limit how much he used the remote, at least for now. Besides, he didn’t want Ash and Pikachu to see the remote and ask questions, so he quickly put the remote back into his pocket.

As Haxorus pocketed the remote, he saw Ash picking up his Pokéballs and returning them to his belt. Haxorus picked up Jenny’s Pokéball and opened it, sending her out in a flash of white light.

“Jen?” she asked.

“We haven’t really had much of a chance to get to know each other,” said Haxorus. “I’m going to let you out of your Pokeball for a while, okay?”

“Jenny,” said Jenny, nodding. Haxorus moved over a little, and allowed Jenny to sit next to her. Jenny sat down, and looked around curiously.

“Jen?” she asked.

“We’re in a Pokémon Centre,” said Ash. “Doctor Jules takes a trainer’s Pokémon and patches them up with the help of his Joy and his Chansey.”

“I don’t think they use Chansey and Joy everywhere,” said Haxorus.

“Well, they don’t always have a Chansey, but every Pokémon Centre I’ve visited has had a Joy,” said Ash.

“Yeah, I’m used to seeing Audino working in Pokémon Centres,” Haxorus said.

Ash nodded. “Right, in different regions, there are different Pokémon working at the Pokémon Centre,” he said. “They also usually use the local form of Joy, which is why the Joys in Kanto, Johto, Hoenn and Sinnoh look different to the Joys of Unova.”

“That makes sense,” said Haxorus. He was slightly surprised by how much Ash knew about Joy, considering she’d only been a Pokémon for a few minutes. Then again, considering how nobody was aware that either Jenny or Joy were supposed to be humans, he guessed that what Ash was saying about Joy was probably common knowledge.

“It’s the same with Jennies, right?” said Haxorus.

“Jenny?” asked Jenny.

“Yeah, the Jennies we saw in Unova looked different from you,” said Ash to Haxorus’ Jenny. “They had much shorter hair, and I think their skin was a slightly different colour. Here, I’ll show you.”

Ash reached into his pocket and pulled out his Pokédex. After a few quick taps, he held it out so Haxorus and his Jenny could see it. On the left side of the screen was a picture of the Kanto Jenny, which looked identical to Haxorus’ Jenny. On the right side of the screen was a picture of the Unova Jenny that Haxorus was familiar with, and like Ash had said, she had much shorter hair than the Kanto Jenny, though it was still the same colour. The Unova Jenny also had a slightly different shape to her face, and was also slightly taller than the Kanto Jenny.

“Jenny,” said Haxorus’ Jenny, looking at the image in fascination.

Ash took his Pokédex back and put it back in his pocket. As Ash put his Pokédex away, Haxorus looked up, and saw Cilan, Iris and Georgia walking up to the table carrying several plates of food.

“Lunch is served,” said Cilan as he started putting the plates on the table. “Enjoy.”

“Jenny,” said Jenny, her eyes wide as she stared at the plate full of Pokémon food that Cilan placed in front of her.

“Go ahead, Jenny,” said Haxorus. “All that food on your plate is yours.”

“Jenny!” said Jenny happily. She began scooping up handfuls of food and shovelling it into her mouth.

Iris sat down next to Haxorus with her plate, and Cilan took a seat next to Ash. Pikachu sat on the table next to Ash with his plate, while Georgia, who was too big to fit on one of the chairs, stood at the end of the table.
115122211121112122222331231112122111.title: Cilan and Iris arrive with lunch.

choices: The remote works, Sabrina is now a species of Pokémon.
Nothing happens, the remote doesn't work on pictures.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112.content:
About halfway through his lunch, Haxorus realised that he needed to relieve himself.

“Excuse me,” he said as he stood up. “I have to go to the bathroom.”

“Okay,” said Iris. “Just don’t take too long, or I’ll eat all your food.”

Haxorus giggled, then made his way over to the bathrooms. To his surprise, he was able to use the facilities without any trouble, despite never using them before, especially not as a female.

The remote must’ve given me the skills I need to live Georgia’s life, thought Haxorus as he washed his hands. That makes sense, since it also gave me her memories.

As he left the bathroom, Haxorus saw a poster on the wall. It showed a young woman with dark green-black hair and pink eyes. The woman was wearing a pink tank top that showed her midriff, white pants held up by a black belt. She was also wearing pink shoes and black metal bracelets with glowing green lights.

“Sabrina, the Mistress of Psychic Pokémon, awaits you at the Saffron City Gym!” Haxorus said quietly, reading the poster out loud. He hadn’t been able to read human languages when he’d been a Pokémon, but now that he had a human life, he could read it easily.

Haxorus was overcome with curiosity. He knew that the remote worked on real people, but would it work on images of those people? Haxorus decided to test that out, and pulled the remote out of his pocket. He pointed the remote at the poster, and decided to press the button that had turned Jenny and Joy into Pokémon. He quite enjoyed seeing how the world adapted to the appearance of these new Pokémon, and he figured it would be the easiest way to see if the remote actually worked on images of people, or if he needed to use the remote on real people.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112.title: Something happened during lunch...

choices: The group makes it to Pallet Town.
11512221112111212222233123111212211121.content:
After pressing the button, the image on the poster changed. There was now an older man with a beard in Sabrina’s place. Sabrina was still on the poster, but she was now standing behind the older man, and she was now completely naked. Haxorus took out his Pokédex and scanned the image of Sabrina. It took longer for the Pokédex to register the image of Sabrina, but it did eventually bring up her Pokédex entry.

“Sabrina, the Magic Pokémon,” said Haxorus’ Pokédex. “Sabrinas train daily to enhance their psychic abilities, and wild Sabrinas can trap people in life-like illusions if they are interrupted during their training. Despite this, they can only unlock their full potential by working with an exceptionally patient Pokémon Trainer, as their cold and distant nature makes them slow to trust. Once they have perfected their psychic abilities, Sabrinas gain the ability to see into the future. Sabrinas are a Psychic-type Pokémon, native to the Kanto region.”

So the remote does work on pictures of people, not just real people, thought Haxorus. That’s good to know.

Haxorus put the remote and his Pokédex back into his pockets, then made his way back over to the others.

“Hey,” Haxorus said as she sat back down to finish her meal. “What’d I miss?”

“Oh, not much,” said Iris. “Cilan and I were just discussing what we were gonna do when we go to Johto.”

“So, what did you decide?” Haxorus asked.

“Well, I’m going to Blackthorn City,” said Iris. “I wanna challenge Clair to a battle, and see what I can learn about Dragon-type Pokémon from the Dragon Tamers there.”

“And I’ll be heading to Olivine City,” said Cilan. “Mister Briney is hosting the Old Rod Fishing Rally this year, and I was planning to attend.”

“What about you, Georgia?” asked Ash. “What are you gonna do?”

“Well, I was planning to travel around Kanto, doing the Gym Challenge,” Haxorus said, as his Jenny listened intently. “After I get all eight Badges, I’m going to the Indigo Plateau Conference.”

“Still planning on challenging Lance?” Iris asked.

“Hey, if I beat him, I’ll prove I’m the best Dragon Buster ever,” said Haxorus.

“You’re the only Dragon Buster ever,” said Iris.

“My point still stands,” said Haxorus, and Iris laughed.

The conversation died down after that, and the group soon finished their meals. Once they’d finished eating, Ash, Iris and Haxorus helped Cilan clean the dishes in the Pokémon Centre’s kitchen. After they finished cleaning, the four Pokémon Trainers left the Pokémon Centre and continued on the road to Pallet Town.
11512221112111212222233123111212211121.title: The remote works, Sabrina is now a species of P...

115122211121112122222331231112122111212.content: What sort of wild Pokémon appeared?
115122211121112122222331231112122111212.title: A wild Pokémon appeared!

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content: Which Human Pokémon appeared?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: A Human Pokémon.

choices: Joy wants to go with Haxorus.
Joy wants to go with Cilan.
Joy wants to go with Ash.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Ash, Iris, Cilan and Haxorus were on the road to Pallet Town. Pikachu was riding on Ash’s shoulder, Georgia was walking behind Iris, and Jenny was walking behind Haxorus. As they walked, Haxorus noticed someone walking towards them, heading towards the Pokémon Centre. As Haxorus got closer, he realised that it was actually a Joy, walking along the path.

“Hey, is that a wild Joy up ahead?” he asked, pointing at the Human Pokémon in question.

“Yeah, I think it is,” said Cilan. “I wonder what she’s doing here?”

“Joy, Joy,” said the wild Joy, smiling as she approached the group. “Joy, Joy Joy?”

“Pika, Pi Pikachu,” said Pikachu, from his spot on Ash’s shoulder. “Chu, Pika Pikachu.”

“Joy,” said the wild Joy sadly as her shoulders slumped.

“What’s going on?” Haxorus asked.

“I think she wanted to work at the Pokémon Centre we just left,” said Ash. “Pikachu just told her that they already have a Joy there, and she seemed pretty disappointed.”

“Joy,” said the wild Joy, nodding sadly as she looked down.

“Oh,” said Haxorus. “I’m sorry to hear that.”

“Maybe she’d like to go with one of you guys,” said Iris. “I mean, a Fairy-type wouldn’t be a good match for me, since I’m trying to become a Dragon Master and everything, but maybe one of you guys could catch her.”

“Joy?” said the wild Joy, perking up.

“Yeah, sure,” said Haxorus. “I’d love to have a Joy on my team.”

“I must admit, I’ve wanted a Joy for myself for some time,” said Cilan. “I certainly wouldn’t say no if you decided to join me.”

“I wouldn’t mind having a Joy on my team, either,” said Ash. “It’d save me always having to go to a Pokémon Centre to have my team healed after every battle.”

“Joy Joy!” said the wild Joy happily, jumping up and down in excitement.

Who did the wild Joy decide to join?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: A wild Joy appeared!

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Joy, Joy,” said Joy as she thought, then she pointed at Haxorus. “Joy!”

“You want to go with me?” Haxorus asked.

“Joy!” said Joy, nodding as she smiled happily.

“Well, okay then,” said Haxorus. He reached into his pocket and pulled out a spare Pokéball, and held it out in front of him. The wild Joy reached out and tapped the button on the front, causing the Pokéball to pop open and hit her with a red beam of light. The red beam pulled the wild Joy in, and the Pokéball wiggled a few times before it dinged, signalling that the wild Joy had been successfully caught.

“Alright!” said Haxorus, holding the Pokéball above his head. “I caught a Joy!”

“Jen Jenny!” said Jenny, raising her hand and showing her trainer a V sign.

Haxorus opened the Pokéball, letting his new Joy back out.

“Welcome to the team, Joy,” said Haxorus.

“Joy,” said Joy, with a big smile on her face.

“Jenny,” said Jenny, waving at Joy.

“Joy,” she said as she waved back at Jenny.

“Come on, guys,” said Haxorus. “We’ve still got a ways to go before we get to Pallet Town.”

“Jenny,” said Jenny.

“Joy,” said Joy.

Jenny and Joy both fell in behind Haxorus as he began walking towards Pallet Town with Ash, Iris and Cilan.

“Do you think we’ll make it to Pallet Town tonight?” Haxorus asked.

Cilan took out his Town Map and quickly looked it over. “No, I don’t think so,” he said. “We’ll have to stop for the night, then continue to Pallet Town tomorrow. If we do, we should arrive in Pallet Town tomorrow morning.”

“Great,” said Iris. “I’ll keep an eye out for a good campsite.”

Ash, Iris, Cilan, Haxorus and their Pokémon continued walking for a few more hours, and the sun continued to sink lower into the sky. As the sun began to set, Iris found a place for the group to set up camp for the night, and the four Pokémon Trainers soon had their sleeping bags out, and Cilan began to prepare a delicious meal for them.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Joy wants to go with Haxorus.

choices: The group makes it to Pallet Town.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
After the group had eaten and night had fallen, Haxorus returned his Jenny and his Joy to their Pokéballs, then, after making sure the remote was safely hidden in his bag, climbed into his sleeping bag. As he lay down in his sleeping bag, Haxorus thought about the three new species of Pokémon he’d created with the remote. That morning, he had turned Officer Jenny into a Pokémon species, then had turned Nurse Joy into a Pokémon while the group had been at the Pokémon Centre. That was when he’d seen how powerful the remote really was, as an entirely new person had taken on Nurse Joy’s old job. Not only that, but he’d learned that the remote also worked on pictures of people. He’d discovered that when he had used the remote on a poster of Sabrina, transforming her from a Gym Leader into a species of Pokémon as well.

Haxorus rolled over, and thought about all the people he’d met on his journey, and wondered what they might be like if they became Pokémon as well. As he slept that night, his dreams were full of different ideas for what some of the humans he had met would be like if the remote had turned them into Pokémon.



Haxorus woke up the next morning, and quickly got changed. Once he’d finished getting dressed, he joined the others for breakfast.

“We’re almost home,” said Ash as he finished his breakfast. “I can’t wait to see everyone again!”

“Pi Pikachu!” said Pikachu with a smile.

“I can’t wait to meet your mom,” said Iris. “She sounds really nice.”

“She is,” said Ash. “She’ll be happy to meet all of you, I just know it.”

“Then what are we waiting for?” said Haxorus as he swallowed the last mouthful of his food. “Let’s get going.”

“Yeah!” said Ash.

“Pika!” said Pikachu.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: The next morning...

choices: Use the remote on Delia Ketchum.
Use the remote on someone else.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
After a few hours of walking, the group could see Pallet Town in the distance. Ash led the group down the dirt paths and through the wide open fields, and he brought them to a two-story house with a red roof, surrounded by a white picket fence. To one side of the house was a garden, and a Mr. Mime was standing in the garden, wearing a wide brimmed straw hat as he used the watering can he was carrying to water the plants growing in the garden.

“Mime?” said the Mr. Mime, looking up as the group approached, then smiled as he recognised Ash.

“Mime, Mr. Mime!” said the Mr. Mime, waving at Ash with his free hand.

“Hey, Mimey,” said Ash, waving back at the Mr. Mime. “Is Mom home?”

“Mime,” said Mimey, nodding as he put down his watering can.

Ash walked around to the front of the house, and knocked on the door. A few second later, the door opened, revealing a woman with brown hair and brown eyes. When she saw Ash, she smiled happily.

“You made it!” Delia Ketchum said, holding her arms out for a hug. “Welcome home, Ash.”

“Hi, Mom!” said Ash as he hugged his mother. “It’s good to see you again!”

“Pikachu!” said Pikachu, standing next to Ash.

“And hello to you too, Pikachu,” said Delia, kneeling down. Delia gave Pikachu a hug as well, then stood up and looked over at Ash’s friends.

“Mom, this is Iris, Cilan and Georgia, my friends from the Unova region,” said Ash. “Guys, this is my Mom.”

“It’s a pleasure to meet you all,” said Delia, smiling. “Come on in.”

Delia stepped inside, and Ash and Pikachu followed her. Iris, Cilan and Haxorus also followed Delia inside.

“Please, make yourselves at home,” said Delia. “I was just finishing lunch.”

“That sounds great!” said Ash as he put his bag down.

“Pika!”

Iris and Cilan put their bags down next to Ash’s, and Haxorus took his bag off and put it down as well. He quickly opened the bag, and checked that the remote was still there. He reached inside, and his hand closed around the remote. He pulled it out and looked at it briefly. Maybe he could use the remote on Ash’s mother...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: The group makes it to Pallet Town.

choices: Delia is now a species of Pokémon
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content: What did Haxorus do to Delia with the remote?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Use the remote on Delia Ketchum.

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content: What did Haxorus do to Delia with the remote?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Something else happened to Delia

choices: Haxorus decides to go with Ashley, Iris and Cilan.
Haxorus decides to stay here with Dale.
Haxorus wants to do something else...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Haxorus quickly tapped a button, then put the remote back in his pocket as he stood up and saw what the remote did.

As Ash took a seat at the table, Haxorus noticed that his black hair was no longer as spiky as it used to be, and it now ran down to just past his shoulders. Iris and Cilan also sat down at the table, and Haxorus joined them, and looked up as Delia walked into the room with a plate full of sandwiches.

The changes to Delia were much more obvious. She was taller, her chest was flat, and she now had a bushy beard growing on her face. Not only that, but her outfit was completely different, as she was now wearing a long sleeved shirt and pants.

“Here you guys go,” said Dale Ketchum as he put the plate on the table. “Nothing but the best for my daughter and her friends.”

“Thanks, Dad,” said Ashley Ketchum as she picked up a sandwich and started shovelling it into her mouth.

“You’re welcome,” said Dale. “Now, I want to hear all about how you did at the Unova League, Ashley.”

As Ashley started talking about her accomplishments in Unova, Haxorus marvelled at the change he had made. Ash was now a girl, and his mother was now a man! Not only that, but no-one, not even Ash or Delia, was aware of the change. As Haxorus listened to Ashley describing one of the battles she had taken part in, he realised that, even though he was now a girl, Ash’s personality and life history was still the same, and he was willing to bet that the same applied to Delia, or rather, Dale Ketchum, who was now a stay-at-home father while his wife continued to travel on her own Pokémon journey.

“...And even though we didn’t win, my Pokémon all tried so hard,” Ashley was saying when Haxorus started paying attention to the conversation again.

“Pikachu!” said Pikachu, eating from a bowl of Pokémon food that Dale had given him.

“That’s good to hear,” said Dale. “Oh, that reminds me. That reporter from Kalos you met, Alexa, I think her name was?”

“Yeah, that’s her,” said Ashley. “She went on ahead of us when Iris and Cilan decided to tag along. She made it here alright?”

“Yes, she said she was going to see Professor Oak for an interview,” said Dale. “I think she should be finished by now, if you want to go and visit his lab.”

“Sure!” said Ashley. “You guys wanna come and meet all my Pokémon?”

“Yeah,” said Iris. “I can’t wait to see them all.”

“I’ll come too,” said Cilan.

“What about you, Georgia?” Ashley asked. “Are you coming?”
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Delia swapped genders with Ash.

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Sure, I’ll come,” said Haxorus.

“Great!” said Ashley, standing up. “I can’t wait to see all my Pokémon again!”

Ashley started to run towards the door, then stopped, and walked over to her bag, which she had put on the floor next to the door earlier. She opened the bag and pulled out a black Badge Case.

“Hey, Dad, can you put this in my room for me?” Ashley said, holding out her Badge Case.

“Sure thing,” said Dale. “Now, go on. I know how much you want to see your Pokémon.”

“Thanks again, Dad!” said Ashley as she opened the door. Iris, Cilan and Haxorus also got up and followed after Ashley, who led them up a hill to a large building with a domed roof and a windmill at the back. She led them around the side, following the wooden fence that went on for quite some distance. As they walked along, Haxorus spotted two people, a man and a woman, in the field on the other side of the fence.

“Professor Oak!” Ashley yelled, waving as she hopped over the fence. “Hey!”

“Ah, Ashley,” said Professor Oak, waving back. “Good to see you again.”

“You too, Professor,” said Ashley as she walked up to him. She then looked over at the woman that had been with Professor Oak. “Oh, hey, Alexa. I’m not interrupting your interview, am I?”

“Not at all, Ashley,” said Alexa, the journalist from Kalos. “As a matter of fact, I had just finished.”

“And who are these friends of yours?” Professor Oak asked as Iris, Cilan and Haxorus all caught up with Ashley.

“Oh, right,” said Ashley. “This is Iris, Cilan and Georgia, from Unova. Everyone, this is Professor Oak. He’s been looking after all the Pokémon I have when they aren’t with me.”

“Yes, I’m always happy to see what new Pokémon Ashley catches,” said Professor Oak. “Speaking of which, what Pokemon do you and your friends have with you?”

“Here, we’ll show you,” said Ashley, pulling out her Pokéballs. “Come on out, guys!”

Ashley threw five Pokéballs into the air, sending out Oshawott, Snivy, Pignite, Scraggy and Charizard. Iris also threw her Pokéballs into the air, sending out Excadrill, Emolga, Dragonite and Georgia the Haxorus. Cilan sent out Pansage, Crustle and Stunfisk, and Haxorus pulled out his own Pokéballs and sent out Beartic, Vanilluxe, Bisharp, Jenny and Joy.

“What an amazing collection of Pokémon!” said Professor Oak. “Your friends are very talented Pokémon Trainers.”

“Thanks, Professor,” said Ashley. She then turned to Iris, Cilan and Haxorus. “Come on, I’ll show you around and introduce you to all my other Pokémon.”
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus decides to go with Ashley, Iris and Cilan.

choices: Use the remote on Professor Oak.
Use the remote to create more Human Pokémon.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
About an hour later, Haxorus found himself inside Professor Oak’s Laboratory. After Ashley had shown Iris, Cilan and Haxorus around the corral and introduced them to all his Pokémon, Professor Oak had invited them inside for a tour of the Laboratory itself. The tour had just finished, and Professor Oak had given them free reign to explore.

Haxorus found himself in the study. He could see Professor Oak and Alexa in the main laboratory, and Alexa was filming various items with the camera on her headset, while Professor Oak pointed out items of interest.

Haxorus reached into his pocket and pulled out the remote. He could use the remote on Professor Oak, or on Alexa. There were also several books, magazines and posters, from all around the world, in Professor Oak’s study. Maybe he could use the remote to create more Human Pokémon using the pictures in those books and posters...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Later, at Professor Oak's Laboratory...

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content: Haxorus made his decision. There were currently three types of Human Pokémon; Jenny, a Fighting-type, Joy, a Fairy-type, and Sabrina, a Psychic-type, all of which were native to Kanto. That left fifteen other types that didn’t have Human Pokémon, so Haxorus began pulling out magazines and books, reading through them and using the remote on pictures of people he thought would make good Human Pokémon, until he had created fifteen more Human Pokémon, one of each type.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Use the remote to create more Human Pokémon.

choices: Haxorus meets up with Ashley, Iris and Cilan.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
A few minutes later, Haxorus had finished with the remote. He put the remote back in his pocket, and took out his Pokédex. He turned it on and scanned the new Human Pokémon with it, and one by one, his Pokedex listed off the fifteen new Pokémon species he had created.

Viola, the Artsy Pokémon. Violas have the ability to create a unique pigment from their hands, which they use to paint patterns in the foliage of forests, to communicate with other Violas. They are normally carefree and friendly, and enjoy painting pictures using the pigment from their hands, and some Violas can even control the colour of their pigment. However, when they are in battle, Violas are extremely focused. Viola is a Bug-type Pokémon, native to the Kalos region.

Karen, the Vanity Pokémon. Very well-known for their beauty, Karens often value their appearance over anything, even during battle. However, Karens are exceptionally skilled in battle, even without training. In fact, Karens that have become bored of living in the wild have been known to find Pokémon Trainers and challenge them to battle, then join their team, regardless of whether the Trainer defeats them or not. Karen is a Dark-type Pokémon, native to the Johto region.

Clair, the Tamer Pokémon. Originally discovered in the Dragon’s Den of Blackthorn City, Clairs have been known to tame even the most unruly of Dragon-type Pokémon. This has led to Clairs being introduced into the nests of Dragon-type Pokemon across the world. However, their prideful and stubborn nature, which is their greatest asset when taming Dragon-type Pokémon, also means they do not take losses in battle well. Clair is a Dragon-type Pokémon, native to the Johto region.

Elesa, the Model Pokémon. Known for their flair for theatrics, Elesas often incorporate fanciful movements into their attacks, and quite enjoy showing off. They are also capable of using the antennae over their ears to absorb and discharge electricity. When absorbing electricity, an Elesa’s hair turns yellow, and returns to its natural black once the electricy has been discharged. Elesas can also use the move Transform, but, due to some unknown quirk, have only been observed turning into other Human Pokémon. Elesa is an Electric-type Pokémon, native to the Unova region.

Malva, the Observant Pokémon. Malvas are always aware of their surroundings and have excellent memories, allowing them to recall what they have seen in great detail. Their powers of observation and retention has resulted in journalists and news organisations across the world using Malvas when in the field. Malvas are also known for their fiery tempers, which can result in them becoming very hostile if they are pushed far enough. Malva is a Fire-type Pokémon, native to the Kalos region.

Skyla, the Highflying Pokémon. Skylas are very confident in their battle skills, especially in the wild, which often results in wild Skylas overestimating their battle prowess and getting into trouble. Skylas can use the propellor in their hair to fly, and can usually be found at high altitudes. Due to their love of flying, many Skylas spend their entire lives in the air, never touching the ground once after they have hatched. Skyla is a Flying-type Pokémon, native to the Unova region.

Phoebe, the Medium Pokémon. First discovered on Mount Pyre, Phoebes use their dancing abilities to commune with Ghost-type Pokémon, to help them pass on, or to summon them to their side during battles. Phoebes are often attracted to graveyards and other places where the deceased are laid to rest, and work to protect these sacred places from grave-robbers and thieves. Phoebe is a Ghost-type Pokémon, native to the Hoenn region.

Gardenia, the Forest Pokémon. Gardenias are very fond of sunshine, and will often use Sunny Day to bring the sun out on overcast or rainy days. Wild Gardenias will always use Sunny Day at the start of every battle they participate in, even if this could be detrimental to them. Wild Gardenias also have a noticeable aversion of Ghost-type Pokémon and locations that are supposedly haunted, and will avoid them as much as possible. Gardenia is a Grass-type Pokémon, native to the Sinnoh region.

Grace, the Rider Pokémon. Capable of climbing on the back of any Pokémon and riding it with ease, wild Graces travel in small herds, and each Grace in the herd will have tamed a different Pokémon. Rhyhorns are especially susceptible to a Grace’s taming abilities, and the leader of a herd of Graces will always be riding a Rhyhorn. Grace is a Ground-type Pokémon, native to the Kalos region.

Candice, the Focus Pokémon. Due to their friendly and inquisitive nature, wild Candices will often follow Pokémon Trainers that they consider to be interesting, which usually leads to them being caught. Their studious nature means that they will often challenge Fighting-type Pokémon to learn how to cover their weaknesses, and will give their full attention to any task set before them, even if it is something mundane. Candice is an Ice-type Pokémon, native to the Sinnoh region.

Lenora, the Backbone Pokémon. Lenoras will refuse to surrender when in battle, regardless of how powerful their opponent is. Wild Lenoras will only stop fighting once their opponent has fled their territory, or if they have collapsed from sheer exhaustion. Their tenacity and protectiveness has led to them being raised in museums and libraries, so they will consider the buildings o be their territory, and protect them from thieves and criminals. Lenora is a Normal-type Pokémon, native to the Unova region.

Plumeria, the Sister Pokémon. Though they may appear intimidating at first glance, and will often be hostile to new people or Pokémon they encounter, wild Plumerias have been observed caring for young Pokémon that have been lost or abandoned in their territory. Plumerias secrete poison from a gland on their stomach, and they coat their braids with this poison when they attack. When travelling on Ula’ula Island, it is best to avoid young Pokémon, as even approaching them can cause a wild Plumeria to attack. Plumeria is a Poison-type Pokémon, native to the Alola region.

Olivia, the Humble Pokémon. Originally found on Akala Island, wild Pokemon have been known to gather around wild Olivias for protection, and Olivias will take their role as protector seriously, and rarely display fear when defending others. However, young Olivias are often clumsy and destructive, so older Olivias will teach them how to control themselves to ensure the safety of themselves and others. Olivia is a Rock-type Pokémon, native to the Alola region.

Jasmine, the Defence Pokémon. Wild Jasmines are shy and non-confrontational, but their frail appearance hides a sturdiness that enables them to take a head-on attack from a charging Tauros without flinching or moving an inch. Jasmines have a noticeable fondness for Electric-type Pokémon, particularly Ampharos, and wild Jasmines can often be found amidst a flock of Mareeps and Flaaffies. Jasmine is a Steel-type Pokémon, native to the Johto region.

Shelly, the Pirate Pokémon. Shellies have an instinctive knowledge of the local weather conditions, and can often be seen gathering a few hours before it rains. During rainstorms, Shellies will often frolic and play around with each other. Shellies also have gills on their necks, allowing them to breathe underwater. Wild Shellies will often make their homes in old shipwrecks, and will fiercely defend any treasure they find. Shelly is a Water-type Pokémon, native to the Hoenn region.

Haxorus smiled, and put his Pokédex away. The world was now completely different, with eighteen kinds of Human Pokémon out there. Haxorus couldn’t wait to go out and catch them all!

What did Haxorus do next?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Group 1 (Reserved for Shortyboss).

choices: Discuss Human Pokémon with Professor Oak
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content: What did Haxorus do next?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus does something else...

choices: Haxorus plans to attend the summit.
Haxorus plans to do something else...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Haxorus put away all the books and magazines he’d used to create the new Human Pokémon, and noticed that there now seemed to be a few extra books, and as far as Haxorus could tell, they were books about Human Pokémon.

I guess people have been studying Human Pokémon now, thought Haxorus. Maybe I should see what Professor Oak knows about them.

Haxorus finished tidying up the study, then headed over to the main laboratory, where Professor Oak was talking with Alexa. As he entered the laboratory, he saw a naked blonde woman standing behind Alexa, and Haxorus realised that the naked woman was a Viola that must have belonged to Alexa.

“Thanks again for your time, Professor,” said Alexa as Haxorus walked up.

“Oh, it’s my pleasure,” said Professor Oak. “I must admit, I was surprised to hear that the Santalune City Gym Leader was asking me for an interview.”

“Well, even Gym Leaders need to take vacations every now and then,” said Alexa. “And since I am still a journalist, I decided I might as well get some footage for a TV special about Professor Oak.”

“I look forward to seeing it,” said Professor Oak. He looked up, and saw Haxorus walking towards him. “Ah, Georgia. Is there something I can help you with?”

“Actually, yes,” said Haxorus. “You see, I recently caught a Jenny and a Joy, and I was wondering what you could tell me about Human Pokémon.”

“Ah, Human Pokémon are truly one of the greatest mysteries of the world,” said Professor Oak. “The first species of Human Pokémon, Jenny, I believe, was first discovered about twenty years ago, and we still don’t know much about them. Every Pokémon Professor I’ve spoken with has been fascinated by them, and they’ve captured the interest of the public as well.”

“Viola,” said Alexa’s Viola. “La, Viola, Vi.”

Alexa nodded. “Viola says that she’s glad more people are taking an interest in Human Pokémon now. Speaking of which, you said there would be a summit of some sort about Human Pokémon next week?”

“That’s correct,” said Professor Oak. “Pokémon Professors from around the world are coming here to Pallet Town, and they’ll be bringing the Human Pokémon native to their regions. There are even plans to give some away to everyone that attends the summit.”

“Really?” asked Haxorus.

“Yes, but we’ll only be giving one Human Pokémon to each person in attendance, so you’ll have to choose wisely,” said Professor Oak.

“I’ll be at the summit, too,” said Alexa. “The Lumiose Press wanted me to cover it, which is why I asked you for that interview today.”

“Getting in before the rush?” asked Professor Oak.

“Exactly,” said Alexa.

“Vi Vi!” said Alexa’s Viola, smiling.

“How about you, Georgia?” Professor Oak. “Will you attend the summit next week?”
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Discuss Human Pokémon with Professor Oak

choices: Skip to the Human Pokémon summit.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Oh, absolutely!” said Haxorus. “I’d love to be there!”

“Wonderful!” said Professor Oak. “It’s always nice to see someone with an enthusiasm for learning.”

“I can’t wait to see all the different kinds of Human Pokémon,” said Haxorus. “I’d love to have one of each kind on my team.”

“Well, you’ve already caught a Jenny and a Joy, so that’s a good start,” said Professor Oak. “All you need to do is catch a Sabrina, and you’ll have all three Human Pokemon that are native to Kanto.”

“So, what Human Pokémon can be found in other regions?” Haxorus asked.

“Well, Jennies and Joys can be found all over the world, though in some places, like in Unova, Kalos or Alola, Jennies and Joys can have different appearances,” said Professor Oak. “And there have been efforts to transplant Human Pokémon to other regions, which have been surprisingly successful.”

“I see,” said Haxorus.

“Having said that, you’re still most likely to find Human Pokémon near the places where they were first discovered,” said Professor Oak. “For example, wild Sabrinas can be found all over Kanto, but they’re very common near Saffron City, which is where they were first discovered.”

“Okay,” said Haxorus.

“In the Johto region, you’ll find wild Karens, Clairs and Jasmines,” said Professor Oak. “Karens can often be found near Indigo Plateau and Mount Silver, while Clairs are often found in the Dragon’s Den in Blackthorn City. Wild Jasmines, on the other hand, are much more common in the area between Olivine City and Ecruteak City.”

“Uh-huh,” said Haxorus.

“As for Hoenn, Phoebes are very common in Mount Pyre,” said Professor Oak. “Shellies are more common near Lilycove City, but they’ve also been found inland, near Fortree City, where there’s regular rainfall.”

“Okay,” said Haxorus.

“In Sinnoh, Gardenias can often be found in Eterna Forest, while Candices are normally found in the north, near Snowpoint City,” said Professor Oak. “But they both like to gather on Mount Coronet. Meanwhile, in Unova, Lenoras are most common in the Pinwheel Forest, just east of Nacrene City. Elesas can usually be found in Chargestone Cave, but they’re also common around Nimbasa City. There are also plenty of Skylas flying above the Unova region, but they rarely ever touch the ground. However, they do like to make their nests in Mistralton City. In the Kalos region, Violas are very common in Santalune Forest, while Graces are often found near Vaniville Town and Aquacorde Town. Malvas, on the other hand, are more common in the mountains to the east of Lumiose City. And finally, in the Alola region, Olivias can be found on Akala Island, while Plumerias are often found on Ula’ula Island.” Professor Oak paused, and realised he’d been speaking for quite some time. “I’m sorry, I got a little carried away there.”

“No, it’s fine,” said Haxorus. “That was all so fascinating to listen to.”

“Yeah, it was a great speech,” said Alexa.

“Vi, Vi!” said Alexa’s Viola.

“Have you ever considered hosting a radio show?” asked Alexa. “I think you’d be wonderful at it.”

“Well, the Goldenrod Radio Tower did approach me a few years back,” said Professor Oak. “Maybe I should see if they’re still interested...”

Professor Oak cleared his throat. “Anyway, I do believe it’s getting rather late, and I believe your friends are waiting for you.”

Haxorus looked behind her, and saw Ashley, Iris and Cilan walking up to them.

“Hey, Georgia,” said Iris. “What’s up?”

“Oh, not much,” said Haxorus. “Just asking Professor Oak a few things about Human Pokémon.”

“Yes, she was very interested in the subject,” said Professor Oak. “Speaking of, there’s a summit about Human Pokémon being held here next week, with Pokémon Professors and Human Pokémon from around the world. We’re even giving away Human Pokémon to those who attend. Are you three interested in attending as well?”

“Yeah!” said Ashley. “I’d love to go!”

“Same here,” said Iris. “I hope they have some Clairs to give out.”

“I’d like to attend as well,” said Cilan. “Though, personally, I’d like to obtain a Grace, myself.”

“Yeah, Graces are cool,” said Ash. “Gracie’s been a big help for Mimey and Dad while I was out travelling.”

“Excellent,” said Professor Oak. “The summit is in four days time, so you have some time to spare.”

“Great!” said Ashley. “Come on, guys, let’s head back to my place. Dad should have dinner ready.”
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus plans to attend the summit.

choices: Iris or Cilan receives Gracie's egg.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Haxorus followed Ashley, Iris and Cilan back to Ashley’s house. Ash, Iris and Cilan were talking about the upcoming summit, and they were all oblivious to the fact that, a few hours ago, most of the Human Pokémon they were talking about didn’t exist. Haxorus was still having trouble believing that. The remote had changed the entire world, not only creating new species of Pokémon that looked like humans, but also having other people filling in the roles that had been left behind by the people that had been turned into Pokémon.

Haxorus remembered that, before he had found the remote, Alexa had said that she had a sister who was a Gym Leader in the Kalos region. Now, Alexa had taken her sister’s place as that Gym Leader, and her sister, Viola, was now a species of Human Pokémon. That made Haxorus wonder about what had happened to the original Viola. When he’d first turned Jenny into a Human Pokémon, he’d caught the Jenny he had used the remote on, meaning he had the original Jenny. But when he’d used the remote to turn Joy into a Human Pokémon, the Joy he’d used the remote on was still at the Pokemon Centre between Pallet Town and Viridian City, and the Joy he had with him was new. Haxorus had no idea if the Joy he’d caught had previously been human, or if she’d been brought into existence by the remote.

Ultimately, Haxorus decided it didn’t matter. Even if his Joy was just over a day old, she was still a Pokémon with her own hopes and dreams, and Haxorus figured that was what really mattered.

As the group arrived at Ashley’s house, Haxorus noticed a Rhyhorn walking around the house. Riding on the Rhyhorn’s back was a woman with blue eyes and brown hair, with a golden hair clip in her hair. Haxorus recognised her as a Grace, one of the Human Pokémon he had created, but was somewhat surprised to see that she was wearing the clothes Delia Ketchum had been wearing before she had swapped genders with her son and become Dale Ketchum.

“Is that Grace yours?” Haxorus asked, pointing at the Grace and her Rhyhorn.

“Oh, yeah, that’s Gracie,” said Ashley. “She and her Rhyhorn belong to Dad. We didn’t see her earlier because she was taking her Rhyhorn out for a walk.”

“Why is she wearing clothes, though?” Haxorus asked. “I thought Pokémon didn’t need to.”

“Well, no,” said Ashley. “But since Human Pokémon look like human women, there are some people that get upset when they see a Human Pokémon that isn’t wearing clothes. Besides, some Human Pokémon just like to wear clothes.”

“Oh, okay,” said Haxorus. “I guess that makes sense.”

“Hi, Gracie!” said Ashley, waving at the Human Pokémon.


“Grace!” said Gracie happily, waving back. She climbed off the back of her Rhyhorn and walked up to the front door, opening it as Ashley walked up.

“Thanks,” said Ashley as Gracie held the door open.

“Grace,” said Gracie.

Haxorus followed Ashley, Iris and Cilan inside, and Gracie came in and shut the door behind them.

“Mr. Mime,” said Mimey as he came downstairs and walked up to Gracie.

“Grace,” said Gracie, smiling at Mimey. She bent over and kissed Mimey on the cheek, causing Mimey to blush.

“Mime, Mime,” said Mimey bashfully.

“Are Mimey and Gracie together?” Iris asked.

“They sure are,” said Dale as he entered the room. “They hit it off when they first met, and they’ve been inseparable ever since. In fact, I think there’s something you two need to tell Ashley.”

“Grace,” said Gracie, nodding.

“Huh?” said Ashley. “What are you talking about?”

Gracie walked around a corner and out of sight, and came back a few moments later. When she returned, Gracie was carrying a brown Pokémon egg that had a yellow triangle on the side, similar to the golden hair clip Gracie wore.

“Grace, Grace Grace,” said Gracie, holding up the Pokémon egg.

“Are you and Mimey having a baby?” Ashley asked.

“Grace,” said Gracie, smiling happily as she nodded.

“That’s wonderful,” said Ashley. “Congratulations!”

“Grace,” said Gracie.

“Mime Mime!” said Mimey.

“Gracie, Mimey and I were talking earlier,” Dale said, turning to Ashley, Iris, Cilan and Haxorus. “We all agreed that we want one of you to take Gracie’s egg and look after it.”

“Really?” asked Iris.

“Yeah, but Gracie was having trouble making up her mind as to who would get the egg,” said Dale. “I think she’s made her decision now, though.”

“Grace,” said Gracie, nodding. She stepped forward, and held her egg out to one of the Trainers.

Who does Gracie give her egg to?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: During dinner at Ashley's house...

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Gracie stepped forward, and held her egg out towards Ashley.

“You want me to take the egg?” said Ashley.

“Grace,” said Gracie with a nod, and Ashley carefully took the egg from Gracie.

“I’ll take good care of it,” said Ashley. “I promise.”

Gracie nodded, then bent over and kissed her egg.

“I’ll be back in a bit,” said Ashley as she started walking towards her room. “I just want to put Gracie’s egg in my Egg Case.”

“Of course,” said Dale. “In the meantime, I’ll start serving up some food.”

Ashley nodded, and headed up to her room, while Dale went back into the kitchen. Mimey and Gracie followed Dale into the kitchen, and Iris, Cilan and Haxorus all took seats at the table as they waited for Dale to finish cooking. Ashley soon came back, carrying Gracie’s egg in a glass container with a padded bottom and a yellow lid. Ashley gently put the Egg Case containing Gracie’s egg down, and joined the others at the table as Dale arrived with dinner.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Ashley receives Gracie's egg.

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
After dinner, Iris, Cilan and Haxorus decided to stay at Ashley’s house for the night. Cilan volunteered to sleep on the couch, so Iris and Haxorus could share the guest room.

Iris had fallen asleep as soon as her head hit the pillow, but Haxorus’ mind was still racing from excitement as he thought about what he had done with the remote over the last few days. He still couldn’t believe that it had only been a few days since he had found the remote, and that no-one had noticed any of the changes he’d made with the remote. First, he’d swapped bodies and lives with Iris’ rival Georgia, then used the remote to make Iris and Georgia friends. Yesterday, he’d learned that he could successfully use the remote on pictures of people, and he’d discovered what was quickly becoming his favourite button on the remote. He’d turned three people, Officer Jenny, Nurse Joy and Sabrina, into species of Pokémon. While they looked like human women, the three of them now acted like any other Pokémon. And today, Haxorus had learned that the remote could swap things between two other people, rather than just with himself and his target. He’d found that out when he’d swapped Ash and Delia Ketchum’s genders, turning them into Ashley and Dale Ketchum, respectively. He’d also created fifteen new species of Human Pokémon, using Viola, Karen, Clair, Elesa, Malva, Skyla, Phoebe, Gardenia, Grace, Candice, Lenora, Plumeria, Olivia, Jasmine and Shelly as his targets. Now, there was one Human Pokémon of each type.

Haxorus was still wondering just how much the world had changed with the creation of eighteen kinds of Human Pokémon. Professor Oak had revealed that, four days from now, there was going to be a summit held in Pallet Town that would be all about Human Pokémon. Other Pokémon Professors would arrive with the Human Pokémon from their regions, and they were going to give away a Human Pokémon to each Pokémon Trainer that attended. Haxorus had to wonder just what kind of Human Pokemon he’d pick when the time came. They all seemed so interesting...

Haxorus sighed quietly. He’d need to find something to do for the next few days, until the summit came around. Haxorus rolled over, and reached down to his bag. He pulled it out and looked at it. Finding the remote had been one of the best things to happen to him, but there were still so many buttons he hadn’t tried yet. Maybe he should try them out now...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: That night...

choices: Haxorus wants to go with Iris.
Haxorus wants to go to Professor Oak's Lab.
Haxorus wants to do something else...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Haxorus tucked the remote into the bottom of his bag, where it would be safe. It was too late to be going around using the remote, anyway. Besides, he was happy with the changes he’d made so far, so he didn’t see any need to go around using the remote, at least, not yet. Once he was satisfied that the remote was safe in his bag, Haxorus rolled back over and went to sleep.



When he woke up the next morning, Haxorus felt great. Now he understood why people liked to sleep in beds. Haxorus got out of bed, and noticed that Iris had already gotten up and left the room. He quickly got changed, then headed downstairs to have some breakfast.

“Morning, Georgia,” said Iris as Haxorus walked down the stairs. She was sitting at the table, and a plate full of pancakes was sitting in the centre of the table.

“Morning,” said Haxorus as he sat down. He looked around, but he didn’t see any sign of Ashley, Dale or Cilan. “Where are the others?”

“Oh, Ashley’s gone back to Professor Oak’s lab,” said Iris. “She wanted to show Gracie’s egg to the Professor, and I think she wanted to ask Alexa some questions about the Kalos Pokémon League.”

“Okay,” said Haxorus, taking a few pancakes from the pile and putting them on her plate. “And what about Cilan?”

“He went with Ashley’s dad,” said Iris. “See, Ashley’s dad runs the only restaurant in town, and Cilan wanted to help out.”

“Right,” said Haxorus. “And what are you going to do today?”

“I dunno,” said Iris. “I was thinking I might just explore Pallet Town, maybe go out and do some training. How about you?”
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus doesn't use the remote.

choices: Gracie knows where some wild Human Pokémon are.
Gracie doesn't know of any wild Human Pokémon nearby.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“I think I’ll go with you,” said Haxorus. “I want to get some training in as well, since I haven’t seen what my Joy can do yet.”

“Hey, yeah, that’s a good point,” said Iris. “You caught her without actually battling her.”

“That’s right,” said Haxorus. “I want to see what she can do.”

“Sounds good,” said Iris as she ate the last of her pancakes. “Maybe we can find some cool wild Pokémon to catch, too.”

“Yeah,” said Haxorus as he finished his breakfast as well. “Do you think there are any Human Pokémon around here? Other than Jennies and Joys, I mean.”

“Maybe Gracie knows,” said Iris. “We can ask her.”

After the two of them finished their breakfast, Iris and Haxorus put their dirty dishes in the kitchen, where Mimey was cleaning up. Once they’d dropped off their plates, they headed outside, and saw Gracie sitting on the back of her Rhyhorn.

“Hey, Gracie,” said Haxorus as he and Iris walked up to Gracie and her Rhyhorn.

“Grace?” she asked.

“Do you know if there are any wild Human Pokémon nearby?” Haxorus asked. “I’m hoping to catch some more.”
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus wants to go with Iris.

choices: Haxorus and Iris found wild Sabrinas.
Haxorus and Iris found a Human Pokémon from Johto.
Haxorus and Iris found a Human Pokémon from another region.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Grace, Grace,” said Gracie, nodding. She patted her Rhyhorn on the back, just behind where she was sitting.

“You want us to take us there?” Haxorus asked.

“Grace,” Gracie said, nodding again.

“Okay, then,” said Haxorus. He climbed onto the Rhyhorn’s back, and sat just behind Gracie. He looked over at Iris, and saw her taking out one of her Pokéballs. She held it out, and sent out Georgia, who was living Haxorus’ old life in his old body.

“Haxor?” asked Georgia.

“Let me up, Haxorus,” said Iris as she climbed on Georgia’s back and sat between two of the ridges on Georgia’s back.

“Hax,” said Georgia.

“Okay, now follow Gracie and her Rhyhorn, okay?” said Iris.

“Hax, Hax,” said Georgia.

“Grace,” said Gracie, and she stirred her Rhyhorn into motion.

“Horn,” said Gracie’s Rhyhorn, and he began plodding along, walking at a slow and steady pace.

Haxorus was impressed with how easily Gracie controlled her Rhyhorn. The Rhyhorn was quite calm, and didn’t seemed to be bothered by Gracie or Haxorus. He just kept walking, easily travelling across the open grassy fields.

Gracie’s Rhyhorn walked for about half an hour, with Georgia following behind him, carrying Iris on her back. Gracie brought her Rhyhorn to a stop at the base of a small hill.

“Grace, Grace,” said Gracie, pointing over the hill.

“On the other side of the hill, huh?” said Haxorus.

“Grace,” said Gracie.

“Thanks, Gracie,” said Haxorus as he climbed off her Rhyhorn’s back, and Iris jumped off Georgia’s back as well.

“Let’s go check it out,” said Iris, and she began climbing the hill. Haxorus began climbing the hill, and once he’d reached the top, he could see a small group of Human Pokémon on the other side.

What kind of Human Pokémon did Haxorus and Iris encounter?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Gracie knows where some wild Human Pokémon are.

choices: Haxorus and Iris found wild Karens.
Haxorus and Iris found wild Clairs.
Haxorus and Iris found wild Jasmines.
