1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Something else happened to Juniper and Fennel

choices: Haxorus makes it to Pallet House.
Haxorus runs into someone on the way.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Yes, dear,” said Fennel, as she walked up to Professer Juniper. “All your notes are here, and I’ve picked up the Human Pokémon we’ll be bringing.”

“Did you buy the plane tickets?” Juniper asked as Fennel passed her the papers she had been carrying. As Fennel passed the folder to Juniper, Haxorus noticed that both women were now wearing a ring on the fourth finger of their left hands.

“Of course I bought the tickets,” said Fennel. “We fly into Pallet Town tomorrow.”

“Thanks, Fen,” said Juniper, leaning over to Fennel and kissing her on the cheek. “You’re the best.”

“Oh, stop it,” said Fennel, blushing. “Anyway, there are a few last things I need to sort out before we leave tomorrow.”

“I’ll let you get back to it, then,” said Juniper.

Fennel nodded, and walked out of the videophone’s camera range as Juniper turned back to face the camera.

“Sorry about that,” said Professor Juniper. “Things are a bit busy over here at the moment.”

“That’s alright,” said Haxorus. “Who was that, anyway?”

“Oh, that was my wife, Doctor Fennel,” said Juniper. “We’re going to a summit about Human Pokémon in Pallet Town.”

“Yeah, I’m in Pallet Town right now,” said Haxorus. “I was planning on attending the summit, too.”

“Really?” said Professor Juniper. “Well, I look forward to meeting you in person tomorrow.”

“Me, too,” said Haxorus. “Will Vanilluxe be okay while you’re gone?”

“Of course she will,” said Juniper. “My father and my new assistant will take good care of the Pokémon here while Fennel and I are in Pallet Town.”

“Okay, thank you,” said Haxorus. “It was nice to meet you.”

“Nice to meet you, too, Georgia,” said Professor Juniper. “I’ll see you tomorrow.”

Haxorus nodded. “Goodbye, Professor,” she said.

“Bye,” said Juniper, then the screen went blank as Juniper ended the call.

With the call over, Haxorus put the remote back in her pocket, having hidden the remote out of sight after she’d used it. Apparently, the remote had made Professor Juniper and Fennel fall in love with each other. As a Pokémon, or rather, a former Pokémon, she wasn’t quite sure how to feel about that. It wasn’t very common for two female Pokémon to fall in love with each other, at least in her experience. Maybe it was different for humans...

Haxorus shrugged, and stood up. She figured that if nobody else had a problem with it, then there was no reason for her to worry about it. She left the Pokémon Centre, then began walking towards Pallet House, the restaurant that Ashley’s father Dale ran. Ashley had shown Haxorus and Iris the way to Pallet House earlier in the day. Hopefully, she could still remember the way...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Juniper and Fennel are now a married couple.

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Thankfully, Pallet Town, while relatively spread out, was a fairly easy to navigate town, and Haxorus found the Pallet House without too much trouble. As she got close, the delicious smell of food filled the air, and Haxorus could see families seated at large tables outside the restaurant, happily eating their meals.

Haxorus walked in through the open front door and had a quick look around. There were large windows on all of the walls, giving Pallet House a great view of the wide open fields of Pallet Town, and the décor was nice and bright, giving off a family-friendly vibe. There was a TV behind the counter, which was currently tuned into a local sports match.

Haxorus was able to find her friends easily, thanks to the fact that May now towered above everyone else, even when sitting down. In fact, as Haxorus noticed as she walked over, May had pushed her chair back some distance from the table, so that her legs could fit under the table while still leaving room for everyone else.

“Hey, Georgia,” said Iris as Haxorus sat down next to her. “How’d it go?”

“It went great,” said Haxorus. “I sent my Vanilluxe over to Professor Juniper’s lab over in Unova.”

“How is Professor Juniper?” Ashley asked.

“She was really nice,” said Haxorus. “I think she’s flying in to Pallet Town tomorrow with her wife.”

“Doctor Fennel’s coming too?” Iris asked. “Are they coming for the summit in a couple days?”

“Yeah, I think so,” said Haxorus. She noticed that Iris didn’t seem surprised that Professor Juniper and Doctor Fennel were married. “How long is it until the summit, anyway?”

“It’s the day after tomorrow,” said Max. “May and I will be helping Professor Birch tomorrow, so everything is ready for the summit.”

“Yeah, I told Professor Oak I’d help him set everything up,” said Ashley. “I’m going to get all my Pokémon to help too.”

“Speaking of your Pokémon, where’s Pikachu?” asked May. “I didn’t see him with you when you walked in.”

“Oh, he’s back at Professor Oak’s lab, with my other Pokémon,” said Ashley. “He wanted to catch up with his friends.”

“Oh, okay,” said May, nodding. “What about you, Iris? Where you going to help with setting up the summit?”

“No, I was planning on having a look around Pallet Town on my own tomorrow,” said Iris. “What about you, Georgia?”

“I was thinking I might help with getting everything ready for the summit,” said Haxorus. “Besides, I was hoping to meet Professor Juniper and Doctor Fennel in person.”

“Okay,” said Iris, who quickly looked around the table. “Well, since everyone’s here, do we want to get some lunch?”

“Sure,” said Ashley, standing up. “I’ll go get some menus for everyone. Be right back.”

As Ashley walked over to the counter, Haxorus wondered if it would be a good idea to pull the remote out and try a few buttons out...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus makes it to Pallet House.

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Haxorus quickly pulled the remote out, and began pointing it at people she hadn't used the remote on, and started pressing random buttons.

What happened as a result?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus uses the remote.

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Haxorus decided not to use the remote. There were too many people around right now, and someone might see her using the remote. Haxorus didn’t want to risk being discovered, even if nobody had been aware of the changes Haxorus had made with the remote so far. Besides, he found it easier to get used to the changes he made if he used the remote sparingly.

Ashley soon returned with menus, and she handed them out to everyone.

“Hey, I forgot to ask, where’s Cilan?” Haxorus asked.

“He’s still helping Dad in the kitchen,” said Ashley. “He’s really enjoying working here, and Dad really appreciates his help.”

“Oh, okay,” said Haxorus, nodding. She turned her attention back to her menu, reading through it and trying to decide what she wanted. The conversation turned towards food as Ashley, Iris, Haxorus, May and Max tried to figure out what they wanted to eat. After a few minutes, everyone had figured out what they wanted and Ashley went up to the counter to order. After placing their order, Ashley returned to the table, and about ten minutes later, their food was served, and the five of them dug into their lunches.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus doesn't use the remote.

choices: Haxorus uses the remote on Professor Oak.
Haxorus uses the remote on Max.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Once they had finished eating their lunches, Ashley, Iris, Haxorus, May and Max paid for their meals and left Pallet House. Iris headed back into Pallet Town, and Ashley, Haxorus, May and Max walked over to Professor Oak’s laboratory. As the four of them reached the laboratory, Haxorus noticed that Professor Oak was speaking to another man. The man had brown hair and a beard, and was wearing a blue shirt and khaki shorts under his white lab coat.

“Who’s that with Professor Oak?” Haxorus asked.

“That’s Professor Birch,” said May, who was walking slowly so as not to outpace the others. “He’s the Pokémon Professor of the Hoenn region.”

“Right, you mentioned him yesterday,” said Haxorus. “You said he was going to be making a presentation at the summit.”

“Yeah,” said Max. “I don’t know who the other speakers are going to be, though.”

“Let’s ask Professor Oak,” said Ashley as she walked up to the two professors.

“Oh, hello Ashley,” said Professor Birch when he saw Ashley. “It’s been a while, hasn’t it?”

“Yeah, it has,” said Ashley. “How have you been?”

“I’ve been doing well,” said Professor Birch. “What about you? How are your Hoenn Pokémon doing here in Kanto?”

“They’ve all been doing really well,” said Ashley.

“That’s good to hear,” said Professor Birch. He turned away from Ashley and towards Georgia. “I don’t believe we’ve met. I’m Professor Birch.

“I’m Georgia,” said Haxorus with a smile. “Nice to meet you.”

“Hey, Professor Oak,” said Ashley. “I know Professor Birch is going to be one of the speakers at the summit, but I was wondering, who else is going to be speaking?”

“Well, at the moment, we have three guest speakers,” said Professor Oak. “Professor Juniper from Unova will be up first, and she’ll be talking about what we know about the origins of Human Pokémon. Then, Professor Elm from Johto will speak about Human Pokémon and the Pokémon they can breed with.”

Professor Birch nodded. “After that, I’ll be delivering my talk,” he said. “I’m planning to talk about how Human Pokémon have adapted to locations with similar habitats to the places they can be found in their native regions.”

“And I’ll be closing out the summit by talking about how Human Pokémon have integrated into both human and Pokémon societies,” said Professor Oak. “There will also be showcases of the various Human Pokémon scattered throughout the day.”

“So, where exactly are you planning on having the summit?” May asked.

“Well, we’re setting up in one of the fields near here,” said Professor Oak, looking up at May. “The stage is being set up now, but I’ll need your help to set up the chairs tomorrow.

“Of course,” said May. “You can count on me.”

“We’ll also need help sorting out the Human Pokémon that have already arrived,” said Professor Birch. “We’ve already received the Human Pokémon from Kanto, Hoenn, Kalos and Alola, and we should be getting the Johto, Sinnoh and Unova Human Pokémon tomorrow.”

“I can help with that,” said Max.

“I’ll help too,” said Haxorus.

“Excellent,” said Professor Oak. “Come with me, then.”

Professor Oak opened the door, and Ashley’s Pikachu came running out.

“Pika Pi!” said Pikachu happily.

“Hey, buddy!” said Ashley, kneeling down so Pikachu could climb up on her shoulder. “Have fun visiting everyone?”

“Chaa!” said Pikachu.

Professor Oak led Haxorus and Max into the laboratory, and he brought them to the Pokéball storage room.

“This is where we’ve been keeping the Human Pokémon,” said Professor Oak. “We plan to have a dozen of all eighteen species of Human Pokémon to give away to Trainers that attend the summit. We’re also going to have a dozen of the Unova, Kalos and Alola variants of Jenny and Joy.”

“Wow,” said Haxorus, looking at the massive group of Pokeballs. “That’s a lot of Pokémon.”

“Yes, it is, and we need help sorting through them,” said Professor Oak. “I’ve already sorted out the Kanto Human Pokémon, so we just need to sort out the Hoenn, Kalos and Alola Human Pokémon.”

“Okay,” said Max. “Where do we start?”

“Well, the Hoenn Human Pokémon are over there,” said Professor Oak, pointing at a pile of Pokéballs. “The Shellies are all in Dive Balls, and the Phoebes are in Dusk Balls.”

“Got it,” said Max, walking over to the pile of Pokéballs.

“That pile over there contains the Human Pokémon from Alola,” said Professor Oak. “The Alolan Joys are in Heal Balls, the Alolan Jennies are in Timer Balls, the Plumerias are in Nest Balls, and the Olivias are in Friend Balls.”

“Okay,” said Haxorus as she walked over to the pile of Pokéballs that Professor Oak had pointed at. Sure enough, the pile contained four different kinds of Pokéball, and Haxorus picked one up, a pink Pokéball with a blue band around the middle and a blue button, with white markings around the button. Georgia’s memories told Haxorus that the Pokéball in her hand was actually a Heal Ball. Haxorus put the Heal Ball to one side, and she quickly found the other eleven Heal Balls and put them together in a neat pile. She then picked up a white Pokéball with a red ridge on the top half, and Haxorus recognised it as a Timer Ball. As Haxorus began gathering the Timer Balls, she looked over her shoulder at Max and Professor Oak. Both of them were busy sorting out the piles of Pokéballs in front of them. While they were distracted, she could use the remote on them...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: That afternoon...

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Haxorus shook her head, and turned her attention back to the pile of Pokéballs in front of her. To her surprise, she hadn’t really felt like using the remote today. She’d really only felt the urge to use it once, and that had been when she made Professor Juniper and Doctor Fennel a married couple.

As Haxorus sorted the Pokéballs in front of her, her mind wandered to the changes she had made with the remote over the last few days. Last week, she’d been a male Axew, but now, she was a human girl, and there were eighteen species of Pokémon that looked like human women. Haxorus knew that, when she had turned Nurse Joy into a species of Pokemon, a new person, Doctor Jules, had taken the role of Pokémon Centre Doctor. Who had taken the places of the other seventeen women that had been turned into Pokémon? They had all been important or well-known figures, since most of them were involved in the Pokémon Leagues of various regions.

Not only that, but at least one new business had popped up due to the creation of the Human Pokémon. People now sold clothes that could be worn by Human Pokémon, but Haxorus was curious about when that business had been created. Had it existed when Officer Jenny was the only person that had been turned into a Human Pokémon? Or had it been created when she’d created fifteen new Human Pokémon species at once?

And then there was the Human Pokémon summit, which was scheduled for the day after tomorrow. The remote had obviously changed history when it had created the Human Pokémon, but Haxorus was slightly surprised at how little was known about Human Pokémon, even though everyone believed they’d been around for about twenty years. The fact that such a big event was focusing entirely on the Human Pokémon was proof that the world was now very different from what it had been only last week.

There was so much she just didn’t know about this new world she had created. Because she was so fascinated by how much things had changed, Haxorus had started using the remote less and less. On the first day she’d had the remote, she’d used it four times, and three times on the second day. She’d used the remote the most on her third day with the remote, when she’d created fifteen new Human Pokemon, one after the other. Yesterday, she’d used the remote twice, and today, she’d only used it once. Haxorus found that she actually really liked the world as it was now, so she didn’t want to change things up too much anymore.

After briefly checking that the remote was still in her pocket, Haxorus finished sorting out the pile of Pokéballs, separating out the Heal Balls, the Timer Balls, the Nest Balls and the Friend Balls.

“There,” said Haxorus when she was finished. “All done.”

“Yeah, me too,” said Max.

“Excellent work, you two,” said Professor Oak as he organised the Pokéballs in front of him. “I’ll finish sorting the Human Pokémon from Kalos myself.”

“Is there anything else we can do to help?” Max asked.

“No, not right now,” said Professor Oak. “I will need your help tomorrow morning, though.”

“Sure,” said Haxorus, and she and Max walked out of Professor Oak’s laboratory, where Ashley and May were waiting for them.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus doesn't use the remote.

choices: "I think I need to bond with my Human Pokémon more before battling you."
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
"Hey, Georgia! Where've you been?" Ashley asked as she waved to her.

"Helping Professor Oak sort out Human Pokémon for the summit."

"Did you see any you wanted?"

"No, they were all in their balls, so I didn't see one."

"Probably for the best; I mean you've got four Human Pokémon now, and you haven't spent a whole lot of time with them."

"That's true," Haxorus said as she pulled out the four balls that contained her Jenny, Joy, Phoebe and Elesa.

"Hey, I have an idea," May said as she walked over to Ashley and Haxorus, towering over the two. "Maybe you two should have a Pokémon battle; that way Ashley can spend more time with her old Pokémon and you can learn what your new ones are capable of."

"Cool! I can't wait to see Human Pokémon in action!!" Max excitedly said.

"I'm fine with it if you are. We can ask Professor Oak to use the mock battlefield he has in the back for it," Ashley added.

Haxorus thought for a minute and said...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Later that day...

choices: Haxorus and Joy win the battle.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“You’re on, Ashley!” said Haxorus.

“Great!” said Ashley, pumping her fists in excitement. “I’ll go get some of my old Pokémon and meet you out the back.”

“Pika!” said Ashley’s Pikachu, riding on Ashley’s shoulder.

Ashley ran into Professor Oak’s lab to retrieve her Pokémon, so Haxorus, May and Max went around to the battlefield that Professor Oak had set up behind his lab. It wasn’t much, just a grass field with the lines of a Pokémon League battlefield marked on it with paint, but it was perfect for practice matches.

Ashley emerged from Professor Oak’s lab a few minutes later and joined the other three at the battlefield. Haxorus took up a position on one side of the battlefield, and Ashley walked over to the other side.

“You’ve got four Human Pokémon, right?” asked Ashley.

“Yeah, that’s right,” said Haxorus. “Jenny, Joy, Phoebe and Elesa.”

“Okay, then,” said Ashley. “If you use your four Human Pokémon, I’ll use four of mine.”

“What Pokémon are you using?” Haxorus asked.

“I think I’ll use Bulbasaur, Quilava, Corphish and Staraptor,” said Ashley. “You ready?”

“Ready!” said Haxorus, grabbing a Pokéball.

“Alright! Bulbasaur, I choose you!” said Ashley, throwing her Pokéball. The Pokéball opened, sending out her Bulbasaur.

“Bulba!” Bulbasaur said.

“Okay, Joy! Let’s go!” said Haxorus, throwing her Pokéball into the air. There was a flash of white light as Joy emerged from her Pokéball.

“Joy,” said Joy, adjusting her clothes as she emerged.

Who wins the battle?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: "You're on, Ashley!"

choices: Ashley and Quilava win the match.
The battle is interrupted by something...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Bulbasaur, use Razor Leaf!” said Ashley.

“Saur!” said Bulbasaur. Curved leaves shot out from the bulb on Bulbasaur’s back and started flying towards Joy.

“Joy, dodge and use Hypnosis!” Haxorus ordered.

“Joy!” said Joy, nodding. She stood still, watching as the Razor Leaves flew closer and closer. Then, when it seemed like the Razor Leaves were going to hit her, she dove forward, passing between the sharply curved leaves. Once she passed through the leaves, Joy hit the ground and rolled to her feet.

“Joy,” said Joy as she got back to her feet. Her eyes glowed blue, and blue waves of hypnotic energy emanated from her eyes.

“Stop her with Vine Whip, Bulbasaur!” said Ashley.

“Bulba!” said Bulbasaur, as vines emerged from the bulb on his back. Bulbasaur’s Vine Whips shot out, and he wrapped them around Joy’s head, covering up her eyes and stopping her Hypnosis.

“Joy!” she cried out in alarm, and tried to push Bulbasaur’s vines off her face.

“Now, use Solar Beam!” said Ashley.

“Bulba,” said Bulbasaur, as bright yellow light began to gather in the bulb on Bulbasaur’s back.

“Come on, Joy, get out of those vines!” said Haxorus.

Light continued to gather in Bulbasaur’s bulb, until the entire bulb was glowing. Once his Solar Beam had finished charging, Bulbasaur pulled his Vine Whips away from Joy’s face.

“Saur!” Bulbasaur yelled as he fired his Solar Beam. A bright white beam of light shot out from Bulbasaur’s bulb, and hit Joy in the chest, knocking her back.

“Oh no! Joy!” said Haxorus as Joy slid to a stop.

“Joy,” Joy moaned as she lay on the ground, stunned. Joy’s furisode was crumpled and dirty around where the Solar Beam had hit her, but it otherwise seemed intact.

“I don’t think Joy’s in any shape to continue fighting,” said Max, watching from the sidelines.

“Yeah, you’re probably right,” said Haxorus as she walked up to Joy and helped her sit up. “Are you okay, Joy?”

“Joy,” Joy groaned sadly as she sat up. “Joy, Joy.”

“What? No, you didn’t let me down,” said Haxorus. “You did great.”

“Joy,” said Joy, smiling slightly.

“Get some rest, Joy,” said Haxorus, holding out Joy’s Pokéball, and a red beam of light shot out and pulled Joy into her Pokéball.

“Good job, Bulbasaur,” said Ashley as her Bulbasaur walked up to her.

“Bulba!” said Bulbasaur, extending one of his vines out to Ashley. Ashley and Bulbasaur high-fived, and Ashley returned Bulbasaur as well.

“You ready for the next battle?” Ashley asked.

“You bet,” said Haxorus, standing up as she grabbed another Pokéball. “Jenny, you’re up!”

Haxorus threw Jenny’s Pokéball into the air, and Jenny emerged from her Pokéball.

“Jenny!” she said as she came out of her Pokeball. Once she saw she was in a battle, Jenny removed her cap, and handed it to Haxorus. She then took off her red jacket, and passed that to Haxorus as well. Finally, Jenny removed her boots and put them on the ground next to Haxorus. Jenny was now wearing only her black shirt and skirt, as well as her stockings. Now that she was no longer worried about her clothes getting damaged in the battle, Jenny moved into a combat stance.

“Jenny!” she said, ready for battle.

“Okay, Quilava! Let’s go!” said Ashley, sending out her second Pokémon.

“Quilava!” Ashley’s Quilava said as she emerged from her Pokéball, igniting the flames on her back.

Who wins the second battle?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Ashley and Bulbasaur claim victory.

choices: Haxorus and Phoebe are the winners.
The battle is interrupted by something...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Okay, Quilava!” said Ashley. “Use Eruption!”

“Lava!” said Quilava as the flames on her back grew larger and hotter. She lowered her head, and a massive geyser of fire shot out from the flames on the back of her head. The Eruption hit Jenny, knocking her back and setting her shirt on fire. Jenny quickly pulled off the charred remains of her shirt and tossed it aside, exposing her bare breasts, leaving her in just her skirt and her stockings.

“Jenny! Use Disable!” Haxorus said.

“Ny!” said Jenny as her eyes flashed blue, and Quilava was briefly surrounded by a blue aura.

“Now, follow it up with Karate Chop!” said Haxorus.

“Quilava, use Flame Wheel!” ordered Ashley.

“Jenny!” said Jenny as her hand glowed white, and she charged at Quilava.

“Quilava!” said Quilava, cloaking herself in flames as she curled up into a ball. Quilava began rolling towards Jenny, and there was a loud bang as Jenny’s Karate Chop struck Quilava’s Flame Wheel. Quilava was knocked to the side and uncurled herself, while Jenny was knocked to the other side with her hand on fire. Jenny shook her hand, dispersing the flames, but Haxorus could see that Jenny’s hand had been burned by Quilava’s Flame Wheel.

“Let’s finish this quickly!” said Haxorus. “Use Low Kick!”

“Jen!” said Jenny as she began running towards Quilava.

“Use Flamethrower to keep her back!” said Ashley. “Don’t let her get close!”

“Quil!” said Quilava as the flames on her back grew hotter. She opened her mouth, and a stream of fire shot out from her mouth. Jenny dodged the flames, and circled around to come in at a different angle, but Quilava turned and fired another Flamethrower.

“Looks like Jenny’s fast enough to avoid Quilava’s Flamethrower,” said May, looking down at her younger brother. “I think she’s trying to tire Quilava out.”

“Yeah, but that burn on Jenny’s hand is weakening her,” said Max, craning his head to look up at May. “Jenny will probably be the one to tire out first.”

Jenny was puffing with exhaustion, and had a pained expression on her face. However, she was still able to dodge Quilava’s next Flamethrower. As she used Flamethrower, Quilava’s body was briefly surrounded by a blue aura as Jenny’s Disable wore off, allowing her to use Eruption again.

“Jenny, use Disable again, then use Low Kick!” said Haxorus.

“Jenny!” said Jenny as her eyes flashed blue again. Once more, Quilava was surrounded by a blue aura, and the stream of fire shooting out of her mouth came to an abrupt stop.

“Jenny!” Jenny yelled as she ran up to Quilava and kicked at her, aiming for Quilava’s legs. Jenny swept Quilava’s legs out from under her, causing her to fall over.

“Now, use Karate Chop!” said Haxorus.

“Ny!” Jenny said as her hands glowed white again, and she struck at Quilava, knocking her over and causing the flames on her back to go out.

“Okay, I think that’s it for Quilava,” said Ashley as she knelt down next to her Pokémon. “Great battle, Georgia.”

“Thanks,” said Haxorus. “You did great, Jenny.”

“Jenny!” said Jenny, smiling happily. She then winced, and held up her burned hand.

“Ny...” Jenny moaned.

“Here,” said Haxorus, holding out a Pokéball. Joy emerged from the Pokéball, and she immediately saw the burn on Jenny’s hand.

“Joy,” she said as she clasped her hands over her chest and used Heal Bell. The sound of a bell chiming rang out as blue waves of energy washed over Jenny, causing her burns to heal.

“Thanks, Joy,” said Haxorus.

“Jenny!” said Jenny, giving Joy a thumbs up.

“Joy,” said Joy, curtsying. Haxorus returned Joy to her Pokéball, and Jenny picked up her boots and put them back on. Once her boots were back on, Jenny put her jacket back on, but chose to leave it unzipped, leaving her breasts exposed to the world. Jenny then put her hat back on, and Haxorus returned Jenny to her Pokéball.

Over on the other side of the battlefield, Ashley returned her Quilava to her Pokéball, then pulled out her third Pokéball.

“Okay, Corphish! Your turn!” Ashley yelled as she threw the Pokéball into the air. In a flash of white light, the orange crablike Pokémon emerged.

“Corphish!” said Ashley’s Corphish.

“Corphish, huh?” said Haxorus. “Phoebe! I choose you!”

Haxorus threw her third Pokeball into the air, and Phoebe emerged in a flash of white light and twirled around to show of her dress.

“Phoe! Phoebe!” Phoebe said as she floated down to the ground next to Haxorus.

“You ready for a battle, Phoebe?” Haxorus asked.

“Be!” said Phoebe as she turned intangible. Her dress phased through her body and fell to the floor, leaving Phoebe naked, except for the flowers in her hair. Phoebe then stepped into the battlefield, ready to fight as Corphish opened and closed his pincers in anticipation.

Who wins the third battle?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus and Jenny are victorious.

choices: Haxorus and Elesa win the battle.
Ashley and Staraptor are the winners.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Corphish, use Bubble Beam!” Ashley ordered.

“Phish!” said Corphish, opening his pincers. Streams of bubbles shot out from his pincers and slammed into Phoebe. The bubbles popped as they hit Phoebe, knocking her back and slowing her down.

“Phoebe, get away from that Bubble Beam with Phantom Force!” said Haxorus.

“Be!” said Phoebe. A shadowy portal appeared under Phoebe, and she fell into the portal, disappearing from sight.

“Get ready, Corphish,” said Ashley. “Use Harden!”

“Cor!” said Corphish, and his carapace gleamed as he tensed up, ready to take a hit.

Another portal opened behind Corphish, and Phoebe emerged with her hands surrounded in ghostly grey energy.

“Phoebe!” she yelled as she punched at Corphish.

“Corphish!” said Corphish as the blow struck his carapace.

“Corphish, hit her with Crabhammer while she’s close!”

“Cor!” said Corphish as his pincers started glowing as they were covered in water.

“Phish!” Corphish yelled as he struck Phoebe with his pincers, causing an explosion of water.

“Phoe!” Phoebe cried as she was knocked into the air, then slammed into the ground, and didn’t get back up.

“Be...” Phoebe moaned, lying on the ground.

“Looks like Phoebe’s out of the battle,” said Max, watching from the sidelines.

“Wow, Corphish’s Crabhammer must be pretty powerful,” said May as she sat down next to her brother. May’s head was now at Max’s eye level, even though Max was standing while May was sitting.

“Good job, Phoebe,” said Haxorus, holding out Phoebe’s Pokéball. “Get some rest.”

A red light shot out from the Pokéball, and pulled Phoebe back into the Pokéball. Haxorus put the Pokeball back in her pocket, then pulled out a Luxury Ball.

“Okay, Elesa!” said Haxorus as she threw the Luxury Ball into the air. “Your turn!”

The Luxury Ball opened, and Elesa appeared in a flash of white light.

“Elesa,” said Elesa, reaching up with one hand and flicking her hair theatrically as she struck a pose.

“This is our first battle together, Elesa,” said Haxorus as she picked up Phoebe’s dress. “Are you ready?”

“Sa, Elesa,” said Elesa, looking over her shoulder at Haxorus with a smile and a wink.

“Great!” said Haxorus. “Then let’s see what you can do!”

Ashley held out a Pokéball and returned her Corphish, then took out her last Pokéball.

“Time for our last battle! Come on out, Staraptor!”

Ashley threw the Pokéball, and a large bird with dark grey and white feathers burst out of the Pokéball.

“Staraptor!” he said as he spread his wings and took to the air.

“You ready, Georgia?” Ashley asked.

“Absolutely!” said Haxorus.

“El!” said Elesa with a confident smirk.

“Then let’s go!” said Ashley.

“Star!” said Staraptor with a nod.

Who wins the final battle?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Ashley and Corphish are victorious.

choices: Seeing if help is needed for the summit
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Quickly going through the PokéDex to find out Elesa's moves, Haxorus yelled out, "Elesa, can you use Electric Terrain?"

"Lesa!" Elesa said with a smirk as her antennae pierced the ground and coated the area surrounding the battlefield in a yellow glow. Elesa's hair then started to recede into her scalp, changing from black to blond as she gained a fiercer look in her eyes. The points on the top of her antennae also receded back into the headphones, leaving the wires as the only protrusions from the otherwise smooth round surface.

"What just happened to Elesa?" May asked as she leaned down to talk to her brother.

"Elesa changed into her charged form!" Max excitedly replied. "When Elesa charge up electricity, their hair changes. If it's fully blond, Elesa's Electric-type moves are doubled in strength."

"Staraptor; use Aerial Ace!" Ashley yelled out.

"Star!" Staraptor said as he rose up into the air, did a black flip and started descending upon Elesa's location, white streaks surrounding him.

"What do I do?" Haxorus started to think, panicking. Staraptor closed in on Elesa and struck, but Elesa simply held onto Staraptor and started rubbing her cheek on the bird Pokémon, discharging a faint electric shock throughout its body. Elesa then jumped to the side as Staraptor landed on the ground, it's body jerking and spasming all over.

"Was that Nuzzle you just used?" Haxorus asked, causing Elesa to smirk at her and wink. She then turned to Staraptor and winked while blowing it a kiss, causing many hearts to surround the paralyzed bird. The hearts then flew into his body, causing him to stare lovingly at Elesa.

"Now, while he's distracted, use Thunder Punch!" Haxorus cried out.

Elesa nodded and coated her fists in electricity before charging at Staraptor.

"Staraptor, use Quick Attack to escape!" Ashley cried out. Staraptor tried to do as she said, but found itself staring into Elesa's eyes with a dazed look. Elesa winked at him before slamming her fist under his beak, sending him flying before landing at Ashley's feet, spirals in his eyes.

"That does it for this match, it seems," Max said as the Electric Terrain faded from the field and Elesa reverted to her default state.

"You were great, Elesa! Are your clothes okay?" Haxorus asked as she hugged her newest Human Pokémon.

"Le, Elesa," Elesa said with a smile as she pointed to scuff marks all over her outfit. She rubbed on them to make them disappear.

"Here, you deserve a good rest," Haxorus said as she sent Elesa back into her Luxury Ball.

"Great battle, Georgia," Ashley said as she approached Haxorus and stuck her hand out. "If you get more Human Pokémon, I'd like to battle you again."

"Yeah, me too," Haxorus said as she shook hands with Ashley.

"So what now?" May asked as she stood, reminding Haxorus of how tall she had made May.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus and Elesa win the battle.

choices: "...I need your help sorting more Human Pokémon."
"...I need you to pick up Professor Juniper from the airport."
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“I think it’s getting late,” said Ashley, looking up at the sky. The sun was hanging low over the horizon, and would be setting soon. “We should probably head home.”

“Yeah,” said May. “We’ll see you two tomorrow.”

“Yep!” said Ashley with a nod.

May and Max began walking off to the Pokémon Centre, while Haxorus followed Ashley back to her house. Once the two had arrived at Ashley’s house, Ashley sent out the Pokémon she’d used in their battle, and Haxorus sent out her Human Pokémon as well. Joy had used her Heal Pulse to heal up everyone, then Haxorus returned her Pokémon to their Pokéballs while Ashley sent her Pokémon back to Professor Oak’s laboratory. Gracie, Dale’s Grace, had kindly offered to clean and repair the clothes that Haxorus’ Human Pokémon had been wearing during the battle. Other than that, the rest of the day passed without incident.



When Haxorus woke up the next morning, she quickly headed downstairs and ate breakfast. Once she finished eating, she headed over to Professor Oak’s laboratory with Ashley, and the two met up with May and Max, ready to help Professor Oak set up for the Human Pokémon Summit tomorrow.

“Ah, good, you’re here,” said Professor Oak as he saw them walking up.

“Yeah!” said Ashley. “All of us are ready to help!”

“Excellent!” said Professor Oak. “Ashley, I’ll need you and your Pokémon down in the field to help with setting up the stage.”

“You got it, Professor,” said Ashley, nodding as she started walking down towards the field where the summit was being held.

“May, Max, I believe Professor Birch wanted some help inside,” said Professor Oak.

“Sure,” said May as she walked inside, ducking under the door frame as she entered the building with her brother.

“And what do you need me to do?” asked Haxorus.

“Well...” said Professor Oak.

What did Professor Oak need Haxorus' help with?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: The next day

choices: Haxorus made it to the airport.
Haxorus got lost on the way to the airport.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Professor Juniper and her wife, Doctor Fennel, are flying into Pallet Town this morning,” said Professor Oak. “If it’s not too much trouble, I’d like you to meet them at the airport and bring them to the lab.”

“Sure, I can do that,” said Haxorus.

“Thank you,” said Professor Oak. “Do you know where the airport is?”

“No, I don’t think so,” said Haxorus slowly.

“That’s alright,” said Professor Oak. He then described the way to the airport to Haxorus, who listened intently.

“Okay,” said Haxorus, once Professor Oak had finished giving her directions. “I’ll head there now.”

What happened next?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: "...I need you to pick up Professor Juniper...

choices: Haxorus finds someone to use the remote on.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Thankfully, Pallet Town was a small town, making it hard for Haxorus to get completely lost. Despite a few wrong turns, she made it to the airport in good time, and took a seat in the lobby, waiting for Professor Juniper and Doctor Fennel to arrive. There was a lot of people in the lobby today, and it was likely that they were here for the summit tomorrow as well.

Haxorus’ hand strayed to her pocket, where the remote was. Maybe she could find someone to use the remote on...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus made it to the airport.

choices: Haxorus uses the remote on Cynthia.
Haxorus uses the remote on someone else.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
As she looked over the crowd, she spotted a familiar face. She could see a tall woman with long blonde hair that covered one eye, wearing a blue sleeveless top and black pants, walking through the airport with her luggage. Haxorus recognised her as Cynthia, a Pokémon Trainer from Sinnoh that Ashley knew. When she was creating Human Pokémon a few days ago, Haxorus had also learned that Cynthia was not just a Pokémon Trainer, but was actually the Champion of the Sinnoh region.

Does Haxorus use the remote on Cynthia, or does he find someone else?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus finds someone to use the remote on.

choices: Haxorus and Cynthia are now related in some way.

Making sure no-one was looking at her, Haxorus quickly pulled out the remote. She pointed it at Cynthia and pressed a random button.

What did the remote do to Cynthia?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus uses the remote on Cynthia.

choices: Cynthia is now Haxorus' older sister.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content: How are Haxorus and Cynthia related to each other?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus and Cynthia are now related in some way.

choices: Professor Juniper and Doctor Fennel arrive.
Haxorus finds someone else to use the remote on.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
After pressing the button, Haxorus didn’t notice any changes to her mom, so she shrugged and put the remote back in her pocket. She’d been hoping that the remote would do something obvious to her mom, but she knew that not all the changes the remote made were immediately obvious.

Haxorus frowned in confusion slightly. Why was she thinking that Cynthia was her mother all of a sudden? Haxorus thought for a moment, and tried to remember Georgia’s mother. A memory flashed through her head of Cynthia playing with Georgia when she was younger. As Haxorus went through Georgia’s memories, she saw Cynthia raising Georgia, and realised that the remote had made Cynthia into her mother.

Haxorus looked back over to her mom, and saw that Cynthia was looking around for something, or maybe someone. A new memory flashed through Haxorus’ mind, and she could now remember calling her mom yesterday, after she’d finished talking with Professor Juniper at the Pokémon Centre. Haxorus had told her mom about the Human Pokémon Summit, and Cynthia had promised to meet her at the airport.

Haxorus got up from her seat, and began walking up to Cynthia.

“Mom!” Haxorus called out as she got close.

Cynthia turned her head at the sound of Haxorus’ voice, and her face lit up with a happy smile when she saw Haxorus.

“Georgia! You’re here!” Cynthia said, opening her arms for a hug.

“Yep!” said Haxorus as she gave her mom a hug. “It’s good to see you again, Mom.”

“Aw, thanks,” said Cynthia. “It’s good to see you, too. How have you been?”

“I’ve been doing great!” said Haxorus. “How about you?”

“Oh, you know how it is,” said Cynthia. “I’m just glad I was able to get away from my duties as Champion and spend some time with you. How was your journey through Unova?”

“It was amazing,” said Haxorus. “I’m planning on travelling through Kanto next.”

“Still planning on becoming a Dragon Buster?” Cynthia asked, teasing her daughter a little.

“Um, about that,” said Haxorus. “Over the last few days, I’ve really begun to get interested in Human Pokémon, especially since I picked up four Human Pokémon since I’ve arrived in Kanto.”

“You did mention that during our call yesterday,” said Cynthia. “I can’t wait to meet your Human Pokémon for myself.”

“I can show them to you later,” said Haxorus. “But anyway, I was thinking about maybe becoming a Human Pokémon Trainer, instead of a Dragon Buster.”

“I think that’s a wonderful idea,” said Cynthia. “I know that I didn’t have any sort of goals like that when I was your age.”

“Thanks, Mom,” said Haxorus, blushing. “Anyway, I’m supposed to be meeting Professor Juniper and Doctor Fennel here and show them the way to Professor Oak’s lab.”

“Do you mind if I wait with you?” asked Cynthia. “I’d like to spend some more time with you.”

“Yeah, sure,” said Haxorus. “I’d like to spend some more time with you too, Mom.”

What happened next?
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Cynthia is now Haxorus' mother.

choices: Haxorus finds someone to use the remote on.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content: As Haxorus and her mom waited for Professor Juniper and Doctor Fennel to arrive, an idea began to form in Haxorus’ head. The remote had turned Cynthia into Haxorus’ mother, without altering her life or personality all that much. Maybe she could find someone else she could use the remote on to turn them into her father, as well...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Haxorus finds someone else to use the remote on.

Steven Stone, Champion of the Hoenn region.

After scanning the crowd for a few seconds, Haxorus spotted someone that she thought could be an interesting candidate for her new father. She pulled out the remote and pointed it at him, and pressed the same button that she’d used on Cynthia to make her Haxorus’ mother.

Who was Haxorus' new father?

Burnet, Pokemon Researcher currently residing in Alola.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content: Perhaps Haxorus, in her curiousity, decided to have a second mother and found...
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Someone else...

choices: Lillie meets up with the others
Lillie and Gladion approach their new family
Lillie approaches with Juniper and Fennel
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
"Cynthia, Georgia! There you are!!" Haxorus heard the woman with long blond hair meticulously styled say as she approached them.

"Lusamine; it's been too long!" Cynthia said as she rose to greet the woman with a hug. Then, to Haxorus' surprise, the two kissed each other on the lips for a brief moment before Cynthia asked, "How are things at the Aether Foundation, honey?"

"The same old thing over and over," Lusamine said with a groan. "I swear, if it wasn't for Wicke helping me out, I'd lose my mind with all the paperwork." She then turned to Haxorus and said, "And how's my oldest daughter doing?"

"Oldest daughter?" Haxorus thought. She then dove into her memories and discovered memories of herself as a little girl playing games with another girl with a blond ponytail and a young boy with hair over his right eye, like his mother. Snapping back into the present, Haxorus decided to say, "I'm doing okay, but I am feeling a little homesick."

"Well, if you ever need to come back home, you're more than welcome to do so. I know Lillie would be excited to play with you some more."

"Speaking of, aren't she and Gladion with you as well? I thought we were arranging a mini family get-together here," Cynthia asked.

"Well..."
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Lusamine, President of the Aether Foundation.
