"Nah, just kidding; Ash's Mom told me who you all were!"
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
"She's the only Delia who was born psychic and decided to become a Gym Leader." Ash said as he looked at the photo. "I remember it was a hard fight; her Kadabra and Sabrina were tough opponents. It took a Haunter making Sabrina laugh for me to win her Gym."

"And I'm still sore about it to this day," a voice that sounded just like Delia said. Looking over, Haxorus saw the Delia in the picture standing in the doorway, along with a naked Sabrina.

"Aunt Delia!" Ash screamed as he ran over to hug Delia. "I didn't know you were coming!"

Ash's now Aunt Delia hugged Ash back and said, "Well, your mother called me the other night to say you were coming back home, so I had Sabrina use Teleport to take us here to welcome you back."

"That's so cool!" Ash said as he turned to hug Sabrina. "It's good to see you too!"

"Bri, Sabrina," Sabrina said as she hugged Ash back.

Haxorus walked over and said, "Um, hi; I'm..."

"Georgia, I know. I have the power to read minds."

"Really?"
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: "She's the only Delia who was born psyc...

choices: Aunt Delia uses the remote on Haxorus.
Aunt Delia uses the remote on Sabrina.
Aunt Delia uses the remote on herself.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
Really, said Aunt Delia’s voice in Haxorus’ mind. I can speak telepathically, too.

“Wow!” said Iris. “That was amazing!”

“Thanks,” said Aunt Delia out loud, smiling at Iris. “It’s actually pretty useful, since I can talk with Sabrina during battle without saying a word.”

“Really?” Haxorus asked.

Yes, a second voice said in Haxorus’ mind. It helps that we Sabrinas also have telepathic abilities.

“Hey, Ash, is it alright if I speak with Georgia for a moment?” Aunt Delia asked out loud. “I have a few things I need to ask her about.”

“Sure,” said Ash. “I’ll take Iris and Cilan to Professor Oak’s lab to see all my Pokemon. You and Georgia can meet us there.”

“Sounds like a plan,” said Aunt Delia. “Have fun.”

Once Ash, Iris and Cilan had left, Aunt Delia turned to face Haxorus. Her eyes glowed blue, and Haxorus felt something tugging at her pocket. After a few seconds, the remote was pulled out of Haxorus’ pocket, and it floated over to Aunt Delia’s hand.

So, this is the remote that did all this, Aunt Delia thought, causing Haxorus’ eyes to go wide as her jaw dropped.

Oh, don’t look so surprised, Haxorus, Aunt Delia thought. You’ve been thinking the changes this thing has apparently made ever since I arrived.

I still think it’s impossible, thought Sabrina. There’s no way the Sabrina Pokemon species used to be a single human.

“No, it’s true,” said Haxorus, looking down guiltily. “You used to be a single person. So did the Jenny and Joy species.”

Yeah, that’s what I can see from your memories, thought Aunt Delia. You also forgot to mention you’re actually Iris’ Haxorus, and not her friend Georgia.

And why does no-one else remember how things supposedly used to be? thought Sabrina.

Maybe only the person who’s holding the remote can see how things have changed, thought Aunt Delia. Or maybe there’s a button that can change whether or not someone is aware or unaware.

“I honestly have no idea,” said Haxorus. “I’m still finding out what the remote can do.”

“Well, there’s only one way to find out,” said Aunt Delia, holding up the remote.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Aunt Delia knows about the remote.

1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
When she pressed the button, Aunt Delia staggered backwards, nearly dropping the remote as an expression of horrified surprise appeared on her face.

“Bri?!” Aunt Delia’s Sabrina said out loud. Are you okay? she continued telepathically.

“I... I’m fine,” said Aunt Delia. “I just... wasn’t expecting that.”

“What do you mean?” Haxorus asked.

“My memories only go back for a few minutes,” Aunt Delia said.

That’s impossible, thought Sabrina. I’ve known you for years.

I know, and I remember that too, thought Aunt Delia. But I can only remember that from about a few minutes ago, which must have been when the remote created me.

“But… you just finished talking about how you knew about that,” said Haxorus. “Why are you acting so surprised now?”



So, this is the remote that created me, Aunt Delia thought, causing Haxorus’ eyes to go wide as her jaw dropped.

Oh, don’t look so surprised, Haxorus, Aunt Delia thought. While I have a lifetime of memories, I’ve only been able to remember those memories for the last few minutes.

I still think it’s impossible, thought Sabrina. There’s no way that you were created a few minutes ago.

“No, it’s true,” said Haxorus, looking down guiltily. “Aunt Delia didn’t exist until I used the remote on Ash’s mom.”

Yeah, that’s what I can see from your memories, thought Aunt Delia. You also forgot to mention you’re actually Iris’ Haxorus, and not her friend Georgia.

And why does no-one else remember how things supposedly used to be? thought Sabrina.

Maybe only the person who’s holding the remote can see how things have changed, thought Aunt Delia. Or maybe there’s a button that can change whether or not someone is aware or unaware.

“I honestly have no idea,” said Haxorus. “I’m still finding out what the remote can do.”

“Well, there’s only one way to find out,” said Aunt Delia, holding up the remote.



“Huh,” said Aunt Delia out loud. So only the person holding the remote is aware of the changes, unless someone uses this button to make them aware, she continued telepathically, rubbing her thumb over the button that had made her aware.

“Wait, you used the remote?” Haxorus asked.

Yeah, I did, thought Aunt Delia. You really think I was aware all this time?

Haxorus isn’t the only one, thought Sabrina. Haxorus and I both remember the conversation we had about your awareness of the remote’s changes, but your memory of the conversation is different.

Which means that you and Haxorus have memories of the new reality that was created when I made myself aware, thought Aunt Delia.

That’s the only logical conclusion, thought Sabrina. “Bri?” Sabrina asked out loud, tilting her head to the side curiously.

“Good question,” said Aunt Delia. “What do we do now?”
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.title: Aunt Delia is now aware of the remote's changes.

choices: Sabrina and Aunt Delia want to stay aware.
Sabrina and Aunt Delia want to become unaware again.
Haxorus tries to take the remote back from Aunt Delia.
1151222111211121222223312311121221112122.content:
“Brina Sa, Sa, Sabrina Na,” Sabrina said out loud, pointing at the remote in Aunt Delia’s hand.

“Alright, if you’re sure,” said Aunt Delia, pointing the remote at Sabrina and pressing the button her thumb was on. Sabrina staggered and clutched at her head as a flood of new memories entered her head.

Sabrina! thought Aunt Delia. Are you okay?!

“Sa...” said Sabrina softly, then shook her head. Yeah, I am now, she continued telepathically. I just suddenly gained a lifetime of memories as a human.

So, you’re the original Sabrina? Aunt Delia thought. I can see from Haxorus’ memories that she used the remote on a picture of you when you were a human.

I... I must be, thought Sabrina. If I wasn’t, my memory would only go back about a day. But in all honesty, I can’t tell which set of my memories is the original. My human memories and my Pokemon memories both seem so real.

“But... both of you have always remembered the way things were before I used the remote!” said Haxorus. “Why are we having this conversation for the third time?!”



So, this is the remote that created me and made Sabrina a Pokemon, Aunt Delia thought, causing Haxorus’ eyes to go wide as her jaw dropped.

Oh, don’t look so surprised, Haxorus, Aunt Delia thought. Sabrina still has her old memories of her human life, and my memory only goes back a few minutes.

I still think it’s impossible, thought Sabrina. There’s no way that remote could do all this.

“No, it’s true,” said Haxorus, looking down guiltily. “I used the remote to create the Sabrina species, and make Ash’s mom into a huge family.”

Yeah, that’s what I can see from your memories, thought Aunt Delia. You also forgot to mention you’re actually Iris’ Haxorus, and not her friend Georgia.

And why do we remember how things used to be, but nobody else does? thought Sabrina.

Maybe it’s because of our psychic powers, thought Aunt Delia. It also seems like the person using the remote is always aware of the changes. Maybe there’s a button that can make others aware or unaware.

“I honestly have no idea,” said Haxorus. “I’m still finding out what the remote can do.”

“Well, there’s only one way to find out,” said Aunt Delia, holding up the remote.



So, it seems that Haxorus is once again unaware of the changes, thought Sabrina.

Seems like it, thought Aunt Delia. And I can see that you remember two different versions of the conversation we had, while I only remember one.

That’s right, thought Sabrina. I can remember the conversation we had when you made yourself aware, and the original conversation, while you can only remember the original version of the conversation.

And Haxorus can only remember the version of the conversation that happened in this new reality, where you’re now aware, thought Aunt Delia.

“What do you mean, now aware?” Haxorus asked. “You two have always been aware. You just finished telling me that twice, before Sabrina started acting like she’d just been... made... aware...”

Haxorus trailed off as she realised that this must be what it was like for everyone else that the remote had been used on.

“Brina,” said Sabrina, crossing her arms over her naked breasts. Now that we’re both aware, what should we do?

Honestly, I think I’m okay with this new life, thought Sabrina. I wouldn’t mind staying as a Pokemon, at least for a while.

“The only question is, what do we do with Haxorus?” Aunt Delia asked, as she and Sabrina turned to face Haxorus.

Can’t hurt to try it, thought Aunt Delia, pointing the remote at Haxorus and pointing the button. When she did so, the confused expression on Haxorus’ face disappeared.

“So, Haxorus, what have we been talking about just now?” Aunt Delia asked.

“Oh, you just wanted to know where I found that remote,” Haxorus said, then frowned. “Wait, why did you call me Haxorus? You do know I’m Georgia, right?”

“Oh, sorry,” said Aunt Delia. “Slip of the tongue. I’ve had a lot on my mind recently.”

“Oh, okay,” said Georgia. “Anyway, I’ve got to meet up with Ash, Iris and Cilan at Professor Oak’s lab. Do you want to come with me?”

“No, I’m afraid we need to get back to Saffron City,” said Aunt Delia. “Do you mind if I keep this?” she asked, holding up the remote.

“Sure,” said Georgia. “I haven’t been able to get it to work, and I have no idea what it might be for.”

“Thanks,” said Aunt Delia. “Now, we need to get going. Sabrina, use Teleport.”

Of course, Sabrina thought. “Sabrina!” she said out loud, raising her hands. In an instant, the two vanished from Ash’s house, and reappeared in the Saffron City Gym. Once Aunt Delia and Sabrina had arrived, the two of them looked at the remote that was still in Aunt Delia’s hands.

Now, what should we do with this? Aunt Delia thought.

Ash sighed as he repositioned himself on the chair. He was now wearing an orange dress with poofy shoulders and a white collar with a blue ribbon tied around his neck. Red low-heel shoes and a pink bow in his hair completed his new ensemble, while his backpack had changed to a large pink purse.

The sudden change caught Haxorus off guard for a second, but eventually he asked, "What's the matter, Ash?"

"I was just thinking about how much I've wanted a Joy," Ash said. "Having one would really help me win Pokémon Contests."

"Contests?"

"Yeah, they may be a recent fad in Kanto, but I've loved them ever since my visit to Hoenn! And I can't wait to show off what I learned here at home!"

"Pika, Pika!!"

Ash giggled as he lifted Pikachu up to him and said, "Don't worry; I haven't forgotten all the contests you've helped me win with your cool moves!"

"I don't think Joys are that hard to find, Every region has Joys, don't they?"

"Yeah, but they're incredibly hard to find. The only ones I see hang out around Pokémon Centers and I can never tell if they're caught or not! And I have so many ideas for performance routines that Joy could look so cute in!!"

Haxorus struggled to hold back his laughter at seeing Ash in his current state. "He's like a completely different person! This remote is incredibly powerful!"

1231.content:
“This is quite odd,” Max said, picking up the remote and examining it, “Why would a remote just be lying around this forest?”

“Maybe someone lost it?” Brock suggested, taking a look at the remote as well, “Maybe someone brought this remote along with them to watch some television?”

“I don’t think so, Brock,” May commented, staring at the remote as she stared right in front of it, “I mean, this doesn’t look like a remote you would use for a television, unless it’s a newly updated one, I suppose.”

“That’s what I was about to say...” Max sighed, continuing to expect the remote, his fingers casually, yet not noticeably moving over one of the buttons as the remote was pointed in front of May’s direction. “You could’ve let me explain, you know, you get to say everything...”

As the remote was pointed at May, a ball of energy started to form in front of the remote, before finishing and being shot out in a beam of magic, rushing straight for and hitting May. She had barely a chance to react as the magic engulfed her body, changing what the very world thought of her as...

"Wat Wappen?"the poor tot asked confusedly

Max her now older brother just smiled and picked his baby sister up"hmmm what do you mean?did you have an accident sissy?"

May just bites her lips scaredly.she knows something is off but she can't tell what.she doesn't respond to Max's question but instead grabs the remote from him and playfully pushes a button

12311221.content:
Upon playfully pushing one of the buttons, magic coming from the remote seemed to appear once more around May's now babyish body, soon engulfing her as her appearance seemed to change itself once again.

The magic once again cleared away after a minute or two, showing that May once again was back looking like a ten year old, but her clothing was...different. Her bandanna that she would always wear was gone, allowing her hair to flow on it's own, and instead of her trainer vest and shorts, she now had a red onesie matching in color, with a noticeably thick diaper appearing underneath.

"Max!" May screamed in a confused manner, poking at her onesie, "What did that Remote do to me? Why am I dressed like this?"

Max, still affected by the change of reality caused by the remote, smiled. "Oh, May, you've always been dressed like this." He said as if this was always the case, going over to hold her hand. "Now, have you had an accident yet, May?"

"A accident!" May said, taken aback at what Max had to say, "When have I ever...had a...a-accident.." She began to say, before her stomach began to rumble, indicating that she clearly had to use the bathroom. What did May then do?

13.title: Dawn

choices: Press the Blue Body Swap Button
Press the Green Life Swap Button
Press one of the other buttons
131.content:
Ash and Dawn were on their way to Pallet Town, Brock having left for Pewter City in order to meet with his family and watch over the Pewter Gym for a while. Ash was trailing a few steps behind Dawn, hoping to spot a few Pokémon in the trees and bushes along the path. What he ended up finding, however, was not a Pokémon but an odd remote lying beside the road.. Curious, he picked up the remote and took a closer look at it, noticing that it had many buttons that were all different colors. Not knowing any of their functions, he randomly pressed the blue button.

In the blink of an eye, Ash felt very different. His perspective had shifted slightly downwards and he noticed weight in areas were there had been none before, namely his chest and the back of his head, and yet other parts of his body felt lighter. Irritated by the new sensations, Ash took a peek at his chest and was shocked to see two mounds on his formerly flat chest. Taking a hand to his chest to confirm whether this was actually real, he noticed his now smaller, feminine hands and the lighter and smoother skin that now covered them. He then moved his hands to the back of his head and noticed the long hair that covered it now. Pulling a strand of it in front of his face, he noticed its familiar blue color. It then dawned on him that there was one area of his body he still had to check for major changes. He let go of his hair and moved his hand downwards. Once it reached where his manhood would have been, realization hit him, now her, like a ton of bricks: she was female now. And not just that, she now had Dawn's body.

Looking over her new body, she noticed that oddly enough, she was still wearing her own clothes, only re-sized for Dawn's, now her, body. When Ash looked up again, she noticed that Dawn had stopped walking and was now looking back at her. "Is something wrong Ash?", asked Dawn, "You suddenly stopped walking." Ash looked at Dawn, immediately noticing that she, now he, was in her original body wearing Dawn's clothes, only re-sized for Ash's body. However, it seemed that Dawn was completely oblivious to what was going on as he did not show the slightest reaction to seeing his original body. Seeing this, Ash came to the realization that this remote could alter reality. By pressing that button, Ash and Dawn had swapped bodies and reality was adjusted so that only she would know.

"Don’t worry, nothing wrong over here", Ash told Dawn in order to not draw attention to the fact that there really was something off, "I thought my shoe was untied, but it was just my imagination." "Oh, okay. Let’s continue to Pallet Town then", Dawn turned back around and continued walking, Ash quickly following a few steps behind.
Ash was amazed at the power the remote in her hands held and was eager to see what she could do with it. Thinking back, she remembered that when she pressed the button, she was aiming the remote in Dawn's direction, so this must be how the target is selected.

Ash wasn't sure how she should go on from here. There were so many possibilities in just the palm of her hand. Sure, she could just press the blue button again and swap back, but trying out the other buttons promised to be exciting. In any case, reality was going to be adjusted, so nobody would notice anyway.
131.title: Ash finds the remote

choices: Undo one ore both of the swaps
Experiment some more with the other buttons
1312.content:
Ash wanted to keep experimenting with the remote. Sure, she could just press the blue button again and undo the body swap with Dawn, but she needed to satisfy her ever growing curiosity. So, deciding on the green button, she took aim at Dawn once again and pressed it.

In an instant, Ash was met with another change in perspective. This time however, it was not a change in height but rather she found herself in a different position than before. Ash noticed that Dawn was no longer ahead of her, so she turned around and saw her original body, wearing her original clothes standing in the exact same position she had been in just a few seconds ago. She then looked down at herself and saw that she was now wearing Dawn's outfit, which was now once again covering the body it belonged to.

"What is it, Dawn? Why did you stop?", Ash heard her original body ask. Wait, did he just call her 'Dawn'? So Ash had swapped positions and clothes with Dawn and was now being referred to as 'Dawn' by the real Dawn. Did that mean they swapped lives? "It's nothing, Ash. I thought I heard some Pokémon over there, but there weren’t any", Ash answered, including his name to see if he was right. "Well, if you do see some, tell me. I want to catch a few new team members before we get to Pallet Town", Dawn in Ash's body said enthusiastically. Ash was shocked, this was exactly what she wanted to do originally before finding the remote. This confirmed it, now Ash hadn’t only swapped bodies with Dawn, but lives as well.

Having gotten confirmation on what the green button did, Ash turned back around and they both continued on their way to Pallet Town. While she was walking, she noticed that interestingly, she wasn’t walking the way she normally did but in a more feminine manner, just like Dawn would. This meant that the remote even helps the user act like the life they swap into. Ash couldn’t believe it, she was now Dawn in any way imaginable.

Still, what should she do from here on out? Yes, she could undo one or both of the swaps she had made, but where would be the fun in that? There were still many more buttons to experiment with, or she could just live as Dawn for now and keep further swaps for another day. In addition, even though Ash was now living another life, the remote was still in her hand. She could now be certain that the remote would follow her whenever she performed a swap like this.
1312.title: Press the Green Life Swap Button

choices: Press the Yellow Personality Swap Button
Press the Red Clothes Swap Button
Press one of the other buttons
13122.content: Having swapped not only bodies but also lives with Dawn just by pressing two buttons on this remote, Ash just had to know what the others did. So, eager to experiment some more, she wondered which of the buttons she hadn't pressed yet to use next.
13122.title: Experiment some more with the other buttons
