Press the Purple Occupation Swap Button
Press one of the other buttons
131223.content: Deciding against the former two, Ash moved on to the next set of buttons.
131223.title: Press one of the other buttons

choices: He turned into a copy of Dawn
He turned into a female version of Ash
1312233.content:
Seeing as the first six buttons on the remote were grouped together, Ash thought that they may have similar functions. So, to try out something different, she pressed a button in a different part of the remote while aiming at Dawn in Ash's body and life.

What did the remote do with Dawn?
1312233.title: Press one of the other buttons

13123.content:
For now, Ash was satisfied with the results of her swaps and decided to just live as Dawn for a while. They both continued on their way to Pallet Town until it was getting progressively darker. On 'her' Pokétch, Ash found a nearby Pokémon-Center and they decided that it would be best to spend the night there.

They made their way to the Pokémon-Center fairly quickly and on entering the lobby were greeted by Nurse Joy. Although they weren’t the only trainers to have come here, both of them were able to get a room for the night. Once Nurse Joy had given them their keys, they left the lobby and headed upstairs to their rooms. Looking at their room numbers, they noticed that they weren’t adjacent, so after climbing the stairs they wished each other a good night and headed towards their respective rooms.

Upon entering her room, Ash let herself fall backwards onto her bed. This day had been wild. Finally, she could get some well needed rest. Looking at the remote in her hands though, a different thought crossed her mind: Why not have some more fun with it? Even though Dawn was in his room, that didn’t mean that she had nobody to swap with. In fact, there was a certain nurse that offered quite a few interesting possibilities for swapping. Just what should she do?
13123.title: Live as Dawn for now

choices: Press a button she already used
131231.content:
Ash finally succumbed to curiosity as she decided to use the remote on Nurse Joy. After lounging on her bed for a while, she got up again and left her room, heading downstairs for the lobby.

Upon reaching the lobby, Ash noticed that it was empty. Well, empty except for Nurse Joy who apparently had just finished her shift and was getting ready to head back to her room. This was Ash's chance, so she had to choose a button.
131231.title: Swap something with Nurse Joy

choices: Press the Blue Body Swap Button
Press the Green Life Swap Button
1312311.content: Sticking to what she already knew, Ash pressed a button she had used before.
1312311.title: Press a button she already used

choices: The night passes without any events
13123112.content:
Ash decided that she wanted to do a life swap and so, aiming the remote at Nurse Joy without her noticing, pressed the green Button.

In an instant, Ash found herself in a completely different position. Examining herself, she saw that while she still had the body of Dawn she was now dressed in Nurse Joy's pink dress and white apron as well as her white cap. Looking towards the stairs, where she had been standing mere seconds ago was now Nurse Joy, dressed in Dawn's black and pink dress, pink boots and white hat. Both outfits were re-sized for the bodies they now covered as reality had adjusted.

When Nurse Joy in Dawn's life noticed Ash looking in her direction, she gave a friendly wave and came over to the desk Ash now found herself behind.
"Good evening, Nurse Joy!", she greeted Ash, "I see you're finally able to get some rest."
"Ah, good evening to you too!", Ash answered politely, "Yes, my shift just ended so I'll return to my room and try to get a good night's sleep."
"Yeah, I guess I should be doing the same thing," Nurse Joy replied, "I don't even know why I came down here in the first place. Anyway, good night!"
"Thank you and sleep well!", Ash replied as Nurse Joy was already headed back to the stairs.
With that, Ash made her way to Nurse Joy's, now her room.

Once inside 'her' room, Ash sat down on her bed and examined the room. That was when she noticed a peculiar photo that hung on the wall opposite of her bed, just over a small table with a vase of flowers. Curious, Ash got up to take a look at the picture and was astounded by what she saw. It was a photo of Nurse Joy's family, which in and of itself wouldn't be out of the ordinary, if it weren't for the fact that every Nurse Joy in the photo looked exactly like Dawn. Seeing this, Ash realized the ripple effect her swap with Nurse Joy had. As all Nurse Joys looked the same and she swapped into the life of one of them with another body, they now all looked liked her.

Ash couldn't help but laugh at this. She didn't expect something like this to happen, but was glad that it did. Having seen once again just how powerful the remote was, Ash decided to get ready for bed and keep further experiments for tomorrow.
13123112.title: Press the Green Life Swap Button

131231121.content:
After an uneventful night, Ash woke up from a very pleasant sleep to the sound of an alarm clock. Turning off the alarm, she immediately realized that the last day had, in fact, not been a dream and that she was still in the body of Dawn, now living the life of Nurse Joy. Looking at the clock once more she realized that it was very early in the morning, which was to be expected given that it was her, at least now that she was living this life, who was running the Pokémon-Center. So, in order not to fail the responsibilities of this life, Ash started to get ready for the day.

Thanks to the remote's power, Ash was able to perfectly replicate Joy's morning routine. From making her bed, over her bathroom and dressing routine to preparing breakfast for herself, it was almost as if she was running on auto pilot. Once she was done with breakfast, she cleaned her used dishes and got ready start her work in the Pokémon-Center. She grabbed the remote she had left on her night stand while she slept and headed for the door. On her way to there, she passed a full body mirror and was able to get another glance at herself. It was still so surreal, looking in the mirror and not only seeing Dawn in the reflection, but Dawn with Nurse Joy's signature uniform and hair style. Still, she had to get going and open the Pokémon-Center. And so, Ash turned away from the mirror, left her room and got on her way to start working as Nurse Joy.

It had now been three hours since Ash had started her shift and nothing had really happened so far. Admittedly, it was still fairly early, but she had expected there would have been a bit more for her to do. It wasn't much later though that two familiar faces came downstairs from their rooms and were heading towards her.
"Good morning, Nurse Joy", the real Nurse Joy living Dawn's life said, "We wanted to return the keys to our rooms."
"Of course", Ash replied, "I hope you had a pleasant night."
"Definitely!", Dawn in Ash's life and body exclaimed, "I slept like a rock."
"That’s good to hear", Ash smiled like Nurse Joy normally would, "Well then, you two are good to go. Have a safe trip!"
Both thanked Ash and waved goodbye before heading towards the exit.

Now, Ash had to act fast. If she didn’t want to get separated from her own life, she had to quickly use the remote and swap back with the real Nurse Joy. And so, Ash took the remote and got ready to swap back into Dawn's life.
131231121.title: The night passes without any events

choices: She waits until they reach Pallet Town
1312311211.content:
Not wasting a single second, Ash grabbed the remote and took aim at Nurse Joy. Just before she and Dawn had made their way out of the Pokémon-Center, Ash pressed the green button and instantly found herself next to Dawn and on her way to Pallet Town. She had successfully returned to Dawn's life.

After a while, Ash began to ponder once again about the remote and what she could possibly do with it. Swapping lives with Nurse Joy had certainly been an interesting experience, especially considering that she got to see what kinds of ripple effects these swaps could cause. She definitely wanted to do more of these swaps, she just had to find the right target. At least for now though, Dawn was the only one she could swap with until they reached Pallet Town, which according to her Pokétch they should be able to reach by the next day.

This in mind, Ash wondered whether she should have a little more fun with the remote before they reached their destination or wait until she had a broader range of targets.
1312311211.title: She swaps back successfully

13123112111.content:
It was the afternoon of the next day and Ash and Dawn had reached their destination: Pallet Town. Ash was glad to finally be home again, but Dawn, who was currently living her life, was the one to express these feelings.

"Ah, it’s so good to be back home!", Dawn exclaimed, "I can’t wait to see the others again!"

"Yeah, it’s great to finally see your home town.", Ash replied like Dawn would, "So, where are we headed?"

"Let’s first head to my house and after that to Professor Oak's lab.", Dawn proposed.

"Sure thing Ash, lead the way!", Ash agreed and followed closely behind Dawn.

It wasn’t long before they reached Ash's home, a small white house with a red roof surrounded by a pretty garden and beautiful landscape. Most notably, however, was the Mr. Mime watering the flowers in the garden.

"Hey Mimey, I'm back!", Dawn called out, causing the Pokémon to pause it's work.

"Mime!", Mimey exclaimed happily running over to Dawn.

"Mimey, this is Dawn.", Dawn pointed at Ash, "She's a friend of mine from Sinnoh.

"Nice to meet you.", Ash smiled sweetly like Dawn usually would.

"Mi-Mime!", Mimey greeted Ash friendly.

"Is Mom home too?", asked Dawn.
13123112111.title: She waits until they reach Pallet Town

choices: Choose a button from the first group
Choose a button from another group
13123112112.content:
In the end, curiosity got the better of her. Ash just had to know what the other buttons did, so she decided to use one of the still unused ones on Dawn once more. Still, there were a lot of options to choose from.

There were four buttons left in the first group, which seemed to include all the buttons that swapped something between user and target. However, there were even more groups of buttons on the remote that could function in a lot of other ways. Maybe she could try out one of those.
13123112112.title: She uses the remote

choices: Dawn is turned into Ash's twin
Dawn is turned into a female version of Ash
131231121122.content:
Eager to find out what the other groups had to offer, Ash aimed the remote at Dawn and pressed one of the buttons from the other groups.

What was the result?
131231121122.title: Choose a button from another group

1312311211221.content:
Once Ash had pressed the button, the first thing she did was to look at herself to confirm that she hadn't accidentally pressed the body swap button. She quickly confirmed that she still had both the body and life of Dawn, so she wondered what exactly it was that the remote did.

What she saw was that were her old body stood before was now another Dawn, this one however dressed in a version of Dawn's normal outfit that had taken on a few features of Ash's original clothes. She wore a dress identical to the one Ash currently found herself in, except for the pink parts being colored red. Her head was covered by a version of Dawn's hat that inherited the red of Ash's cap as the color for the pokéball symbol. While her hair clips were still colored yellow, her scarf now shared that same color like the stripe on Ash's jacket did. Lastly, instead of being colored pink, her boots sported the same red color Ash's original shoes did.

Ash was dumbfounded. There were now two Dawns, but she was unsure whether that was the only thing the remote did. She wouldn’t remain in the dark for long, however, as the original, now new, Dawn spoke up.

"It sure is fun exploring Kanto with you sis! Too bad there are no contests for you to participate in," she said enthusiastically.

"Huh? Yeah, seems like they are only hosted in Sinnoh and Hoenn," Ash replied.

"Still, I'm so glad that you want to cheer me on when I take on the Kanto gyms, Dawn," Dawn said as she smiled at Ash.

Huh, so apparently she and Dawn were now twin sisters and this new Dawn wanted to take on the Kanto gyms. Did that mean Ash's original life was converted into this new Dawn or was it replaced? She decided to test that.

"You know you can always count on me, Ash," she said.

"Yeah, I do. And you should know that I don't like that nickname, just call me Ashley," Dawn replied a little annoyed.

"Just teasing," Ash tried to laugh it off.

Okay, her original life had been converted into this new Dawn. She wondered whether or not this was reversible, but decided to think about that at a later time. For now, she thought about whether she should keep experimenting with the many unused buttons of the remote or if she should keep things as they were for now and explore this new reality.
1312311211221.title: Dawn is turned into Ash's twin

choices: Ash decides to stay as Dawn
Ash swaps back and lives as Ashley
13123112112212.content:
Ash decided to explore this new reality for now, curious about what else might have changed. She put the remote into her bag and continued her journey with her new twin sister. Along the way, she wondered about two things:

What were they going to do in Pallet Town? They were originally going to visit Ash's mother, but now that they were twins they were both from Sinnoh. She just had to wait and see what Dawn, now Ashley, would do once they got there.

What about their Pokémon? It seemed as though neither of them had been to Kanto yet, so they both would most likely only have Pokémon from Sinnoh. But what about their first Pokémon? Ash probably still had Dawn's Piplup, but as they both would have started their journey in Twinleaf Town Dawn, or Ashley, probably got one of the Sinnoh starters as well.

After a few more hours of walking, the two finally reached their destination as Ash noticed the familiar sight of Pallet Town on the horizon.

"We're almost there, I can already see Pallet Town in the distance," Ash exclaimed happily.

"Yeah, now we just need to find Professor Oak's lab. Can you check your Pokétch, Dawn?" Dawn replied.

"Sure thing," Ash nodded as she started to type on her Pokétch.

Although Ash could have just led them to the lab - this was his home town after all - he decided to use the Pokétch as to not make her sister wonder how she knew all this. Once the Pokétch displayed the location of Professor Oak's lab, they headed there right away.

"I hope we will find many new Pokémon that we haven't already seen in Sinnoh," Dawn grinned at Ash.

"Me too, Ashley. Maybe even a few that can help me in future contests," Ash replied.

They quickly made their way to the Professor's lab, which was located outside of town and easily recognizable thanks to it's signature windmill. Upon arrival, they were greeted by a dark haired boy in a green shirt and red shorts Ash recognized as Tracey.

"Hi, I'm Tracey, the assistant of Professor Oak. Can I help you two?" Tracey greeted the twins.

"Hello, my name is Ashley and this is my twin sister Dawn," Dawn pointed at Ash who greeted Tracey politely. "We're from Twinleaf Town in the Sinnoh Region and want to start our journey through Kanto."

"Ah, you must be here to ask the Professor for a Pokédex, correct?" Tracey guessed.

"That's right," Dawn answered with a nod.

"Well then, please come with me," Tracey went ahead into the lab, the twins following closely behind.

It didn't take long until they found themselves face to face with Professor Oak, who greeted them with a friendly smile.

"Hello you two. So, you want to start your journey through the Kanto region?" the Professor asked.

"Yes, that's right," Ash replied. "My sister Ashley wants to take on the Kanto gyms."

"And what about you? You don't want to challenge the gym leaders?" he asked Ash with a look of curiosity.

"No, I am a Pokémon coordinator." she told the Professor.

"Ah, yes, I have heard about the Pokémon contests they host in Sinnoh and Hoenn," he began to ponder. "It would be quite interesting to watch one myself."

"Maybe they will start hosting contests here as well," Dawn interjected. "Then you could show your skills to Kanto, right sis?"

"Yeah, that would be great," Ash smiled at her sister.

After that, the conversation returned to the main reason for why Ash and Dawn had come to the Professor's lab. The professor went to a desk a few meters across the room and retrieved two Pokèdexes, one colored red and one colored pink.

"Now, to help you on your journey through the Kanto region, I want to give each of you a Pokédex," he said as he handed Dawn the red one and Ash the pink one.

"Thank you, Professor Oak!" both sisters said at the same time.

"I assume you both already have a Pokémon?", the Professor asked.

"Yes," Dawn told him. "My sister has a Piplup and I have a Chimchar. We both decided that we wanted to start this journey with one Pokémon each, so we left the rest of our teams in the care of Professor Rowan."

"Alright, then I wish both of you the very best on your journey through Kanto," Professor Oak shook both of the girls to send them off on their way.

"Good luck on your journey," Tracey added. "Also, you can always send your Pokémon here in case your team gets too big. We will take good care of them here."

"Thank you, I'm sure you will," Ash replied.

With that, the two twin sisters made their way out of the Professor's lab and headed back towards Pallet Town. As it got progressively darker, they both decided to spend the night at the local Pokémon-Center and start their journey the next day.

They arrived at the Pokémon-Center and were greeted by the once again normal Nurse Joy. Other than the last time though, they now shared a room. So, after they were given their key by the friendly nurse, they headed to their room and made themselves comfortable. Meanwhile, Ash thought about what had happened today. She had turned Dawn, who was in Ash's life and body, into her twin sister Ashley and now they were going to start their journey through Kanto. She didn't know if she could reverse this, but she was intrigued by this new reality and wanted to explore it.

Still, she wondered whether she should stay in Dawn's life or if she should swap back lives and live as Ashley.
13123112112212.title: Don't push buttons

choices: Ash leaves things as they are
Ash tries out one more button
131231121122121.content:
Ash sat on her bed and was talking to Dawn, who was now her twin sister Ashley, wondering what she should do now. She could just swap back lives with her and live as Ashley, but staying as Dawn seemed more interesting to her. Also, she had already challenged all the Kanto gyms in her own life, so it might be interesting to watch her new twin sister do so instead. In the end, Ash decided to keep living Dawn's life and support her sister while she took on the gyms of the Kanto region.

"So, where are we going to head first, sis?" Dawn asked, pulling Ash out of her thoughts.

"I think the gym closest to Pallet Town is in Viridian City," Ash told her sister.

"Then that's where we're going to head tomorrow," Dawn exclaimed. "I can't wait to challenge my first Kanto gym!"

"Alright, sounds like a plan," Ash agreed.

With that, the two sisters got ready to go to bed so they could get a head start on their way to Viridian City. Still, Ash thought about whether she should test out one more button before she went to sleep. She wanted to know what the other buttons did, but she could also just leave things as they are for now and experiment some other time.
131231121122121.title: Ash decides to stay as Dawn

choices: She uses the remote on Misty
She doesn't use the remote on Misty
1312311211221211.content:
Making up her mind, Ash decided that she should leave further experiments for the next day and keep things as they were for now. Thus, just like her sister, Ash laid down on her bed and slowly began to fall asleep.

The next morning, Ash and Dawn got up early, eager to start their Kanto journey. After a small breakfast, they returned their room key to Nurse Joy and left the Pokémon-Center. Their destination set, they made their way out of Pallet Town and followed the path through the surrounding fields. After a while, they entered a forest.

"You think we'll find a few new Pokémon in this forest?" Dawn asked her sister.

"Yeah, I think so," Ash replied. "You're pretty motivated, aren't you, Ashley?"

"I just can't wait to catch my first Kanto Pokémon," Dawn exclaimed. "Hopefully it won't be too long until we find one."

"Don't worry, we'll find one soon," Ash assured her sister.

As if on cue, the two twin sisters heard the rustling of a bush on the side of the path. Turning to face it, they saw a small green and yellow Pokémon poking its head out of the leaves. Using her new Pokédex, Dawn found out this Pokémon was a Caterpie.

"Alright! You are going to be my first catch in Kanto!" Dawn exclaimed, sending out her own Pokémon. "Go, Chimchar!"

"Chim!" it called out, ready to battle.

Upon seeing the fire-type Pokémon, the Caterpie retreated into the bush and fled in the opposite direction. Dawn, not wanting to lose her opportunity to make her first catch, began chasing it with her Chimchar, closely followed by Ash. After chasing the small bug-type for a bit, they ended up losing it at the side of a small river flowing through the forest.

"Seems like we lost it, too bad!" a disappointed Dawn said. "You did a good job anyway, Chimchar. Come back!"

"Char!" it said as it returned to its Pokéball.

"You'll get it next time, Ashley," Ash said, trying to cheer up her sister.

"Thank you, Dawn," Dawn said, smiling at Ash.

"Let's follow the river for a bit," Ash proposed. "It seems like a nicer way through the forest than the path."

"Alright, good idea!" Dawn agreed.

As the two followed the river through the forest, they enjoyed the beautiful scenery while also looking for any wild Pokémon that might be nearby. Not long after, they could see a part of the river bank that was lined by many larger rocks. On one of these rocks sat a girl that Ash was familiar with, at least in her original life. As the two sisters got closer to the rocks, they could see that the girl was dressed in a yellow top and short denim shorts, held by two red suspenders strapped over her shoulders. She wore red and white sports shoes and her orange hair was held up in a side pony tail by a blue hair band. The girl was currently fishing and didn't notice the two sisters until Dawn approached her.

"Hey there, any luck yet?" Dawn asked the girl.

"Not yet, but I haven't been here for too long either so I'm still pretty optimistic," the girl answered.

"That's good to hear," said Dawn. "My name is Ashley and this is my twin sister Dawn."

"Nice to meet you! My name is Misty," she told the two. "By the way, how did you even get here, this place is pretty far off the path."

"My sister wanted to catch a Pokémon, but it ran away and we lost it at the river," Ash told Misty. "We then decided to follow the river and got here."

"Do you mind if we keep you company for a bit?" Dawn asked. "We could really use a break."

"I'd be glad if you did," Misty told the two sisters. "If you want, I have a spare fishing rod you can use."

"Thank you very much!" Dawn smiled at Misty as she handed her her spare fishing rod.

Ash and Dawn sat down on some of the rocks next to Misty, who then explained to Dawn how to use the fishing rod. Once Dawn had successfully cast out the rod, the three began to talk about where they were from and their respective goals. Meanwhile, Ash thought about the remote again. She knew Misty from her original life, so it might be interesting to use it on her instead of her sister. However, she could also just enjoy the time they spent together for now and use the remote another time.
1312311211221211.title: Ash leaves things as they are

choices: Misty is turned into a species of Pokémon
13123112112212111.content:
Ash was curious about what the remote would do with Misty, so she decided to try a new button on her. Getting up from the rock she was sitting on, she took the remote and aimed the remote at Misty, who, like Dawn, was facing away from her as they kept fishing and talking. It seemed like the two were getting along pretty well.

Pressing a random button, Ash wondered what would happen to Misty.
13123112112212111.title: She uses the remote on Misty

choices: She decides not to use the remote
She goes to the Center's lobby to use the remote
131231121122121112.content:
Once Ash had pressed the button, the scene before her had changed drastically. First of all, Misty didn't have any clothes on her anymore and instead of being put up in a side pony tail, her hair now ran down her back freely. She was still sitting on the same rock, but neither she nor Dawn were fishing anymore as there was no sign of the fishing rods or even Misty's bag that had leaned against the rock before. Strangest of all was her interaction with Dawn, though. Before, they had been talking about what they wanted to achieve on their journeys, but now the conversation was something Ash would never have expected.

"You're such a cool Pokémon!" Dawn said with visible excitement. "I have never seen anything like you."

"Mis..." Misty says, slightly embarrassed.

"Do you mind if I check your Pokédex entry?" Dawn asked.

"Ty, Misty," she answered, shaking her head to signify that it was okay if she did.

With that, Dawn pulled out her Pokédex which then displayed an interesting entry.

Misty, the swimmer Pokémon. Type(s): Water.
Mistys are most commonly found near bodies of water where they spend most of their time either swimming or resting near the shore. They enjoy the company of other water-type Pokémon and tend to form close bonds with them, but are rather hesitant towards Gyarados. Conversely, they show a strong aversion towards bug-type Pokémon and will try to keep them at as much distance as possible.

Ash was dumbfounded, she had just turned Misty into her own species of Pokémon. This remote was incredible. Still, she was interested in how Misty and Dawn now interacted with each other. Before the change to reality, the two of them seemed to get along with one another pretty well and it looked like this was still the case in this new one. Their encounter in this reality must have gone similarly to the one Ash remembered, the difference being that they had encountered a Pokémon resting at the riverbank instead of a girl fishing.

"You know, since we get along pretty well, wouldn't you like to join me on my journey?" Dawn proposed to Misty.

"Mis?" she asked, a little surprised.

"I want to challenge the gyms of the Kanto region and compete in the Indigo League and I would love to have you on my team." Dawn told her with a smile on her face. "What do you say?"

"Ty..." she pondered for a moment before making up her mind. "Mis, Misty Mis!"

"Really?" Dawn happily asked before taking a Pokéball from her bag and holding it in front of Misty. "I promise to take good care of you."

"Ty, Mis," she said with a smile as she touched the center of the Pokéball, getting pulled in by the red beam of energy it emitted. The ball wiggled once in her hand before dinging, signaling that Misty had been caught. Dawn looked at the ball in her hand with a smile, then struck a pose to celebrate having caught her first Kanto Pokémon. "Yeah, I caught a Misty!"

Having watched the entire situation unfold, Ash couldn't help but grin at how ridiculous this all was. Her former traveling companion was now a Pokémon, caught by her new twin sister. Seeing the grin on her sister's face, Dawn went over to her and presented the ball containing her newest team member.

"What do you think, Dawn? Didn't I catch a cool new Pokémon?" she asked her sister proudly.

"You sure did, Ashley. Congratulations!" Ash replied.

"What do you say, should we get back on our way to Viridian City?" Dawn proposed.

"Yes, we should. According to my Pokétch we'll be there by tonight." Ash told her sister.

"Alright then, let's go!" Dawn exclaimed as the two were once again headed for Viridian City, now with one more member in their group.

The sun had already set as the two twins reached Viridian City so they quickly made their way to the local Pokémon-Center and got a room for the night. While Dawn made herself comfortable on her bed, Ash pondered whether she should use the remote some more. For now, she didn't want to change her twin, but as there were plenty of possible targets in the Center's lobby she could still experiment to her hearts content.
131231121122121112.title: Misty is turned into a species of Pokémon

choices: On the way to the Viridian City Gym
1312311211221211121.content:
Ash decided against using the remote and, like her sister, made herself comfortable on her bed. Before she went to sleep, however, Dawn had a favor to ask of her.

"Hey Dawn," she began. "Before we go to the gym tomorrow, can we maybe have a training match? I want my Misty to gain some experience before she gets to fight in a gym battle, so I thought she could train with your Piplup."

"Sure, Ashley." Ash agreed, incredibly curious to see Misty fight in a Pokémon battle. "I believe there is a battleground behind the Pokémon-Center, we can go there after breakfast tomorrow."

"You're the best, sis!" Dawn smiled at her sister. "I can't wait for tomorrow!"

"Me neither," Ash smiled back at her sister as both of them went to sleep, eagerly awaiting their training match.

The next morning, Ash and Dawn got up early and made their way to the Pokémon-Center's lobby to eat breakfast. Once they were done eating, the two quickly made their way to the battleground and went to their respective positions at the sides of the field. Ready to battle, they reached for their Pokéballs and sent out their Pokémon.

"Alright, Piplup, it's your turn!" Ash called out as she sent her Piplup into battle.

"Pip!" it said as it proudly stood on the field.

"Misty, I choose you!" shouted Dawn as she sent out her Misty.

"Misty Mis!" she said, ready for her first battle with her trainer.

Both sisters looked at each other with a confident expression on their faces as they started the battle. "Let's go!"

"Okay Misty, let's start off with Water Gun!" Dawn instructed her Pokémon.

"Ty!" Misty said as she shot a stream of water from her mouth at her opponent.

"Quick, dodge to the left and use Peck!" Ash shouted.

Barely avoiding the attack, Piplup did as his trainer said and charged at Misty, his beak starting to glow white. Not giving Misty the time to dodge, he landed his attack, causing her to fall back a little.

"Hang in there, Misty!" Dawn called out to her. "Use Double slap now that Piplup is close!"

"Misty!" she yelled as she approached the smaller Pokémon, her hands glowing like Piplup's beak did before.

"Use Bide!" Ash said as Piplup took the hits from Dawn's Misty, getting ready to retaliate. Once Misty began to back off from her attack, Piplup charged at her. "Piplup Pip!"

"Jump over the attack!" Dawn shouted, her Misty able to jump at the last second and avoiding the attack thanks to her significant height advantage. "That was a close one! Now, use Water Gun!"

"Ty!" she said as she once again shot a stream of water from her mouth, this time hitting Piplup and causing it to stagger a little.

"Piplup, no!" Ash yelled, her Piplup now an easy target.

"Let's finish this with another Double Slap!" Dawn shouted confidently.

"Misty!" Dawn's Misty charged at her staggering opponent, landing another Double Slap. Ash's Piplup was sent flying, landing a few meters from Misty with a dazed look on his face. He was unable to battle, Misty had won.

"We won! Great job Misty!" Dawn cheered, running over to her Pokémon.

"Mis Misty!" she smiled as she hugged her trainer, happy to have won her first battle.

Ash walked over to her Piplup, helping it sit back up and congratulating it on doing a great job despite not ending up winning. The disappointed Pokémon was quickly cheered up and both trainers returned their Pokémon to their Pokéballs.

"That was a great battle," Dawn said to her sister. "Thank you for training with me before taking on the gym."

"You know I'm always happy to help you, Ashley," Ash told her.

With their training match finished, the two sisters headed back to the Pokémon-Center to get their Pokémon back to full health. After that, they could finally head to the Viridian City Gym.
1312311211221211121.title: She decides not to use the remote

choices: On the way to Viridian Forest
13123112112212111212.content:
After Nurse Joy had taken care of their Pokémon and they were once again fighting-fit, Ash and Dawn were on their way to the Viridian City Gym.

"Are you ready for your first Kanto gym battle?" Ash asked her sister.

"You bet!" Dawn replied enthusiastically. "After our battle with you and your Piplup, both me and my Misty can't wait to get our first badge."

"And I'll be sure to cheer you on," Ash gave Dawn a supporting smile.

"You're a huge help, Sis," Dawn returned the smile and the two sisters continued on their way to the gym.

The Viridian City Gym was easily spotted as Ash and Dawn closed in on their destination. Once they reached the gym, however, they immediately noticed a sign attached to its closed front door.

The Viridian City Gym is currently closed as the position of Gym Leader is unoccupied. Challenges will be accepted again once a new Gym Leader has been found. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

Ash was surprised. Last time she was in Viridian City, Agatha had taken over the role as Gym Leader until they found a new one. It seemed as though they still hadn't found anybody for the position though, and as Agatha couldn't fill in permanently due to her status as a member of the Elite Four, they had to temporarily close the gym.

"You can't be serious!" a disappointed Dawn shouted out. "I wanted to get my first gym badge!"

"It can't be helped," Ash told her sister. "You'll just have to challenge another gym. As far as I know, the closest gym aside from this one is in Pewter City."

"Then we'll head to Pewter City!" Dawn decided with determination. "There I'll really get my first badge."

"Sure thing, Sis," Ash agreed as the two began heading towards Pewter City. "We'll need to cross Viridian Forest though. You might want to keep your Misty in her Pokéball because there are many bug-type Pokémon there."

"Yeah, you're right," Dawn nodded. "But Chimchar can handle them easily."

With that, Ash and Dawn made their way towards Viridian Forest, their first waypoint on their way to Pewter City.
13123112112212111212.title: On the way to the Viridian City Gym

choices: She uses the remote on Viola
She doesn't use the remote on Viola
131231121122121112121.content:
Ash and Dawn had been wandering through Viridian Forest for a while now, still not having encountered any new Pokémon. Both sisters were slightly disappointed by this, having hoped to find a few additions to their teams. It didn't take much longer, however, until the two finally spotted something a little off the path.

Sitting behind a bush next to a small clearing was a woman with blonde hair, dressed in a white top with green trousers and brown boots. The camera she was holding was pointed at a tree in the center of the clearing where the twins spotted a Butterfree searching for berries. Trying not to disturb either of them, they slowly and quietly made their way over to the woman. A sudden clicking sound caused by the camera broke the silence of the scene and they could see the Butterfree flying away from the tree and back into the forest. Looking at her camera, the smile the woman made showed that the picture she had taken was a good one.

"Did the photo turn out well?" Ash asked her.

"Yes, I can't wait to display it in my gallery," the woman answered.

"Your gallery?" Dawn asked.

"Let me introduce myself," the woman began friendly. "My name is Viola, I am the Gym Leader of Santalune City in the Kalos Region. I am also a passionate photographer, so I set up a gallery at my gym where I display my photos."

"Nice to meet you, Viola," Dawn replied. "My name is Ashley and this is my twin sister Dawn. We're from Twinleaf Town in the Sinnoh Region."

"Nice to meet you too," Viola said with a smile.

"Did you come here all the way from Kalos to take pictures of Pokémon?" Ash asked curiously.

"That's right," she explained. "I specialize in bug-type Pokémon and Viridian Forest is widely known for being home to many different kinds of bug-types."

"Could we maybe take a look at some of the pictures you took?" Dawn asked.

"Of course," Viola agreed. "I'm always happy to share my pictures with others."

As Dawn went over to Viola to take a look at the pictures she had taken, Ash thought about using the remote again. It had been a while since she last used it and Viola seemed to be an interesting target. In the end, she had made her decision.
131231121122121112121.title: At Viridian Forest

choices: Viola is turned into a species of Pokémon
1312311211221211121211.content: Having decided to use the remote again, Ash aimed it at Viola, making sure to not accidentally hit her sister. Pressing one of the buttons, she was eager to see the result.
1312311211221211121211.title: She uses the remote on Viola

choices: On the way to Pewter City
13123112112212111212112.content:
After Ash had pressed the button, a scene similar to when she had used the remote on Misty unfolded before her. Like Misty, Viola now had no clothes on her, but her hair still looked the same. Instead of her camera, she now showed a colorful object to Dawn, who looked at it with amazement.

"Wow, this looks beautiful," she said as she waved for her sister to come closer to them. "Take a look at this, Dawn!"

As Ash walked over to them, she saw that the object was made from various berries and flowers and that it shone a little as it was hit by the sunlight reaching through the trees.

"You're right, this looks amazing," she agreed with her sister and looked at Viola. "Did you make this?"

"Vi, Viola!" she nodded happily, glad that the two trainers liked her creation.

"Let's see what the Pokédex can tell us," said Dawn as she pulled out her Pokédex. Not long after, it displayed the entry they were looking for.

Viola, the Artist Pokémon. Type(s): Bug.
Violas can create a clear, glue-like liquid from their saliva which is among the strongest adhesives currently known. They use this liquid to encase and preserve various berries and flowers, arranging them into colorful artworks. The strength of the adhesive makes them incredibly robust, but it can be dissolved again if they apply more of their saliva. Violas love presenting their creations to both people and Pokémon.

"The Artist Pokémon?" Ash began. "With how good your artwork looks, that description definitely fits."

"Vi Vi!" Viola cheered at the praise.

"Hey Dawn," Dawn approached her sister. "You should ask her if she wants to come with you. I bet she would do great in a Pokémon Contest."

"That's a great idea, Sis!" Ash said and turned towards Viola. "Would you like to come with me, Viola? I want to become a Top Pokémon Coordinator and would be very happy if you wanted to join us. You could also show everyone your creations when we compete in contests together. I'm sure they will all love them."

"Viola, La!" Viola happily nodded, excited at the prospect of showing her creations to a larger audience.

"Alright! I'll take good care of you, Viola," Ash said as she took a Pokéball from her bag and held it in front of Viola. Like with Misty before, Viola pressed the center of the Pokéball and was quickly pulled in by the red beam of energy it sent out. After shaking once, it made the familiar sound that indicated that the Pokémon had been caught. Excitedly striking the same pose her sister did, Ash celebrated having caught her first Kanto Pokémon of this life. "Yeah, I caught a Viola!"

"Congratulations, Dawn!" Dawn said, still holding the artwork Viola had presented them earlier. "Now we both have our first Kanto Pokémon."

"Thank you, Ashley!" Ash replied with a smile. "I can't wait to compete in Contests with her."

"And I can't wait to watch your performances," Dawn said, then gave her sister the artwork Viola had shown them earlier. "Here, you should have this. This was made by your Pokémon after all."

"Thanks, I will carry this with me as a memory of how we met Viola," Ash told her.

With a new member to their group, Ash and Dawn continued their journey to Pewter City, where Dawn would challenge her first gym in the Kanto Region.
13123112112212111212112.title: Viola is turned into a species of Pokémon

choices: On their way to Mount Moon
131231121122121112121122.content:
Ash and Dawn had finally made their way out of Viridian Forest and arrived in Pewter City. After a short stay at the Pokémon-Center where Nurse Joy returned their Pokémon to full health, the twins were on their way to the Pewter City Gym. As they approached the gym, Dawn got increasingly excited for her battle.

"Finally, my first Kanto Gym Battle!" she said excitedly.

"You've got this, Ashley!" Ash motivated her sister.

"Thanks for the support, Sis," Dawn smiled at Ash as they entered the gym.

Entering the gym, Ash and Dawn immediately noticed the battlefield at the center of the large room. Unlike the one in Viridian City, this field was very rocky with large boulders spread all over it. Across the battlefield, they saw somebody sitting atop a small stone pedestal. He had spiky brown hair and wore an orange t-shirt under a green vest as well as brown trousers and gray shoes. Seeing the two girls enter his gym, he stood up and introduced himself.

"Welcome to the Pewter City Gym," he began. "My name is Brock and I am the Gym Leader."

"I am Ashley, and this is my twin sister Dawn," Dawn introduced herself as well. "I am here to challenge you to a battle."

"Alright, I accept your challenge," Brock said. "Is this your first Gym Battle?"

"Here in Kanto, yes," Dawn replied.

"In that case, we will both be fighting with two Pokémon each," he told her. "Are you ready?"

"Yes," she nodded as she headed to her position at the end of the battlefield. While Brock and Dawn got ready for their battle, Ash headed to the stands at the side of the field. With everybody on their positions, the two opponents started their battle. "Let's go!"

"Geodude, it's your turn!" Brock called out as he sent out his first Pokémon.

"Geodude!" it said as is came out of its Pokéball.

"Let's do this, Misty!" Dawn shouted as she sent out her own Pokémon.

"Misty Mis!" she said, ready for battle.

"I see, you have a water-type Pokémon," Brock noted. "A good choice against my rock-types. But it takes more than just type advantage to win a battle. Geodude, use Tackle!"

"Geo!" the rock-type charged at Misty.

"Quick Misty, jump!" Dawn instructed her Pokémon.

"Mis!" like in her battle against Piplup, her height advantage helped her jump over the attack at the last second.

"Good, now follow up with Water Gun!" Dawn called out.

Still in the air, Misty spun around and fired a Water Gun from her mouth at her opponent. "Ty!"

Unable to dodge it, Geodude was hit by the super effective attack "Geodude!"

"No, Geodude!" Brock yelled as his Pokémon found itself in a tight spot.

"And now finish it with Double Slap!" Dawn shouted as her Misty landed.

"Misty!" Misty's hands began to glow as she charged at her opponent. Landing the two hits of her attack, she sent Brock's Geodude flying into the nearest boulder. A dazed look on it's face, it was unable to battle.

"Well done, Misty!" Dawn praised her Pokémon as there now was only one Pokémon left to beat.

"Keep it up, Misty!" Ash cheered from the stands. "You can do this!"

"Okay Geodude, return," Brock said as Geodude was pulled back into its Pokéball. "Your Misty is a really good fighter."

"Thank you," Dawn said as she gave a confident smile. "We trained hard, together with my sister and her Pokémon."

"I can see that, but you still haven't won. There's one more Pokémon you have to beat," Brock said as he reached for his second Pokéball. "Go, Onix!"

"Onix!" the huge Pokémon towered over the field as it was sent out.

"Now, start with Tackle!" he instructed his Pokémon.

"Misty, jump!" Dawn yelled as Brock's Onix charged at her Misty.

Dawn's Misty was barely able to avoid the attack, but unlike before, her opponent was prepared.

"Not this time! Onix, use Wrap!" Brock had predicted what his opponent was trying and knew how to react. The airborne Misty was an easy target as Onix grabbed her with its tail, trapping it in its tight grip.

"Miiiiis!" the trapped Pokémon cried out.

"Misty, no!" Dawn yelled as Onix tightened its grip on her Pokémon.

"Doing the same thing twice makes your opponent able to react to it," Brock lectured his challenger. "Now your Misty is unable to move."

Dawn had to think fast. If she didn't come up with a strategy quickly, her Misty would lose the battle. Suddenly, she had an idea.

"Misty, use Rain Dance!" she called out to her Pokémon.

"Misty Ty!" Misty yelled. Her arms not constrained by Onix's grip, she formed a light blue sphere between her hands and launched it at the ceiling. As clouds began to form under the gym's roof, it started to rain, irritating Onix just enough for it to loosen its grip on Misty. Using her chance, Misty freed herself and positioned herself before her opponent.

"A clever idea," said Brock as he looked at the clouds. "But it won't be enough. Onix, use Tackle!"

"Dodge!" Dawn shouted as the large Pokémon came charging at Misty, who was once again able to dodge the attack. This time, however, she was much quicker than before and was able to avoid ending up in Onix's grab.

"Now use Water Gun!" Dawn followed up as she saw that her Pokémon was free to attack.

"Ty!" Misty fired a stream of water from her mouth, this one being more powerful than the one that hit Geodude.

"Onix, no!" Brock shouted as his Pokémon was hit by the attack. Realizing what was happening, he turned to Dawn. "So your Misty has the ability Swift Swim. She gets faster and her water-type moves increase in strength in the rain."

"She is the Swimmer Pokémon after all," Dawn answered. "And now, we're going to finish this battle!"

"Misty!" her Misty agreed, ready to take down her opponent.

"We'll see about that," Brock answered. "Onix, get her with Wrap!"

As Onix charged at Misty, she once again dodged the attack, circling it and getting behind it at incredible speed.

"Well done Misty!" Dawn yelled. "Now finish it off with Water Gun!"

"Ty!" Misty shouted as she fired one final stream of water at her opponent. As it got hit by the stream, Onix began to tumble and finally collapsed on the battlefield, unable to battle.

"We did it Misty, we won!" Dawn cheered as she ran to her Pokémon and hugged it tightly.

"Mis, Misty Mis!" Misty joined her trainer's cheers, proud of how she had done.

"Ashley, Misty, congratulations!" Ash called out to the two victors, running over to them from the stands.

After recalling his Onix into its Pokéball, Brock made his way to the celebrating trainers. Reaching out his hand, he presented the reward for beating the Pewter City Gym Leader.

"That was a great battle, you two have truly earned the Boulder Badge." he said as he handed the badge to Dawn. "You and your Misty are a great team and I hope that you will do just as good on the rest of your journey."

"Thank you, Brock!" Dawn happily said as she accepted the badge.

"Now that you have the Boulder Badge, you should probably head towards Cerulean City," Brock suggested. "I think challenging this gym next would be a good idea."

"Alright then, now we know our next destination, right Misty?" she asked her Misty.

"Misty!" she nodded in approval before being returned to her Pokéball to rest.

"Good luck on your journey, Ashley," Brock said with a smile, then turned towards Ash. "And good luck to you too, Dawn."

"Thank you!" Ash smiled.

With that, Ash and Dawn left the Pewter City Gym. Having won her first gym badge, Dawn was looking forward to challenging the other gyms of the region. Their next destination in mind, their journey continued.
131231121122121112121122.title: In Pewter City

choices: Ash uses the remote on them
Ash doesn't use the remote on them
1312311211221211121211221.content:
After leaving the Pewter City Gym, Ash and Dawn made their way to the Pokémon-Center to have Nurse Joy take care of Misty. Once Misty returned from the nurse's care, they were planning eating together with all their Pokémon. However, that meant that they first had to get Misty to be more comfortable around Ash's Viola. It took the two trainers a while, but they finally managed to get Misty to sit at the same table as Viola. On opposite sides, of course.

The group enjoyed their break as they all happily ate, Ash and Dawn sharing a plate of rice balls while their Pokémon each had their own bowl of Pokémon food. As they were eating, Viola tried interacting with Misty who was still rather hesitant, but over time got more comfortable around the bug-type Pokémon. It seemed as though the two Pokémon slowly grew closer with one another.

With their meal finished, the two twins returned their Pokémon to their Pokéballs and went back to the Pokémon-Center lobby. There, they noticed a poster on the wall next to the reception. As they got closer to the poster, they saw that it was advertising the underwater ballet of the Cerulean City Gym Leaders.

"Are you also interested in the underwater ballet?" they heard as two girls approached them.

The first girl was dressed in a dark gray top with a white collar and a red skirt as well as black stockings and shoes. Her honey-blonde hair reached down to her shoulders, covered by a dark pink hat with a black bow. Next to her stood a girl with tan skin, her brown hair kept in curly pigtails. She wore a dark pink T-shirt with three black bows at the front, fairly small denim shorts with black frills at the bottom and pink heeled shoes.

"We just noticed the poster," Dawn replied. "But it does look interesting, right Dawn?"

"Yes, it does," Ash agreed. "We're headed to Cerulean City anyways, so we could definitely go watch it."

"Would you mind if we joined you on the way there?" the brown-haired girl asked. "It should be fun if we traveled as a group."

"Sounds good to me," Dawn told the two, then turned to Ash. "What about you, Sis?"

"I would like that too," said Ash.

"Great, I'm happy to hear that," the honey-blonde girl smiled. "My name is Serena, and this is my friend Shauna. We're both Pokémon performers from the Kalos region."

"Nice to meet you, I'm Ashley and this is my twin sister Dawn. We're from the Sinnoh region," Dawn introduced herself and her sister. "While my sister is a Pokémon coordinator, I want to challenge the gyms of the Kanto region and compete in the Indigo League."

"So, you came all the way from Kalos to watch the underwater ballet in Cerulean City?" Ash asked the girl that had introduced herself as Serena.

"In part, yes," Serena began. "We want to travel through the Kanto region to find inspiration for new elements to include in our showcases."

"What about you, Dawn?" Shauna asked Ash.

"I mainly want to support my sister on her journey," Ash told her. "But I also want to find many new Pokémon that I can compete in contests with."

"Say, could you tell me a bit about Pokémon showcases?" a curious Dawn asked. "I haven't really heard about them before."

"Sure thing," Shauna agreed as the two Kalosians began telling Dawn about Pokémon showcases.

Meanwhile, Ash thought about using the remote again. The two girls seemed to be interesting targets, but she could also just leave the remote aside for now and enjoy the journey with them normally.
1312311211221211121211221.title: Resting at the Pokémon-Center

choices: Serena and Shauna get new professions
Serena and Shauna are turned into species of Pokémon
13123112112212111212112211.content: Having decided to use the remote on the two trainers they had encountered, Ash pressed a button on the remote and waited to see the result.
13123112112212111212112211.title: Ash uses the remote on them

choices: On their way to Mount Moon
131231121122121112121122112.content:
As soon as she had pressed the button, Ash once again saw that her targets weren't wearing any clothes anymore. Other than her last uses of the remote, however, there were now more visible changes to be noted.

While Serena's loose pony tail was now held together by a small ring of fire, Shauna's hair had taken on a slightly more green shade and had small leaves growing out of it. Ash was a little surprised by this, wondering if this might happen more in the future.

Seeing that the remote had done its work, she walked over to her sister and the two former trainers. Instead of being told about Pokémon showcases, Dawn was now gently stroking Shauna's head. Ash soon did the same for Serena, the two new Pokémon visibly enjoying this.

"You two are very pretty Pokémon," Dawn said as she stroked Shauna's head.

"Shauna Na!" she said with a joyful smile.

"You are definitely right about that, Sis," Ash agreed with her sister, stroking Serena's head.

"Se Serena!" Serena said, leaning her head to the side a little.

Curious about the changes that had taken place, Ash reached for her Pokédex and looked for their entries.

Serena, the Treat Pokémon. Type(s): Fairy, Fire.
Serenas are very kind Pokémon that use their fire abilities to create sweet treats to share with other Pokémon. This makes them very popular with cafés and bakeries, where you can often order their creations. They value their appearance highly, resulting in fiery outbursts if they get dirty. Serenas often form close bonds with Shaunas and love joining their performances.

Shauna, the Performer Pokémon. Type(s): Fairy, Grass.
Shaunas are cheerful Pokémon that often stage performances for other wild Pokémon, creating intricate and colorful costumes from flowers and foliage. In battle, their strong spirit makes them capable fighters, especially when protecting those close to them. Shaunas often form close bonds with Serenas and enjoy helping them create their sweet treats.

"But where is your trainer?" Dawn asked, looking around the lobby. "As far as I can see, there is no one here besides us."

"They don't have a trainer," Nurse Joy approached them, having overheard their conversation from the reception. "They are wild Pokémon that live here in the Pokémon-Center."

"Really? How long have they lived here now?" Ash asked the friendly nurse.

"They've been here for quite a while now," Nurse Joy continued her explanation. "A few trainers have offered to take them with them on their journeys, but they always refused as none of them wanted to take both of them. They're pretty much inseparable."

"I can't believe these trainers would be willing to separate the two," Ash fumed.

"But you two are the first trainers they approached by themselves," Nurse Joy told them. "I think they want to come with you."

"Is that true?" Dawn asked Shauna.

"Sha!" Shauna nodded with a bright smile.

"Rena!" Serena happily agreed.

"We'll gladly take you with us," Dawn told the two of them with a smile. "Which one of us do you want to join?"

The two Pokémon, already having made their decisions, walked towards the trainer they wanted to travel with. Serena decided to join Ash's team, while Shauna wanted to join Dawn's team.

"Are sure you don't want to both join one of us?" Ash asked the two fairy-types. "You would be on the same team then."

"Serena Na!" Serena nodded happily.

"Shauna Sha!" Shauna also nodded, her decision final.

"Well, with us being sisters, it's pretty unlikely that they will ever get separated for long." Dawn reasoned.

"Then I will gladly welcome you on my team, Serena," Ash told her, taking a Pokéball from her bag and holding it in front of her.

"I'm also happy to have you on my team, Shauna," Dawn said as she too held a Pokéball in front of Shauna.

Both Pokémon happily pressed the center of the Pokéballs and got pulled inside by the red beam of energy. After shaking once in their hands, the balls signaled that the two Pokémon had been caught. Excited to have new members on their teams, the two twins shared a happy grin.

"I'm happy that the two of them have finally found trainers that will keep them together," Nurse Joy said as she smiled at the two trainers. "I can see that they're in good hands now."

"Thank you, Nurse Joy," Ash replied.

With their two new Pokémon in tow, Ash and Dawn said goodbye to Nurse Joy and set out on their way to Cerulean City, where Dawn was going to challenge her second Kanto gym.
131231121122121112121122112.title: Serena and Shauna are turned into species of Po...

1312311211221211121211221121.content:
Ash and Dawn had left Pewter City and were now on their way to Cerulean City, where Dawn wanted to get her second Kanto badge. Both of them now had three Pokémon on their teams and were looking forward to finding new members for them. As they walked through the forest towards Mt. Moon, which marked the midway point on the route to Cerulean City, the two sisters talked about their new Pokémon.

"I'm glad to have Viola and Serena on my team now," Ash beamed. "I can't wait to enter a contest with them!"

"The same goes for me, Sis," Dawn replied. "Misty already did great in the Pewter Gym, together with Chimchar and Shauna the other gyms better watch out!"

"You know, Ashley, with Shauna on your team you could also compete in contests," Ash suggested.

"You think so?" Dawn asked.

"Yeah, she's the Performer Pokémon after all," Ash told her. "I'm sure you could put on some great performances."

"Well, if my sister wants me as a rival for her contests, I'll be sure to be tough competition." Dawn joked.

"We'll see about that," Ash retorted.

The two twins shared a laugh as they continued to joke around a bit more. They continued their conversation as they got closer to Mt. Moon, both sisters hoping to find new Pokémon to add to their teams.

14123312.content:
After pressing the button a white light shot out of the remote and engulfed Misty. After awhile the flash faded and she stood there confused.

„Are you ok Misty?” - Ash asked, concerned about the well being of his friend.

„I suppose so, but that experience wasn’t that spectacular as I originally suspected it would be.”

Ash stood there confused. He didn’t remember Misty ever saying a sentence as complicated. She wasn’t stupid, but her manner of speech was rather simple.

„You sure that this remote didn’t do anything to you? You sound weird speaking like that.”

Misty frowned at Ash annoyed.

„I have no idea why are you choosing to base your assumptions of the manner of my speech, which was consistent throughout our adventures, but that’s your uneducated choice to make”.

Her mild anger soon passed as she saw Ash's Pikachu looking as confused as his trainer. She moved toward him and squatted with a face full of adoration.

„I have no idea why I never noticed that glorious fact, but your Pikachu’s raw power is magnificent. Did you know that in Alola a plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant? Doesn’t this sound like a marvelous idea for increasing the Alolan power grid effectiveness?".

„Pika?” - said Pikachu bewildered from hearing all that word salad coming out of Misty’s mouth.

"And now you sound like a Pokedex!" - Ash exclaimed - "Hold on Misty! I'm going to figure out how to help you!" - said young trainer as he started to fiddle with the remote.

Ash tried his best to remember which button he pressed, but all of them looked the same. The labels were written in an unknown language so he couldn’t distinguish individual functions and didn’t want to try anything else because it could worsen the situation.

While Ash was busy trying to figure out how the mysterious device works, Misty got up.

„Ash, I appreciate the supposed help I desperately need, but can we proceed to the Pallet Town already? I urgently want to meet the famous Professor Oak and ask him a few distinctive questions.”

As soon as she finished the sentence her jean shorts started to expand downward until they transformed into regular jeans. Shortly afterward, just as fast as before those jeans changed into khaki pants. Yellow crop top she was wearing did the same, but horizontal. Buttons appeared all over, changing it into a yellow, long-sleeved, buttoned shirt. Her physique also got thinner and more scrawny.

„Oh no! It’s getting worse!” - Ash said ignoring Misty's question and still holding the remote, hoping that the right answer will come to him sooner or later on its own.

The changes continued as her suspenders and sneakers lost their original color and became brown. Brown, dotted bow-tie appeared under the chin. Her short, side ponytail broke loose as her hair grew slightly longer and became a little more greasy. Freckles, that had the same color as her hair, started to appear one by one on her face. At last, she reached to her shirt pocket and pulled out the case which held her glasses. Misty put them on naturally like she was doing that every day. The black, square rimmed frames fitted her round face nicely.

Ash stood there shocked with his mouth in agape. He couldn’t believe that the device was powerful enough to change a person so drastically.

"What's the matter, Ash? Do any unwanted piece of material got in my hair?" - said Misty in a slightly more high pitched voice.

151131.content:
Ash picked up the remote and took a closer look at it and noticed that it had many buttons that were all different colors. Not knowing any of their functions, he randomly pressed the blue button.

In the blink of an eye, Ash felt very different. His perspective had shifted slightly downwards and he noticed weight in areas were there had been none before, namely his chest and the back of his head, and yet other parts of his body felt lighter. Irritated by the new sensations, Ash took a peek at his chest and was shocked to see two mounds on his formerly flat chest. Taking a hand to his chest to confirm whether this was actually real, he noticed his now smaller, feminine hands and the lighter and smoother skin that now covered them. Upon seeing these changes, Ash got a suspicion of what had happened and needed to confirm it. He reached behind his back and felt... hair, a lot of it. This was enough to confirm his suspicion, he had actually turned into Serena. Then it dawned on him, there was one area of his body he still had to check for changes. Not daring to look, he pulled his hand away from his hair and slowly moved it towards that part. Once he reached it, realization hit him, now her, like a ton of bricks: she was actually female now.

Finally managing to look downward again, she notices that, oddly enough, she was still wearing her own clothes, only re-sized for Serena's, now her, body. Looking back at where Serena was standing, Ash saw that she, now he, was in her original body, wearing Serena's clothes re-sized for Ash's body. However, it seemed that Serena was completely oblivious to what was going on as she was still talking to Clemmont, who also seemed not to notice anything. Seeing this, Ash came to the realization that this remote could alter reality. By pressing that button, Ash and Serena had swapped bodies and reality was adjusted.

Ash was amazed at the power the remote in her hands held and was eager to see what she could do with it. Thinking back, she remembered that when she pressed the button, she was aiming the remote in Serena's direction, so this must be how the target is selected.

Ash wasn't sure how she should go on from here. Unfortunately, she couldn't remember which button she pressed to swap with Serena, so if she wanted to swap back, she had to guess.

As the button is pressed, Ash finds himself downstairs in the kitchen, wooden spoon in his hand cooking as he hears a familiar male voice scream from upstairs, As Ash goes to run to the voice he trips over, Looking down he can see why, he'd never worn a skirt before, specially not one this tight as he see's his moms white pumps on his feet as he panics.

"Hey mom, something weirds going on" Ash/now Delia calls as he see's himself walking down the stairs with a packed bag.
"What? where are you going?" The new Delia asks as Ash sits down.

"Ash do you know how worried sick I am all day, you never call or message, so this time it's your turn to worry" As the new Ash jumps up

"PIKACHU" he calls as his partner runs over and runs on his old bodies shoulder as they both leave together, as Ash/now Delia sits there dumbfound.
